title: IT Project Manager
description: About the jobIT Project Manager At fiskaltrust, we specialize in providing seamless fiscalization solutions that integrate effortlessly with existing POS systems, ensuring secure and compliant transaction processing for businesses across Europe. Our mission is to simplify the complexities of fiscal compliance, enabling our clients to focus on their core operations with confidence. With a presence in multiple European countries and a commitment to transparency and innovation, we empower our partners and clients to navigate the evolving fiscal landscape effectively.  Position Overview:  We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented IT Project Manager to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and finalizing internal IT projects that enhance our operational efficiency and support our mission. Your hands-on approach will be crucial in managing resources, timelines, and stakeholder communications to ensure successful project outcomes. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Execution: Lead projects from initiation to completion, ensuring they meet business requirements and are delivered on time and within budget. Stakeholder Collaboration: Act as the primary liaison between internal departments, to ensure clear communication and alignment throughout project lifecycles. Hands-On Involvement: Engage directly with project tasks as needed, demonstrating a hands-on mentality to drive project progress and resolve issues promptly. IT Service Management: Apply fundamental IT Service Management (ITSM) principles to enhance service delivery and support processes, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives. Risk and Issue Management: Identify potential project risks and issues, developing mitigation strategies and facilitating timely resolution to minimize impact on project objectives. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate project documentation, including plans, status reports, and post-project evaluations, to ensure transparency and knowledge sharing within the organization.  Qualifications: Proven experience in IT project management, preferably within the fintech or compliance sectors. Strong understanding of IT Service Management (ITSM) frameworks and best practices. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving and task execution. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively with diverse stakeholders. Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies. Fluency in English; additional European languages are a plus.  What We Offer: A collaborative and supportive work environment that values innovation and transparency. Opportunities for professional growth and development within a leading fintech company. The chance to contribute to projects that have a significant impact on businesses across Europe. Competitive compensation and benefits package.  For legal reasons, we would like to point out that the minimum gross salary for this position, based on the Austrian IT collective agreement, is ‚Ç¨3,843 per month on a full-time basis (38.5 hours per week), which corresponds to ‚Ç¨53,802 gross per year. Depending on your qualifications and experience, we offer a competitive and market-aligned salary that may significantly exceed this minimum.If you are passionate about driving IT projects to success and thrive in a hands-on, collaborative setting, we invite you to apply for the IT Project Manager position at fiskaltrust.

title: [Full Remote] Junior Data Scientist & AI (‚Ç¨50k-‚Ç¨80k)
description: About the jobOur goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,000,000 users come true!We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals who aspire to join our team around Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a role in this area becomes available and your CV matches the profile we are seeking.For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: ‚Ç¨50k-‚Ç¨80k) in the EMEA Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.--Responsibilities:Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.--What We Offer:Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.--Who We Are:Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.Our community includes over 1,000,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we‚Äôre growing fast‚Äîjoin us!--Contract & Compensation:For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: ‚Ç¨50k-‚Ç¨80k).Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.--Selection Process:CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.--Why Join Our Team?Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

title: Product Manager - Meta Group with verification
description: About the jobVio.com believes travel is the one thing that opens minds to new ideas, cultures, and ways of thinking. Our mission is to get every traveler the best accommodation deal, worldwide. From adventure travel and backpacking to honeymoons and family vacations, we genuinely care so that every traveler can make the best-informed accommodation choice at the absolute best conditions for every trip.We are looking for a Product Manager to join our Meta group and lead key cross-team initiatives that power the core systems at Vio.com. You will play a central role in shaping and executing initiatives that span infrastructure, data, and machine learning ‚Äî owning products that are deeply technical, API-based, and data-driven. These initiatives have a direct impact on both our internal teams and end-user experience and are essential to scaling our platform with speed and reliability..What You Will DoOwn key cross-team initiatives from definition to execution and iterationDefine KPIs and ensure that the product meets its goals, both quantitative and qualitativeDefine and prioritize the roadmap for our products, aligning across multiple teams and stakeholdersDiscover new features, define enhancements, write requirements, prioritize, and lead the squad with clear and well-articulated ‚Äúwhat‚Äù based on an inspiring ‚Äúwhy‚ÄùTranslate complex, ambiguous challenges into clearly scoped initiatives that deliver concrete outcomesCollaborate closely with other product managers, analysts, engineers, data scientists, and leadership to align priorities and ensure group-level strategy is translated into impactful workBe a hands-on PM: dive into data, write and run SQL queries, read documentation, QA features, and debug with engineers when neededWho You AreYou preferably hold a BSc or MSc in Computer Science or another technical field or have experience as a data analyst, developer/engineer or data scientistExtensive experience working for a product company in relevant roles. the most recent of which is within Product ManagementYou have experience working in high-performing cross-functional teams that have built and deployed large scale backend services and machine learning based productsYou have a successful track record of shipping applications and servicesYou know how to work with data, utilize it, and enable your product to produce itYou know how to inspire, motivate, and support a team to get things doneYou know how to influence decision-making at all levels within an organization and in a variety of contextsWhy join us now?We are one of the fastest-growing accommodation booking platforms in the world today, having grown our bookings 30x between 2017 and 2022, and catering to the needs of over 100 million unique visitors worldwide each year. We do that by harnessing the power of advanced algorithms and an innovative suite of power features and managed to overcome the corona crisis remarkably fast;The mobile applications (iOS and Android) we launched in 2023 are already a big success in the US, and we are aiming at 10M global app installs by the end of 2024, as we are beginning to build Vio.com as the brand for value-seeking travellers worldwide;We are a passionate and diverse team of tech enthusiasts and creatives with a commitment and focus on the traveler above all else - and it shows in our industry-leading TrustPilot score;We place huge importance on rewarding our employees for the value they generate by giving Stock Appreciation Rights to all employees.Check vio.com/careers for a detailed job description and company benefits.

title: Principal Engineer - Core Platform - 100% Remote Europe with verification
description: About the jobNOTE: This is a FULLY remote role, but the candidate must be within the EMEA region to collaborate with their team, peers, and internal customers. You do not have to be in the specific country or city shown in this listing, but please only apply if you are physically based within Europe.Hostaway is the market-leading SaaS scale-up transforming the vacation rental industry. With innovative solutions and partnerships with giants like Airbnb, VRBO, and Booking, we're taking on the competition and winning. Leveraging our customer-centric core values, we consistently deliver results that encourage growth, learning, and innovation for our team, our customers, and the industry.As a profitable and growing company, this role is necessitated by our continued growth. Check out more about our recent funding round of $365 million here.About the roleOur platform powers a global customer base, handling millions of transactions, integrating with industry giants like Airbnb & Expedia, and driving the future of short term rental tech. With $365M recently invested, we‚Äôre scaling fast‚Äîbreaking down our monolithic architecture, designing for next-level scalability, reliability, and innovation.As Principal Engineer, you'll be at the heart of this transformation, shaping how our platform evolves to support hundreds of integrations, complex workflows, and a rapidly growing customer base. If solving deep complex engineering challenges at scale excites you, let‚Äôs talk.Job requirements10+ years of experience in software development, with at least 4 years in a leadership roleExpert-level proficiency in a Backend programming language, we use PHPHands-on experience with completing the transition to microservices architectures and Domain-Driven DesignStrong understanding of both relational (MySQL) as well as no-SQL data stores (like DynamoDB or ElasticSearch), data modeling and optimization techniquesKnowledge of containerisation technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Fargate) and the associated ecosystemExperience with event-streaming platforms like Kafka or KinesisExtensive experience with AWS services and cloud architectureProven track record of leading and mentoring cross-functional engineering teamsExperience with Agile methodologies and CI/CD practicesSolid understanding of software design patterns and architectural distributed computing principlesExperience with working in SaaS product companiesNice to have skills for this role:Experience with front-end engineering (e.g., ReactJS, NextJS, TailwindUI and similar)Experience with performance monitoring and optimisation toolsUnderstanding of security best practices in web applicationsExperience with scalability challenges in high-growth environmentsKnowledge of machine learning and AI conceptsExperience with infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation)The ability to exert Extreme Programming values & techniques to the teamAn Average Day for a Principal Engineer 10:00-10:15 Quick team stand-up, one of your team members seem to be working on a problem you worked on before, and offer to pair with them after the stand-up to support10:30-14:00 Pairing with one of your team members to work on a complex scalability issue together and grabbing a quick bite to re-fuel those pesky braincells in-between coding sessions!14:00-15:00 Doing a design session with the Product Manager and UX designer for a large upcoming feature that the team should pick up next week. You ask a lot of questions to drill down to the problem we are trying to solve, and suggest some easier solutions that require less effort for the team.15:00-16:00 The design session triggered some thoughts about other areas of the system that will be affected. You‚Äôre doing a quick dive in the affected areas of the code and find some technical debt that might affect the system‚Äôs scalability or reliability. You create a brief Jira ticket and tag the Product Manager to help get it prioritised and to ensure it is not forgotten. You also ping the ticket to one of the other domains' tech leads, as you recall them mentioning a similar problem existing in another domain team.16:00-16:30 Quick catch-up with the Engineering Manager on the teams delivery reliability and how you can help keep Work in Progress (WIP) and Pull Request (PR) review time to a minimum.16:30-18:00 Talking about PR‚Äôs, there are actually still a few open. You take the last part of the day to review your teams PRs. There are some great solutions offered, but one of the junior engineers introduced some code that is difficult to maintain and is lacking unit tests. You jump on a quick call with them to explain the issues and why it matters.What we offerCompetitive Compensation: We offer competitive pay based on market rates in the country of the applicant.100% Remote: Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere within your country of residence‚Äîbe it a co-working space, your home office, or even your dining room table. The choice is yours. Just don‚Äôt ask to work in our office (we don‚Äôt have one).Equity: Every role in our company comes with valuable stock options in a fast-growing and profitable company. This ensures we all share in the company‚Äôs success.Values-Driven Leadership: Our Core Values are not just words we‚Äôve written to make us feel good. We leverage them daily when making strategic and tactical decisions.Professional Growth: Our rapid growth offers unparalleled learning and development opportunities, along with a multitude of career advancement opportunities.Annual Paid Leave: The specific amounts vary by country and are aligned with country and/or contract-specific norms.Geographic Specific Benefits: As an international employer, we offer different country-specific benefits such as Health Insurance and Pensions in countries where these perks are customary. The specifics depend on the country of the applicant.Dynamic Team Culture: As a global company with team members in over 40 countries, our diverse and international culture fuels our innovation and creativity, providing a key pillar to our success (and making it a lot of fun to work here).Thank you for your interest. If you apply for this role, you will receive an email from our Talent Acquisition team after your application has been reviewed alongside the qualifications for this role and the qualifications of others who have applied.

title: Senior Data Engineer - 100% Remote EMEA with verification
description: About the jobNOTE: This is a FULLY remote role, but the candidate must be within the EMEA region to collaborate with their team, peers, and internal customers. You do not have to be in the specific country or city shown in this listing, but please only apply if you are physically based within the EMEA region.Hostaway is the market-leading SaaS scale-up transforming the vacation rental industry. With innovative solutions and partnerships with giants like Airbnb, VRBO, and Booking, we're taking on the competition and winning. Leveraging our customer-centric core values, we consistently deliver results that encourage growth, learning, and innovation for our team, our customers, and the industry.As a profitable and growing company, this role is necessitated by our continued growth. Check out more about our recent funding round of $365 million here.Hostaway is seeking a highly motivated Senior Data Engineer to join our team and drive our growth in the market.Your MissionYou will be leading the design and implementation of our Data Engineering practice, providing robust, scalable, and cloud-native data infrastructure to fuel analytics across Hostaway.Our Data Engineering team is focused on providing a unified data model that powers our RevOps, Product Analytics, and FinOps teams with the ability to do and build their own analytics.Key ResponsibilitiesArchitect, build and maintain scalable data pipelines and ELT/ETL processes using modern DAG orchestration toolsBuilding out and establishing our data transformation framework using dbtEnsuring a central data repository exists for consumption from our different analytics teamsBe a proactive, communicative, and trustworthy partner to both analytics and engineering stakeholdersEstablish and enforce data governance standards to maintain high-quality, trustworthy data assets and ensure reporting consistencyAbility to independently design and deploy cloud infrastructure required for the Data domainRequirements5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track record of designing and implementing scalable data solutionsExpert-level SQL skills, with the ability to write, optimize, and debug complex queries.Extensive experience with dbt and the best-practices for building, structuring, and testing code-first transformations using PythonStrong experience with operating in a git-first environment and automating workflows using CI/CD pipelinesProven experience building and maintaining production-grade DAG-based pipelines orchestration like Airflow or DagsterIn-depth knowledge of building ETL and ELT pipelines using FivetranStrong experience with streaming data architectures and (near) real-time data processing, using the Google Cloud data ecosystemDeep understanding of Google BigQuery services for big dataNice to haveFamiliarity with DevOps infrastructure-as-code tooling like Terraform to provision cloud resourcesHands-on experience integrating data from Sales and Marketing platforms, such as Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo, or OutreachWhat we offerCompetitive Compensation: We offer competitive pay based on market rates in the country of the applicant.100% Remote: Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere within your country of residence‚Äîbe it a co-working space, your home office, or even your dining room table. The choice is yours. Just don‚Äôt ask to work in our office (we don‚Äôt have one).Equity: Every role in our company comes with valuable stock options in a fast-growing and profitable company. This ensures we all share in the company‚Äôs success.Values-Driven Leadership: Our Core Values are not just words we‚Äôve written to make us feel good. We leverage them daily when making strategic and tactical decisions.Professional Growth: Our rapid growth offers unparalleled learning and development opportunities, along with a multitude of career advancement opportunities.Annual Paid Leave: The specific amounts vary by country and are aligned with country and/or contract-specific norms.Geographic Specific Benefits: As an international employer, we offer different country-specific benefits such as Health Insurance and Pensions in countries where these perks are customary. The specifics depend on the country of the applicant.Dynamic Team Culture: As a global company with team members in over 40 countries, our diverse and international culture fuels our innovation and creativity, providing a key pillar to our success (and making it a lot of fun to work here).Thank you for your interest. If you apply for this role, you will receive an email from our Talent Acquisition team after your application has been reviewed alongside the qualifications for this role and the qualifications of others who have applied.

title: Solutions Architect with verification
description: About the jobAt Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That‚Äôs why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you‚Äôre looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain.We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways. Are you curious about being part of our growth story while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation. As a Solutions Architect, you will play a pivotal role in guiding our clients through the technical evaluation of our digital solutions. Working closely with engineering, sales, and project services, you will serve as a trusted technical and strategic advisor. Your responsibilities include presenting our product's value proposition, understanding client architectural landscapes, and effectively communicating both technical and business aspects.What will you doCollaborate with Sales Executives to achieve strategic goals and advance deals to closure.Prepare for client meetings by coordinating with Sales Execs, Professional Services, Partners, and other stakeholders to present a coherent path to success.Conduct value-based demonstrations, focusing on technical solutions aligned with clients' business challenges.Lead in-depth discovery sessions with empathy to understand client needs and qualify solutions and services.Become a subject matter expert in relevant areas and provide advisory consulting services to fellow Solutions Architects and colleagues.Engage with strategic accounts to build customer relationships and expand our footprint in products and services.Deliver presentations to various stakeholders, including technical, business, and C-Suite participants.Respond to RFPs, RFQs, and create proposals for clients.What you will bringBachelor's or Master's degree in a related field.Numerous years of experience in Pre-Sales consulting or Professional Consulting services.Passion for winning technical aspects of deals and ensuring long-term customer success.Understanding of ECM, BPM, App-Dev, and AI/ML concepts with the ability to articulate to non-technical clients.Knowledge of deployment architecture, including cloud and on-premises solutions.Effective written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to build presentations and facilitate customer discussions.Familiarity with major cloud Infrastructure providers such as AWS and GCP.Knowledge of Low-Code platforms, IDP, and software development tools (e.g., Java and Python) is a plus.Discover what we offerDiscover Limitless Possibilities: Embark on an exciting journey with Iron Mountain, a global organization that embraces transformation and innovationEmpowering Inclusion: Join a supportive environment where everyone's voice is heard, opinions are valued, and feedback is encouraged, fostering an atmosphere of inclusion and belonging.Global Connectivity: Connect with 26,000+ talented individuals from 59 countries, opening doors to diverse cultures and fostering global learning opportunities.Championing Individuality: Be part of a winning team that celebrates diversity and encourages individual differences to drive greatness.Competitive Total Rewards: supporting your career at Iron Mountain, family, personal wellness, and wellbeing. (Local benefits may vary based on country-specific policies.Embrace Flexibility: Experience the freedom of remote/hybrid work, enabling a harmonious work-life balance (dependent on role)Unleash Your Potential: Access abundant opportunities for personal and professional growth, preparing you for a digitalized futureValuing Every Contribution: Join a workplace that actively encourages and supports all talents, recognizing the unique impact of each individualPioneering Sustainability: Contribute to our vision of fostering a sustainable and thriving workforce, leaving an enduring legacy for generations to come

title: IT Developer - Automation & APIs (Work From Home)
description: About the jobPersona is the company top startups use to hire people from all around the world. Our vision is a future where each person can find the best role for them and companies can discover the world‚Äôs best talent. Founded by two Stanford University graduates, Persona works with the world‚Äôs fastest-growing technology startups. Our clients are funded by some of the world‚Äôs top investors, like Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, and Andreessen Horowitz.Persona is a talent agency that recruits, trains, and staffs talented remote professionals such as yourself. This is an opportunity to work closely with the future Googles, Facebooks, and Amazons of the world‚Äîbuilding out their organizations and helping them reach the next level of success.We support everyone we hire with training, mentoring, and technology resources so they are enabled to do their best and are as happy as possible in their roles. We have a large international team dedicated to supporting and taking care of new Persona team members, and our goal is to provide excellent long-term career opportunities for everyone who joins the team.Who‚Äôs building Persona?We are a global team of passionate problem solvers who love to build new things and make our customers happy. Our team is made up of motivated, hard-working people spanning the globe, united by a culture of learning and continuous improvement.What we‚Äôre looking for:We are looking for an IT Developer to design, implement, and optimize automation solutions, APIs, and database systems. This role requires expertise in C#, Python, Microsoft JScript, and familiarity with automation tools like UiPath and Selenium. The ideal candidate will have experience developing and managing RESTful APIs, handling database operations, and ensuring efficient background job processing.Responsibilities‚Äîwhat you'll do:Develop automation workflows to streamline processes and improve system efficiency, utilizing tools such as UiPath and Selenium.Build and maintain RESTful APIs, ensuring seamless communication between applications using ASP.NET 6+ and Entity Framework.Manage database interactions, including creating, modifying, and optimizing data retrieval processes, stored procedures, and transactions in Microsoft SQL Server.Implement background job processing to automate repetitive tasks and optimize system performance through HangFire.Write and refine SQL queries to ensure efficient data operations and improve overall database performance.Test and debug APIs to ensure reliability and functionality using tools such as Postman.Utilize version control systems like GitHub to manage code repositories, track changes, and collaborate effectively with the development team.Diagnose and resolve technical issues, ensuring smooth operation of automation scripts, APIs, and databases.Create and manage validation rules and macros using JScript to enforce data integrity and optimize automation processes.Requirements:Proficiency in C#, Python, and Microsoft JScript.Hands-on experience with UiPath, Selenium, and HangFire for automation and job scheduling.Strong background in REST API architecture and system integrations.Expertise in Microsoft SQL Server, including stored procedures and CRUD operations.Familiarity with Postman for API testing and troubleshooting.Experience with GitHub for managing and tracking code versions.Ability to work U.S. business hours (Pacific Time, Central Time, or Eastern Time)This position is for serious, career-oriented candidatesOther qualities we look for:Ability to collaborate with teams and explain technical concepts effectively.Analytical skills to troubleshoot and enhance system performance.Ability to solve complex problems with minimal guidanceIntellectual curiosity and resourcefulnessProfessionalismWhat we offer:Best salaries in the industryPermanent ability to work from anywhere in the worldOpportunities for growth and advancementA fast-paced and collaborative environmentWarm and friendly company cultureFull benefitsBenefits at Persona:Health insuranceUnlimited paid time off (paid sick and vacation leaves)Annual bonuses based on performanceMonthly tech allowanceOpportunity to be paid in your currency of choiceOthers depending on seniorityThis is a full-time and long-term role, dedicated exclusively to serving one of our clients. We are looking for individuals who are ready to fully commit their time and energy to one company and grow and develop along with that company. All roles at Persona are 100% work-from-anywhere (work from home or wherever it suits you best). If this is your first time working for a U.S. company, that‚Äôs okay; we provide guidance and assistance getting set up as a remote professional. Once hired, we will carefully match you to a client company of ours that perfectly suits your career background, skills, and goals.In case you or any exceptional people you know are exploring other roles, our rapidly growing company is also looking for new team members with backgrounds in administration, bookkeeping, accounting, finance, project management, operations, recruiting, human resources, content writing, social media management, research, executive assistance, customer service, customer support, technical support, data management, video editing, sales, account management, marketing, and design.Visit our website for more information: https://www.personatalent.com/

title: Full Stack Developer (Work From Home)
description: About the jobPersona is the company top startups use to hire people from all around the world. Our vision is a future where each person can find the best role for them and companies can discover the world‚Äôs best talent. Founded by two Stanford University graduates, Persona works with the world‚Äôs fastest-growing technology startups. Our clients are funded by some of the world‚Äôs top investors, like Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, and Andreessen Horowitz.Persona is a talent agency that recruits, trains, and staffs talented remote professionals such as yourself. This is an opportunity to work closely with the future Googles, Facebooks, and Amazons of the world‚Äîbuilding out their organizations and helping them reach the next level of success.We support everyone we hire with training, mentoring, and technology resources so they are enabled to do their best and are as happy as possible in their roles. We have a large international team dedicated to supporting and taking care of new Persona team members, and our goal is to provide excellent long-term career opportunities for everyone who joins the team.Who‚Äôs building Persona?We are a global team of passionate problem solvers who love to build new things and make our customers happy. Our team is made up of motivated, hard-working people spanning the globe, united by a culture of learning and continuous improvement.What we‚Äôre looking for:We are looking for a Full Stack Developer with expertise in Next.js, TypeScript, Django, and AI-powered search. This role involves developing intelligent web applications that enhance project and content management with AI-driven semantic search capabilities. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing web applications with AI/ML integration. You will work across the frontend (Next.js, TypeScript) and backend (Django, Python) to build secure, high-performance applications. This role requires strong problem-solving skills, experience in web security, and a passion for AI-driven solutions.Responsibilities‚Äîwhat you'll do:Build and maintain scalable, AI-enhanced web applications using Next.js (React), TypeScript, and Django (Python).Implement AI-powered semantic search to improve content organization and retrieval.Develop RESTful and GraphQL APIs for seamless frontend-backend communication.Ensure application security best practices to protect user data.Optimize performance and scalability for high-traffic web applications.Implement authentication, authorization, and data encryption protocols.Use Git for version control and manage CI/CD pipelines for automated deployments.Conduct unit, integration, and end-to-end testing to ensure code reliability.Debug and troubleshoot complex frontend and backend issues.Work closely with product managers, designers, and AI engineers to deliver intelligent search and content solutions.Stay up to date with AI/ML advancements, web security, and modern web development practices.Contribute to code reviews, documentation, and best practices for continuous team improvement.Requirements:3+ years of full-stack experience developing modern web applications.Expertise in Next.js, React, TypeScript, and Django (Python).Experience integrating AI/ML models into web applications.Strong knowledge of RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and backend development.Proficiency in web security best practices (OAuth, JWT, CSRF protection).Experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and cloud deployment.Familiarity with PostgreSQL, Redis, or other databases.Fully fluent in EnglishAbility to work U.S. business hours (Pacific Time, Central Time, or Eastern Time)This position is for serious, career-oriented candidatesOther qualities we look for:Prior experience with AI-powered search technologies is a plusPassionate about AI/ML and how it enhances user experience.Problem-solving mindset with a focus on innovation and performance optimization.Proactive and self-driven, able to work independently in a remote environment.Strong collaboration skills, working across multiple teams (product, AI, security).Familiarity with serverless computing and containerized applications.Strong understanding of scalability and distributed systems.An ability to solve complex problems with minimal guidanceIntellectual curiosity and resourcefulnessProfessionalismWhat we offer:Best salaries in the industryPermanent ability to work from anywhere in the worldOpportunities for growth and advancementA fast-paced and collaborative environmentWarm and friendly company cultureFull benefitsBenefits at Persona:Health insuranceUnlimited paid time off (paid sick and vacation leaves)Annual bonuses based on performanceMonthly tech allowanceOpportunity to be paid in your currency of choiceOthers depending on seniorityThis is a full-time and long-term role, dedicated exclusively to serving one of our clients. We are looking for individuals who are ready to fully commit their time and energy to one company and grow and develop along with that company. All roles at Persona are 100% work-from-anywhere (work from home or wherever it suits you best). If this is your first time working for a U.S. company, that‚Äôs okay; we provide guidance and assistance getting set up as a remote professional. Once hired, we will carefully match you to a client company of ours that perfectly suits your career background, skills, and goals.In case you or any exceptional people you know are exploring other roles, our rapidly growing company is also looking for new team members with backgrounds in administration, bookkeeping, accounting, finance, project management, operations, recruiting, human resources, content writing, social media management, research, executive assistance, customer service, customer support, technical support, data management, video editing, sales, account management, marketing, and design.Visit our website for more information: https://www.personatalent.com/

title: Junior People Advisor - Austria (m/f/d) with verification
description: About the jobWe‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading sports technology company, at the intersection between sports, media, and betting. More than 1,700 sports federations, media outlets, betting operators, and consumer platforms across 120 countries rely on our know-how and technology to boost their business.Job DescriptionOVERVIEW:As we continue to grow, we're looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Junior People Advisor to join our People Team in Austria. You will play a crucial role in managing HR operations with a particular focus on payroll preparation. This role requires a keen eye for detail, a passion for data accuracy, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Furthermore, you will support end-to-end People matters, including for example local implementations of global People initiatives, Culture, Values and Engagement agendas, compliance for all global policies and local law / policies, local learning and local leadership and employees coaching/guidance.THE CHALLENGE:Payroll for Vienna and Linz: Drive and fully own the payroll cycle for both Austrian offices, Vienna and Linz. Prepare the payroll for the external payroll provider while considering being SOX compliant through the whole process (from preparation to payout).Employee Relations: Serve as admin and assist Senior PA Manager for employee relations matters, including conflict resolution, disciplinary actions, and grievances. Provide guidance to managers and employees on HR policies, procedures, and employment laws to ensure compliance and maintain positive employee relations.Local Admin: Support the creation of employee contracts as well as other employee-related necessary documents and keep employee records up to date and compliant with GDPR. Act as subject matter expert internally and liaise internally with Legal and externally with immigration teams on relocation support, including immigration matters where applicable.Onboarding and Offboarding: Support the onboarding and offboarding physically and administratively for any new employee on location, working closely with line manager, talent acquisition team and responsible divisional partner. Support the immigration and relocation process and ensure related documents are up to date.Compliance, HR Policies: Stay up to date on country, state, and local employment laws and regulations. Ensure HR policies, procedures, and practices are following relevant legislation. Partner with Compliance and Risk to ensure employee data integrity as well as relevant trainings are implemented.Local Strategy and People data: Support the adaption and implementation of the relevant and selected People Strategic initiatives locally in alignment with Divisional People Partners and CoEs. Ensure local initiatives on Talents, Learning & Development are implemented. Keep quarterly KPIs, Joan and RTO reporting.Culture and values: Partner with the local Functional Leaders to understand, translate business needs into the relevant actions when comes to people, culture and organization, including local values activation plans and Hybrid working.Engagement, CSR and Diversity Equity Inclusion: Drives engagement, CSR and DEI activities locally. Support the implementation of initiatives to enhance employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention. Identify ways to engage on-site employees. Partner with the relevant stakeholders.Global Projects: Actively participate in various global projects for your further professional and personal development and for enhancing the collaboration across the wider People team.YOUR PROFILE:Bachelor¬¥s degree in HRM or related field, or experience equivalent.Minimum of 2 years of progressive HR experience (first experience with payroll preparation is considered as a plus).First knowledge of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations specific to the countryPassionate about HR operations and accuracy in data.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in HRIS systems, Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel), and other relevant HR software applications.Customer in centricity, high-level communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.German and English fluent; Additional languages considered a plus.OUR OFFER:Attractive challenge in one of the world's fastest growing sports media/tech companies with great development opportunities.Generous mobility offer (e.g. job/climate ticket, parking garage or subsidy for bicycles/ Firmenradl)Centrally located office with in-house padelcourt, in-house gym, table tennis, darts, table football, air hockey and billiards.Gym Benefit (monthly support for fitness memberships).Health offers, such as annual medical screening checks, mental health offers etc.Language trainings (German and English classes).Subsidized massages every Monday as well as Yoga/Pilates classes.Fresh fruit and pastries, free coffee, tea and milk.Food subsidy in Europe's largest canteen.Team activities (happy hours, running community, sports tournaments etc.).The minimum monthly salary for this position is according to Collective Bargaining Agreement, overpayment will be considered depending on qualifications and working experience.Buckle up, hold on tight and get ready for an incredible adrenaline-rush throughout this exciting ride with us: #maketheteam and shape your future as well as ours!Additional InformationAt Sportradar, we celebrate our diverse group of hardworking employees. Sportradar is committed to ensuring equal access to its programs, facilities, and employment opportunities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We encourage you to apply even if you only meet most of the requirements (but not 100% of the listed criteria) ‚Äì we believe skills evolve over time. If you‚Äôre willing to learn and grow with us, we invite you to join our team!

title: STAFF / PRINCIPAL ANALOG / MIXED-SIGNAL DESIGN ENGINEER (M/F/D)
description: About the jobYour missionAs an experienced "Staff/Principal Analog/Mixed-Signal Design Engineer (m/f/d)", you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the development of our innovative products. Join our team in Germany / Mannheim or Austria / Villach (hybrid or full remote work) and drive the advancement of high-speed data interfaces. Your expertise will be instrumental in creating products that exceed our customers' expectations. We prioritize top-notch design quality, timely delivery, and a strong customer-centric approach.Own analog/mixed-signal and digital/full-custom building blocks and subsystems.Complete design and implementation of analog/mixed-signal and full-custom circuits, including schematics, testbenches and simulation.Collaborate with system architects in block level specification derivation.Work with the verification team in model creation.Work with the layout team to guide physical implementation.Provide guidance and possibly lead smaller design sub teamsOrganize and participate in the design review process.Work closely and cross-functional across different groups to support a successful and on-time product release.Your profileB.S./M.S. degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related subject with emphasis on hardware design.A min. of 10 years work experience, including internships.Experience on circuit design in the field of high speed SerDes design or some related functionality (PLLs, Rx or Tx analog frontends, high speed digital full custom logic).Experience in mixed signal designs incorporating digital control loops.Worked in advanced process nodes is a plus (FDSOI, FinFET).Being familiar with the Cadence design flow and full-custom EDA tools, in particular Virtuoso Schematic/Layout, ADE Assembler and Spectre.Script programming languages such as Python and TCL are a plus.Good written and oral communication skills in English.Our X-FactorFlexibility: We offer attractive flexible working hours, above-average vacation days, a worktime account, and the possibility of mobile working (hybrid work or remote work) so that you can balance your personal life and your job. Competitive Salary: You will receive a competitive salary based on your qualifications and skills. Job Security: You will have a secure job in a financially stable company. Career Opportunities: With the right commitment, you can advance your career with us, as your development, further training, and success are important to us. Team Events: We offer team events and the opportunity for regular exchange. Workation: Combine your vacation with your work abroad in the form of a "workation" for up to six weeks per year. Great Work Atmosphere: We are a company with a strong value orientation and a really good work atmosphere, as well as appreciation in dealing with each other, cooperation, trust, and mutual support (btw: there is also a football table, gaming events, tournaments, and free drinks #smile).For applicants from Austria:  We provide attractive salaries and additional benefits tailored to your performance, experience, and qualifications. The employment terms comply with the collective agreement for Information Technology employees, specific to employment group ST2 (Kollektivvertrag). You will receive your monthly salary 14 times a year. Depending on your expertise and skills, higher compensation is also available.LocationRheinvorlandstra√üe 5, 68159 Mannheim, GermanyTech-Center, Europastra√üe 8, 9524 Villach, √ñsterreichWe also offer remote work from Greece, Italy, Austria, and Germany. Do you live in another EU country? Try applying anyway or be ready for a relocation: we will support you. If you come from a country outside the EU, we will help and assist you with the entire visa process. ContactYou want to unleash the chiplet age with us? If so, we look forward to your application as "Staff / Principal Analog / Mixed Signal Design Engineer (m/f/d)". Good to know: CV only! In the first step, your CV is sufficient for an initial application. You can simply send us your further references and certificates later. What matters to us is your personality. Do you have any questions? Then simply contact us: careers@extoll.com Please use the email address only for requests. We look forward to your application via our quick & easy job platform: Jobs at EXTOLL GmbH We look forward to working with you!About usWe Unleash the Chiplet Age - with you! We, at EXTOLL, are a leader in state-of-the-art High-Speed Serializer-Deserializer (SerDes) IP and interconnect technologies for semiconductor chips. Our cutting-edge solutions support the next generation of products for our international customers. We create essential and eXcellent tech. Together with our customers we are shaping the next era of the semiconductor industry - chiplet technology. For this we need you!What makes us an eXcellent company are our employees. We are proud of our open, creative working atmosphere, of colleagues who support each other and of our really eXciting projects. Become part of our internationally positioned team. Our head office is in Mannheim / Germany, near Heidelberg, in the Rhine-Neckar metropolitan region. We are growing and we are also looking for new team members in Villach / Austria and in Greece / Remote.

By establishing quality gates and automating manual processes, you will increase the reliability of our services.Job DescriptionDevelopment and maintenance of cloud infrastructure for the future of e-commerceSolving extensive DevOps tasks in a motivated developer teamIntroduction and further development of modern SRE practicesBuilding the future cloud infrastructure for applicationsOptional: On-call services (PagerDuty) within your teamQualificationsProfessional experience as a DevOps engineerKnowledge of the cloud environment (preferably GCP) is an advantageKnowhow in the field of logging & monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, EFK Stack)Expertise in container virtualization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)Experience in Infrastructure As Code (Terraform)Experience in pipeline configuration (GitLab)Experience with Java Spring and database management (Postgres) is an advantageVery good comprehension as well as communication and team player skillsSelf-responsibility, organizational and coordination strengthAdditional InformationLong-term, interesting and varied work for a reliable employer in a supportive teamA family-friendly company culture with flexible working hours and remote working options available according to your individual needsNumerous training and further development opportunities within the Group (5% of working time for self-organized training and education)Staff shopping and travel discountsEasy public accessAn industry-standard, attractive and performance based annual gross salary starting at 60,000 Euro (on a full-time basis) with the possibility of higher pay according to experience and qualificationsNo matter where you are in your career, we have a path for you. Whether you‚Äôre looking for your first job, advancement in your field, or a new career shift. We‚Äôre proud to employ great people who are passionate about their jobs. But they‚Äôre all different. No matter who you are, what you need and where you‚Äôre going, REWE Group can be a part of it. Apply now!Please upload your resume to give us insight of your work experience - anonymously if you like!We promote a diverse and inclusive work environment. Therefore, we welcome applications from people of different gender, age, cultural or social background, sexual identity and applications from people with disabilities. In addition, we would like to increase the proportion of women in technical professions and are particularly pleased to receive applications from women for this position.

description: About the jobHuawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Driven by a commitment to operations, ongoing innovation, and open collaboration, we have established a competitive ICT portfolio of end-to-end solutions in Telecom and enterprise networks, Devices and Cloud technology and services. Our ICT solutions, products and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. With 180,000 employees, Huawei is committed to develop the future information society and build a Better-Connected World.Huawei's Munich Research Center is responsible for advanced technology research, architectural development, design and strategic engineering of our products.The Advanced Wireless Technology Laboratory is responsible for beyond-5G research and prototyping on topics related to vertical industry use cases. In particular, we perform research, participate in industrial associations and standard bodies in the areas of next generation mobile communication system.Now We Are Looking For AnIntern for Design and Implementation of Multi-Agent Systems in Next-Generation Mobile Networks (m/f/d)Your missionDesign and development of multi-agent systems using the existing open-source frameworks (e.g., CrewAI, Autogen, LangGraph etc.) for use cases relevant for next-generation mobile networksDesign and implement multi-agent communication mechanisms between AI agents and evaluate their advantages and disadvantages in practical deployment scenarios.Identify potential requirements for native integration of AI agents in future telecommunication systems based on the insights gained throughout implementation and system architecture design.Collaborate closely with colleagues from science and engineering backgrounds on research topics involving agentic AI, machine learning, wireless communications, and computer networking.RequirementsUniversity student pursuing a BSc or MSc degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or other related disciplines with top performance. Good knowledge of computer networking, machine learning, and recent developments in agentic AI.Hands-on experience in popular open-source LLMs (e.g., GPT-3, Llama) and prompt engineering. Having solid programming skills in programming languages that are widely used in existing multi-agent frameworks is strongly preferred (e.g., Python).Fluent in Business English. Having peer-reviewed scientific publications is a plus.By applying to this position, you agree with our RECRUITMENT PRIVACY STATEMENT. You can read in full our recruitment privacy statement via the link below.https://career.huawei.com/reccampportal/portal5/grcprivacy.htmlWhat You Can ExpectOur culture is characterized by innovative power and team spirit as well as the intensive exchange of knowledge and experience within our global network.We offer you a competitive compensation package and a broad range of training opportunities. Many online and face-to-face training programs.Self-responsible work in a competent, motivated and constantly growing team.If you are enthusiastic in shaping Huawei's Munich Research Center together with a multicultural team of highly skilled Engineers and Researchers, feel free to contact us. Driving future technologies focused on the customer experience is our main mission. Apply now!Please send your application and CV (incl. cover letter and reference letters) in English.Department Advanced Wireless Technology & ESID Laboratory Locations Munich

description: About the jobAls eins von 76 Instituten und Forschungseinrichtungen der Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft, der f√ºhrenden Organisation f√ºr angewandte Forschung in Europa, zeigen wir, wie man Krisen nicht nur meistert, sondern an ihnen w√§chst. Mit unserer angewandten Forschung zu Circular Economy, Carbon Management, Green Hydrogen und Local Energy Systems leisten wir konkrete Beitr√§ge zum Erreichen der 17 Sustainable Development Goals der Vereinten Nationen. Unsere Mitarbeitenden forschen in den Bereichen Energie, Umwelt, Sicherheit, Gesundheit, Kommunikation und Mobilit√§t.M√∂chtest Du zu nutzbringender und sinnvoller Forschung beitragen? Das Ziel Deiner Masterarbeit ist es, die Genauigkeit des Systems zur Erfassung von Ver√§nderungen bei Sekund√§rmetaboliten w√§hrend des Pflanzenanbaus mithilfe der Raman-Spektroskopie zu verbessern.Was Du bei uns tustLiteraturrechercheAnbau der optimalen Pflanzensorten f√ºr den VersuchNachweis der Pflanzenteile mittels Raman-SpektroskopieExtraktion von Sekund√§rmetaboliten aus PflanzenAnalyse des Raman-SignalsWas Du mitbringstStudium im Bereich Biologie, Agrarwissenschaften, Umwelttechnik oder UmweltingenieurwesenErfahrung in der Planung strukturierter ExperimenteKenntnisse der Datenanalyse (R oder Python)Grundkenntnisse der OptikInteresse am Bereich Indoor Farming/Vertical FarmingSehr gute EnglischkenntnisseWas Du erwarten kannstMitarbeit auf Augenh√∂he sowie die M√∂glichkeit, deine Kenntnisse aus dem Studium mit praktischen Erfahrungen an der Schnittstelle zwischen Wirtschaft und Wissenschaft zu verkn√ºpfen und eigene Ideen einzubringenNew Work, Diversity und ein kooperatives Miteinander sind klare Bestandteile unserer strategischen AusrichtungFlexible Arbeitszeiten ‚Äì wir wissen, dass das Studium vorgeht Flexible Arbeitsorte, die zu Deinem Studium passen ‚Äì mobile Arbeit und Arbeit vor Ort werden je nach Bedarf kombiniertVielseitige Unterst√ºtzung bei der Anfertigung Deiner AbschlussarbeitGesundheits- und Achtsamkeitsprogramme f√ºr einen guten AusgleichNoch mehr attraktive Benefits findest Du hier: Fraunhofer UMSICHT als Arbeitgeber Wir wertsch√§tzen und f√∂rdern die Vielfalt der Kompetenzen unserer Mitarbeitenden und begr√º√üen daher alle Bewerbungen ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identit√§t. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.Die w√∂chentliche Arbeitszeit betr√§gt 39 Stunden. Die Verg√ºtung richtet sich nach der Gesamtbetriebsvereinbarung zur Besch√§ftigung der Hilfskr√§fte.Mit ihrer Fokussierung auf zukunftsrelevante Schl√ºsseltechnologien sowie auf die Verwertung der Ergebnisse in Wirtschaft und Industrie spielt die Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft eine zentrale Rolle im Innovationsprozess. Als Wegweiser und Impulsgeber f√ºr innovative Entwicklungen und wissenschaftliche Exzellenz wirkt sie mit an der Gestaltung unserer Gesellschaft und unserer Zukunft.Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt online mit Deinen aussagekr√§ftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!Wir m√∂chten Dich darauf hinweisen, dass Bewerbungen ausschlie√ülich √ºber unser Karriereportal entgegengenommen werden. title: Senior Applied AI Engineer - MLOps
description: About the jobCyberTide GmbH is seeking an experienced Applied AI Engineer specializing in MLOps to join our team. This role involves deploying, fine-tuning, and optimizing large language models (LLMs) for cloud and on-premises environments, with a strong focus on efficiency.What You will doDeploy and manage AI and LLM models across various platforms including AWS, Azure, GCP, and on-premises infrastructure, with a preference for Azure.Enhance model performance using advanced techniques such as parameter-efficient fine-tuning (e.g., LoRA, QLoRA).Implement AI model inference frameworks like vLLM to improve speed and efficiency.Apply advanced prompt engineering techniques and principles to improve model outputs.Ensure AI models are designed to enhance user experience and address end-user needs effectively.Collaborate with clients to deliver tailored technical solutions, translating customer requirements into effective AI approaches.Collaborate closely within a small, agile startup team, where your ideas and expertise will have a direct impact. Exhibit strong communication skills to articulate concepts clearly and contribute meaningfully across diverse functions.Your ProfileAt least 3 years of experience in machine learning engineering, with a minimum of 1 year working specifically with LLMs, prompt engineering, deployment, and operationalization.Ability to work legally in Germany on a full-time basis. Unfortunately, we do not offer visa sponsorship.Proven experience deploying and managing AI models in production environments.Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.Familiarity with the Hugging Face ecosystem, including Transformers library and Model Hub. Contributions to the Hugging Face community or experience with Hugging Face Spaces is a plus.Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.Proven experience in deploying and managing solutions across major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) as well as on-premises infrastructure.Sufficient knowledge of AI model inference techniques and frameworks, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for enhancing contextual understanding and response generation.Fluent in English. German or French language skills are preferred, as they align with our target market.Ability to continuously learn and adapt cutting-edge techniques to enhance model performance and deployment efficiency.Thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where rapid iteration and efficient delivery are essential to success, ensuring consistently high-quality results within tight deadlines.BenefitsCompetitive salary and equity package.Opportunity to work in a cutting-edge AI startup tackling real-world data security challenges for leading organizations in regulated industries, empowering them to securely unlock AI capabilities.Remote-friendly environment.Direct collaboration with the founders, providing substantial ownership over projects and the potential to take on a leadership role as the company grows.About CyberTideCyberTide GmbH is an AI startup based in Berlin, Germany, specializing in AI-native data security solutions. Our mission is to empower organizations to safeguard their sensitive data through innovative, efficient, and scalable AI technologies. As a part of our team, you will work on challenging projects, contributing to the development of state-of-the-art solutions that address critical security needs across various industries.Join CyberTide and help us shape the future of AI-driven data security solutions!

title: Senior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
description: About the jobThis is a full-time, hybrid position based in Berlin.ResearchGate is the professional network for scientists and researchers. We provide scientists with the help and support they need by connecting them to the world‚Äôs most active scientific community.We've built a platform that gives the world's scientists the tools and services they need to connect, collaborate, and advance their research. Over 25 million members from 193 countries use ResearchGate to share, discover, and discuss research.Objective of the RoleOur Data Platform Engineering team is crucial to our success in working with data. You help us maintain, shape and enhance our data infrastructure to enable innovation across all data functions. By keeping data flowing through our pipelines, you ensure we can make data-informed decisions. Most importantly, you will make an impact for 25+ million scientists around the world, who themselves have an impact on 8 billion peoples‚Äô lives via their research.The teamThe team we are hiring for is part of the platform engineering department and consists of data engineers, with a broad spectrum of experience in managing big data pipelines. Their support enables our product, analytics and business teams on a daily basis.Collaboration is critical to our team‚Äôs success; team members ask for and offer help on each others‚Äô projects and own objectives collectively, and we work closely with stakeholders in Product and other Engineering teams. We balance pragmatic solutions within our existing tech stack with forward-facing experiments, trying new solutions, employing new technologies, and informing ResearchGate‚Äôs Data Platform strategy.Responsibilities:Engineer efficient, adaptable and scalable data architectures to make building and maintaining big data applications easy and enjoyable for others.Work with key big data technologies including Hadoop, Flink, and Kafka and help to migrate them into Cloud.Data ingestion (work with third-party tooling like Debezium and Kafka Connect plugins)Take ownership for continuous maintenance and improvement of components of our data platform.Act as a technical leader to drive the evolution of our data platform in collaboration with backend engineering, data science and analytics teams.Requirements:5+ years of experience as a Data Platform Engineer or Data Engineer.Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform or a different cloud provider.Proficient knowledge in Python (Experience in Java is a bonus)Understanding of DevOps: running applications in Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code using terraform, cloud security principles.Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop and Flink) and as a bonus operating at petabyte scale.Your Profile:You are a strong team player and know that results come from great people working together around meaningful ideas.With your experience you are comfortable working with the team to support our product and business, as well as our engineering teams with data pipelines and insights.You are eager to learn and research new methods, solutions, and technologies.You love to work with data as much as you enjoy communicating your findings to an interested audience.You enjoy taking technical project ownership and designing complete systems to solve challenges.You are energized by teaching and learning from your teammates, engaging in brainstorming and pair-programming sessions, and giving and getting peer-to-peer feedback.You understand our mission and want to help us achieve it.The Interview ProcessYou will interview with several ResearchGate team members, including your hiring manager, potential teammates, and senior leadership. Your interview process will include experience-based interviews, technical challenges, and a Data pipeline case study.Life at ResearchGateYou'll be working in an open and empowered company culture, with the chance to individually shape your professional development and growth. Enjoy being a part of an energetic team that‚Äôs passionate about changing science for the better. We‚Äôre a team of optimists from around the world and from many different backgrounds guided by our mission to connect the world of science and make research open to all.Enjoy a flexible working environment that adapts to your life circumstances, a generous 30 full days of vacation for you to unwind and days focused for your professional development to further grow your career.We support a remote work approach by enabling our team to work across borders (up to 120 days a year) We occasionally come together for team summits, workshops, and in-person meetings, but fully embrace a remote-first approach to work.ResearchGate is an equal opportunity employerWe encourage people from all backgrounds and life experiences to apply with us and help us change the world of science. We commit to impartial and inclusive hiring processes, and therefore ask you to please refrain from adding a picture and your age to your application form or CV.Our hiring decisions are made based on your skills and qualifications, regardless of your age, gender, origin or race/ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, disability status, religion, or any other (perceived) personal characteristics. We are excited to receive your application.ResearchGate Intro and MissionResearchGate is the largest professional network for scientists and researchers. We've built a platform that helps the world's scientists and researchers to connect, collaborate, and advance their research to drive progress towards a better world.Over 25 million members from 193+ countries use ResearchGate to share, discover, and discuss research.

title: Senior Data Scientist with verification

title: Intern - Product Analytics with verification
description: About the jobTHE ROLE & THE TEAMZalando fulfils more than a hundred million customer orders every year and volumes are increasing. All these products are designed to help Zalando and our partners to offer premium fulfillment to customers. You will support our team in building the required infrastructure that will enable us to track key metrics and derive actionable insights through dashboards and ETL Pipelines. You will collaborate with other analysts, product managers, software engineers, and a network of stakeholders to develop scalable analytics products and contribute to shaping KPIs throughout the product platform. Your contributions will shape interesting new projects and influence the future of Fulfillment at Zalando.You‚Äôll find our Berlin campus and HQ in the vibrant area of Friedrichshain. With amazing views of the Spree river and East Side Gallery, it‚Äôs a campus designed to inspire. Berlin is the city that has shaped our business.Are you up for a new experience in one of the most vibrant, diverse, and green cities in Europe?WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING) Design and build interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI, Microstrategy and ensure dashboards provide actionable insights by collaborating with stakeholders.  Develop and maintain ETL pipelines to process and transform data efficiently ; Ensure data quality, accuracy, and reliability across all pipelines.  Work with SQL, Python, and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Databricks).  Document project requirements clearly to align with engineering and product teams.  Support ad hoc data analysis and reporting requests.  Analyze data trends to identify areas for product and operational enhancements. WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF You are currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in relevant fields such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Natural Sciences, Economics or a related field with strong analytical components.  You have intermediate to expert proficiency in SQL AND(OR) Python (or other relevant programming languages).  You have some familiarity with Libraries like Pandas, Numpy, Scipy (would be a plus, not a must have)  You have some familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI)  Basic understanding of ETL processes and cloud data platforms is a plus but not a Must-have  Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you‚Äôre great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusionOur employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groupsZalando BenefitsZalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer. 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners  2 paid volunteering days a year  Hybrid work model of up to 60% remote work and flexible working times.  27 days of vacation a year to start  Family services, including counseling and support  Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)  Mental health support and coaching available  Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
