Du bist mit den g√§ngigen Data-Science-Libraries & Tools wie scikit-learn, pandas, Matplotlib und jupyter bestens vertraut und besitzt Erfahrung mit Big-Data-Frameworks wie Apache Spark.Dar√ºber hinaus gerne gesehen sind Kenntnisse von Methoden der professionellen Softwareentwicklung einschlie√ülich Versionskontrolle (Git), CI/CD und Containerisierung (Kubernetes).Was wir bieten:Die REWE Group als einer der gr√∂√üten Handels- und Touristikkonzerne Europas bietet einzigartige Voraussetzungen f√ºr alle, die etwas bewegen wollen. Entdecke einen lebensnahen Arbeitgeber, der dir Vertrauen schenkt, Gestaltungsfreir√§ume erm√∂glicht und durch flexible Strukturen Innovationen und frische Ideen f√∂rdert. Wer bei uns arbeitet und viel bewegt, darf auch viel erwarten:Attraktive Verg√ºtung: Mit Sonderleistungen wie Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld, verm√∂genswirksamen Leistungen, betrieblicher Altersvorsorge, Zusch√ºssen f√ºr Kantine und verg√ºnstigtes Deutschlandticket sowie Vorteilen beim Fahrrad-Leasing.Mitarbeiterrabatte: Bei REWE, PENNY, toom Baumarkt und DER Touristik.Work-Life-Balance: Mit flexibler Arbeitszeit ohne Kernzeiten, Homeoffice, Auszeitmodellen, Betriebskinderg√§rten, zeitgem√§√üen Eltern-Kind-B√ºros, Unterst√ºtzung bei der Suche nach Kinderbetreuung und Pflege.Pers√∂nliche Weiterbildung: Mit umfassenden Seminarangeboten, fachspezifischen Akademien, Tech-Talks, E-Learnings und Teilnahme an Konferenzen und Hackathons.Gesundheitsmanagement: Mit Vorsorgeuntersuchungen, Sport-, Gesundheits- und Kochkursen.Gestaltungsspielraum: Mitbestimmung bei der Auswahl von Algorithmen, Analysetechniken und Technologien und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten an spannenden Fragestellungen aus den verschiedensten Unternehmensbereichen (Supply Chain, Logistik, Marketing, Kundenservice).Agiles Umfeld: Zusammenarbeit mit agilen Entwicklerteams im Big-Data-Kontext.Vernetzt: Unternehmensweite Netzwerke der REWE Group, wie z. B. unser LGBTIQ-Netzwerk ‚ÄûDITO ‚Äì different together‚Äú und das Frauennetzwerk ‚Äûf.ernetzt‚Äú f√ºr den Austausch rund um Karriere und pers√∂nliche Weiterentwicklung. In unserem Mini-Podcast erf√§hrst du mehr √ºber den Arbeitsalltag als Data Scientist von Hannes.Alle weiteren Infos rund um den Bereich Analytics findest du hier.Weitere Informationen erh√§ltst du auf unserer Website unter www.rewe-group.com/karriere.Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung mit Angabe deiner Verf√ºgbarkeit und Gehaltsvorstellung. Bitte nutze hierzu unser Onlineformular, so erreicht deine Bewerbung direkt die richtige Ansprechperson in unserem Recruiting Center. Bewerbungsunterlagen in Papierform k√∂nnen wir leider nicht zur√ºcksenden.F√ºr R√ºckfragen zu dieser Position (Job-ID: 829295) steht dir unser Bewerber-Servicetelefon unter 0221 149-7110 zur Verf√ºgung.Um dir den Lesefluss zu erleichtern, beschr√§nken wir uns im Textverlauf auf m√§nnliche Bezeichnungen. Wir betonen ausdr√ºcklich, dass bei uns alle Menschen - unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung - gleicherma√üen willkommen sind.

title: Working Student Workplace Engineer (f/m/d) - 20 hrs/week
description: About the jobHelp us decarbonize the cement and concrete industry.alcemy was founded to reduce the massive CO2 footprint of the cement and concrete industry. Concrete is humanity's second most used material by volume and its production is responsible for around 8% of global CO2 emissions.We are changing this! We leverage machine learning to provide smart production control software to the cement and concrete supply chain to improve efficiency and allow for the production of low-carbon cement and concrete at large scale. Our software is used 24/7 in cement and concrete plants to optimize production and reduce carbon emissions today. We are currently enabling our customers to save more than 100 000 tons of CO2 emissions each year and we aim to save 100 million tons per year in 2030.RequirementsKey Responsibilities:Device ManagementProcure and maintain all company devices, including laptops, printers, cell phones, and WiFi equipmentEnsure all devices are secured, regularly upgraded, and backed upImplement and utilize device management software to achieve the aboveTechnical On- and Offboarding ProcessCreate and remove user accounts as part of the on- and offboarding process. Develop and implement simple automation for these tasks to increase efficiencySet up and decommission devices for new and departing employeesTrain employees on new policies and ensure adherenceCloud Account ManagementManage and oversee non-engineering cloud accounts including Google Workplace, Slack, Notion, and othersEnsure appropriate access levels and security measures are in place for all cloud servicesRestructure and improve company-internal file sharing solutionsGeneral IT SupportProvide general IT helpdesk support, troubleshooting issues, and resolving technical problems for employees (2-3 times per week)Take your first steps in the industry working in a startup where your actions truly have an impactHelp save the planet!You'd be a great fit if:You are passionate about fighting climate changeYou have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field, or an apprenticeship as a FachinformatikerYou have 1-2 years of experience in account management, device management, and automation in a cloud-based environmentYou have excellent problem-solving and communication skillsYou have strong organizational skills and attention to detailYou have solid experience in administering and securing Linux and Mac laptopsYou can work from our Berlin office at least 2 days per weekYou can communicate effectively in GermanBenefitsWhat we offer:A company culture where honesty, professionalism, and integrity run deep with an open feedback culture and regular 1:1 meetingsFlat hierarchies, efficient decision-making processes, and an agile company structureCompetitive market-rate salary aligned with your experienceWork from our office in the heart of Berlin with flexible working hoursOf course, free drinks, fruit and snacks in the officeRegular team activities and team weeks a few times per yearMac or Linux laptopEnglish is our main language of communication28 days of vacation per year and an additional day of vacation every 2 years at alcemyAccess to nilo.health - the comprehensive mental well-being platform that provides access to 1-to-1 sessions with psychologists, group sessions and self-guided toolsDog-friendly office with specific rules in place, as well as dog-free areas for work and relaxationHiring ProcessInitial 1:1 screening call (30 minutes)Complete a take-home task relevant to the actual work you'd be doingA team and technical interview (60 minutes)We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. We also understand how stressful interviews can be. Let us know if there is anything we can do to improve the process so you can demonstrate your skills. To do so, contact Magdalena Milecka at magdalena.milecka@alcemy.tech.Note: We cannot offer relocation support for this position, and due to regulations, you need to be enrolled in a German university.Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) at alcemyFor the past two years, we have been dedicated to enhancing the diversity and inclusivity of our company. We have organized diversity workshops and established a DEI workgroup. By actively collecting feedback, educating our team, and considering new ideas, we have implemented several key improvements:Flexible work schedules to help you balance your job with your personal lifeAccess to nilo.health, a comprehensive mental well-being platform that provides 1-to-1 sessions with psychologists, group sessions, and self-guided tools, including sessions with representatives of minoritiesA diverse team to work with. We have team members across different age profiles, ethnicities, religions, gender identities, and orientationsNo mandatory vacation periods: use your time off for religious holidays, special events, or however you see fitCollecting feedback from team members during 1:1 meetings with team leaders, AMA sessions with the founders, and through regular engagement surveysWe're committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and included. Our journey toward diversity, equity, and inclusion is ongoing, and we're excited about the progress we'll make.

title: Backend Engineers (Python) with verification
description: About the jobAbout WoltAt Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.We are looking for Software Engineers who can develop production-level backend services in Python, to join several different Engineering Groups at Wolt. We have exciting opportunities for senior engineers ready for their next big adventure, as well as for engineers with a few years of experience looking to take the next step in their careers.Our Engineering organization at Wolt consists of 700+ Engineers working across 70+ product teams. Some of us work on the visible parts, making our services easy on the eye and some of us focus on the unseen magic happening behind the scenes.Our Engineers handle the whole development process (business logic, testing, database & data streaming, CI/CD, analytics, cloud) in an autonomous manner. They build things that are accessible and made to scale. They keep our systems in the best shape by simplifying the unnecessary complexity.We make the decisions as a team and group of teams for our ways of working and we take architectural decisions together. Everyone plays a role in our future.Our Engineers choose the best technologies that work for Wolt, their teams and themselves. Making good choices means finding scalable, robust technology that works in everyone‚Äôs best interests. The freedom to experiment and adopt the best technology benefits everyone. Needless to say, in such an environment there‚Äôs a lot of room for learning, teaching and growing together!The main stack for these roles consists for example Python (FastAPI), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker and Kubernetes.At the moment, we‚Äôre particularly looking to hire for the following groups:Courier Group: The Courier Group is made up of great teams dedicated to optimizing logistics and routing, enhancing courier partner earnings, forecasting, and delivering outstanding onboarding and delivery experiences for our courier partners.We are currently hiring a senior backend engineer to fulfillment team. The fulfillment team‚Äôs goal is to make our logistics platform more efficient while improving on-going delivery experience for consumers. To improve logistics efficiency the team is continuously making efforts to produce accurate travel and other fulfillment estimates of the delivery. This is achieved through building our own Maps platform and using Machine learning models to improve the accuracy constantly. While the on-going delivery experience is enhanced through more realistic & stable delivery ETA.Data Group: As the scale of Wolt has rapidly grown, we are introducing new users to our data platform every day and want this to become a coherent and streamlined experience for all users, whether they‚Äôre Analysts, Data Scientists working with our data or teams bringing new data to the platform from their applications. We aim to both provide new platform capabilities across batch, streaming, orchestration and data integration to serve our user‚Äôs needs, as well as building an intuitive interface for them to solve their use cases without having to learn the details of the underlying tools.Our primary programming language of choice is Python. We deploy our systems in Kubernetes and AWS. We use Datadog for observability (logging and metrics). We have built our data warehouse on top of Snowflake and orchestrate our batch processes with Airflow and Dagster. We are heavy users of Kafka and Kafka Connect. Our CI/CD pipelines rely on GitHub actions and Argo Workflows.We have multiple open positions across various teams in the Data Group, with opportunities at different seniority levels.‚Äî--üìçAll these roles are open for candidates who are based in Berlin. We offer a flexible hybrid setup: you can choose to work from the office, remotely, or a mix of both.Our humble expectationsWe are looking for Software Engineers who can develop production-level microservices in Python. We'd love to see experience with building high-load and large-scale systems in Python. We have openings for both senior engineers with extensive experience and engineers with a few years of experience.As a member of our teams, you'll dive into the world of microservices, primarily using Python, while remaining open to exploring other modern languages, such as Kotlin and Go, in some teams. We appreciate previous experience in handling the whole development cycle all the way to production.But what truly sets you apart is your ability to tackle big challenges together, envision scalability and availability, and dare to question conventional decisions. You‚Äôll be successful in our teams if you quickly grasp new concepts and thrive in an environment of continuous learning.We put a lot of focus on the ability to collaborate well with others. We work closely with our teammates and having a good connection with team members is essential. We understand that everyone has their own unique way of communicating with others. We expect you to be yourself, express your opinions, and work together with the rest of the team.In addition to technical expertise, we cherish those who take ownership beyond the obvious, have an insatiable hunger for knowledge, make collaborative decisions, and enthusiastically collaborate with diverse teams Woltwide. We value the unique perspectives and skills you bring to our adventure, and we're excited to see what you can achieve with us!üë•üöÄNext stepsWe are hiring for a number of positions across a few different Engineering Groups. During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about different teams. After the call with a Talent Acquisition partner, the interviewing steps are conducted for a particular group in mind, with a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that‚Äôs the moment when you‚Äôll latest get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills and aspirations with the most suitable Engineering team at Wolt!Our Commitment to Diversity and InclusionWe‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Quantum Algorithm Researcher
description: About the jobQuantum Futures is partnering with one of the biggest European quantum computing companies that is looking for an experienced Quantum Algorithms Researcher with expertise in quantum chemistry to join their applications team.The Researcher will be required to have a strong background in the development and implementation of novel quantum algorithms, as they will be in charge of multiple projects related to the company‚Äôs quantum chemistry applications.The ideal candidate will have:PhD/Postdoctoral experience in Quantum Chemistry, Theoretical Chemistry, Physics or related disciplinesExpertise in the development of quantum algorithmsExperience writing grant applicationsThe position is onsite, based in Central Europe (DACH region) and only EU-residents are eligible to apply.Please apply only if you have relevant experience in quantum computing.If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about this role, please apply below.

title: Cross-Platform AI Internship
description: About the jobCross-Platform AI Internship (Unpaid)Location: Berlin, Germany (Remote work possible)Start Date: Immediate or latest by April 30thDuration: Three months or more, tailored to fit your scheduleAbout EpapaAt Epapa, we are pioneering the future of AI-powered education and humanoid robotics. Our journey starts with launching an intelligent, adaptive learning mobile app designed to transform how students learn math and science. But this is just the beginning. We are building the world‚Äôs first humanoid robot capable of acting as an interactive AI tutor for STEM subjects while also assisting with household tasks.This is a rare opportunity to push the boundaries of mobile AI development and robotics integration. If you are a passionate React Native developer ready to lead the development of cutting-edge technology, we want to hear from you.About the InternshipThis full-time, unpaid internship offers a hands-on opportunity for a passionate and creative React Native AI Developer to contribute to real-world projects at a dynamic EdTech startup. You will work closely with our team to build and enhance our intelligent, adaptive learning mobile app and collaborate on integrating AI-driven systems into our educational platform.Opportunities to Contribute (May Include):‚Ä¢ Mobile App Development & AI Integration:‚Ä¢ Develop scalable mobile applications using React Native, Node.js, and Azure.‚Ä¢ Implement adaptive learning systems using OpenAI APIs and other AI tools to deliver personalized and engaging educational experiences.‚Ä¢ Optimize app operations through CI/CD pipelines and automated deployments to ensure smooth performance.‚Ä¢ AI-Driven Educational Models:‚Ä¢ Design AI-driven learning models that enhance students‚Äô experiences in learning STEM subjects.‚Ä¢ Build innovative interaction systems that can eventually integrate into humanoid educational robots.‚Ä¢ Collaborative Development:‚Ä¢ Work with our robotics engineers to ensure seamless integration between app functionalities and future hardware systems.‚Ä¢ Develop APIs and interaction protocols that enable the app‚Äôs AI capabilities to support engaging educational experiences.‚Ä¢ Exploring AI Tools:‚Ä¢ Experiment with AI frameworks like title: Machine Learning Engineer at AI CoE (f/m/d) with verification
description: About the jobWe help the world run better At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.What you`ll doSummaryWe are looking for a ML Engineering who can drive AI development and participate in our engineering scrum teams as technical code contributor. The candidate will have profound skills in Data Science, Data Engineering and Software Engineering with an entrepreneurial spirit to join our diverse team and work on innovation projects.RoleIn this role you contribute to the entire development lifecycle of an AI service, from Data Science PoC to productization and production operations. This requires skills and knowledge throughout the entire development lifecycle. You are very experienced with general software engineering best practices and enterprise-grade code development applied to an AI space. Concretely this means that next to having profound AI modeling expertise, you are exceptional at working with vast amounts of data in a Big Data setup, professional Data Engineering Pipeline development as well as model deployment/serving and CI/CD setup. To fully understand our stakeholders' problems and challenges a solid business acumen is needed as well. As a development leader you can motivate and guide a scrum team through complex tasks with tight deadlines.Responsibilities / Core TasksDevelop AI services from PoC to Production Setup and develop new Big Data pipelines, to productize data ETL workloads for different AI services Develop AI/ML models to solve real life business problems (this includes Data Science exploration phase as well as model productization) Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutionsProductionize AI PoCs with good software engineering by incorporating CI/CD pipelines, deployment and MLOps.Take ownership over AI services in development and productionLead, guide and mentor junior colleagues and evolve their AI engineering skillsetWhat You BringBachelor's or master's degree in machine learning, computer science, engineering, or related technical fields Vast coding knowledge of at least one programming language such as Python or Java Deep knowledge of Distributed Computing Systems for Big Data Engineering such as Databricks (PySpark/Scala) Exceptional understanding of AI/ML concepts Extensive coding experience in applying ML frameworks such as Keras, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Langchain, OpenAI, Huggingface Vast general software engineering best-practices (e.g. Object-Oriented Programming) and experience working in a scrum-like software engineering unitProductization technologies and tools such as Docker, K8s, GitHub, VSCode, Linux etc. CI/CD and ML Ops frameworks such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, MLFlow, etc. Cloud-deployment offerings such as Azure ML, Databricks, AKS, Event Hubs, Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions or similar in AWS / GCP Some form of code ownership and scrum team leadership experienceCuriosity to learn about different AI applications and new technologies in general Excellent spoken and written knowledge of English as well as collaborative mindset; good German language skills desirable Experience with SAP AI offerings e.g. AI Core, AI Business Services, Joule etc. is a plus Understanding of Agile / Scaled Agile (SAFe) methodologies is a plus Python backend development, e.g. Flask, Django, FastAPI, OpenAPI is a plus Meet your team SAP Intelligent Enterprise Solutions (IES) department has the purpose to ‚ÄúDeliver and Run the Intelligent Enterprise‚Äù. IES is SAP‚Äôs technology backbone and most compelling reference customer, and as such, we influence product development and strategy, with our customer experience at heart.Within IES, our ‚ÄúArtificial Intelligence CoE‚Äù team has the purpose to help SAP to transform into a data-driven intelligent enterprise, by empowering SAP employees to simplify processes, leveraging AI technologies. Our vision is to be an advocate and enabler of best-in-class AI within SAP. Our mission is to deliver business value through AI in SAP‚Äôs processes and be recognized as AI Thought Leader in the market.We implement both standard SAP AI and custom built solutions across all LoBs. We are customer zero of SAP standard AI solutions and provide continuous feedback to standard development for product improvement. We provide an AI Platform and Infrastructure to entire SAP AI practitioners for building their own ML solutions in the entire ML lifecycle following MLOps methodology. Furthermore, we build and operate a central chatbot platform based on SAP Conversational AI with the aim to provide capabilities from all lines of business through a single digital assistant. We also build those capabilities (individual chatbots) as well as support other teams in building further ones.Within our team, we practice a trust-based working model with emphasis on great collaboration, agility and transparency. We offer a lot of room for creativity and freedom to experiment. Our operating model is based on autonomous/agile team concept (SAFe) and SAP New Work practice where we put people at the center of everything we do.Bring out your bestSAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.We win with inclusionSAP‚Äôs culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone ‚Äì regardless of background ‚Äì feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.Requisition ID: 423232 | Work Area: Information Technology | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Part Time or Regular Full Time |

title: Software Engineer Intern - Berlin (2025) with verification
description: About the jobBuild the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.Snowflake started with a clear vision: develop a cloud data platform that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Snowflake developed an innovative new product with a built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. We are now a global, world-class organization with offices in more than a dozen countries and serving many more.We‚Äôre looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake.WHAT WE OFFER :Paid, full-time internships in the heart of the software industryPost-internship career opportunities (full-time and/or additional internships)Exposure to a fast-paced, yet fun, startup cultureA chance to work with world-class experts on challenging projectsOpportunity to provide meaningful contributions to a real system used by customersHigh level of access to supervisors (manager and mentor), detailed direction without micromanagement, feedback throughout your internship, and a final evaluationStuff that matters: treated as a member of the Snowflake team, included in company meetings/activities, flexible hours, casual dress code, accommodations to work from home, swag and much moreCatered lunches, access to gaming consoles, recreational games, happy hours, company outings, and moreEmbraced as a full member of the diverse Snowflake engineering teamWHAT WE EXPECT :Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college/university program during the time of the internshipRequired: A completed BS degree, with an MS or PhD in progressDesired Majors: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field Required coursework: algorithms, data structures, and operating systemsRecommended coursework: Database systems, distributed systems, Geospatial/Geographic IS, cloud computing, compilers, Bonus experience: Research or publications in databases or distributed systems, experience with geo features processing, and contributions to open source. Experience working with big data (engineering / processing) and data migrationDuration: 4 month minimum, 6 months recommended, up to 12 months supported, start date flexibleExcellent programming skills in C++ or Java Knowledge of data structures and algorithmsStrong problem solving and ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environmentFluent English language skills (oral and written)Experience with working as a part of a teamDedication and passion for technologySystems programming skills including multi-threading, concurrency, etc.WHAT YOU WILL LEARN/GAIN :How to build enterprise grade, reliable, and trustworthy software/servicesExposure to SQL and/or other database technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)Understanding of database internals, large-scale data processing, transaction processing, distributed systems, and data warehouse designImplementation, testing of features in query compilation, compiler design, query executionExperience working with cloud infrastructure, AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud in particularLearning about cutting edge database technology and researchPossible Teams/Work Focus Areas:Database Query Engine, Data Infrastructure, Data Pipelines, Data Platform, Database Security, Data Governance, Data Sharing, FoundationDB, Manageability, Metadata, Service Runtime, Snowhouse Foundation, Storage and ML Engineering High performance large-scale data processingLarge-scale distributed systemsSoftware-as-a-Service platformSoftware frameworks for stability and performance testing POSSIBLE TEAMS/WORK FOCUS AREA :Execution platform (XP), Search Optimization (SO), SQL Features (Geo, Collations) as well as FDB CAT (Client/Authorization/Transport)Database engineering, service runtime, streaming (data pipelines), metadata, Streamlit and cloud engineering teams. High performance large-scale data processingLarge-scale distributed systemsQuery compilation and optimizationGeospatial Design/Geographic IS (map compilation, CRS manipulation, geo features processing)Software-as-a-Service platformSoftware frameworks for stability and performance testingSnowflake is growing fast, and we‚Äôre scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.How do you want to make your impact?Snowflake is growing fast, and we‚Äôre scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.How do you want to make your impact?For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com

title: Masterand Energy Systems
skills: ['German'; 'Machine Learning'; 'Python (Programming Language)'; 'Analytical Skills'; 'Computer Simulations'; 'Electrical Engineering'; 'Engineering'; 'Power Electronics'; 'Power Engineering'; 'Voltage']
description: About the jobEaton is an intelligent power management company dedicated to improving the quality of life and protecting the environment for people everywhere. We are guided by our commitment to do business right, to operate sustainably and to help our customers manage power ‚îÄ today and well into the future. By capitalizing on the global growth trends of electrification and digitalization, we are accelerating the planet's transition to renewable energy and helping to solve the world's most urgent power management challenges.What You'll Do Master's thesis on the topic "Energy Management System Tool for DC grids " Literature research on energy management system algorithms and control strategies Integration of RESs (e.g., solar, wind) and ESSs (e.g., batteries) into the DC grid Adaptive voltage sharing control for DC grids Develop algorithms for optimizing power and energy flow and minimizing losses within the DC grid Strategies for load balancing and peak shaving to enhance grid stability Use of simulation tools (e.g., MATLAB/Simulink) to test and validate the EMS under various scenariosQualifications Pursuing a master's degree in electrical engineeringSkills Understanding of the principles of power electronics and DC grids Previous experience with EMS tools is an advantage Experience with simulation platforms like MATLAB/Simulink, PSCAD desired Strong communication and teamwork skills Proficiency in English and/or German Individual support during the preparation of the Master's thesis Prospects of employment at one of the many national and international locations Culture & values - Eaton offers more than its products - "We make what matters work" Inclusion & DiversityWe are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.

title: Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m) - Large-scale Machine Learning with verification
description: About the jobWhy us?We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.As a Senior Data Scientist in Aignostic's foundation model team you will work on our self-supervised base models. Together with collaborators in academia and industry you will push the state of the art in large-scale machine learning for digital pathology. Within our team of experts on large-scale machine learning and data handling, you will work on improving, benchmarking and extending our family of best-in-class foundations models, bridging image, text and other pathology data modalities. Moreover, using our foundation models you will contribute to developing prototypes for new applications to assist pathologists and generate new insights for improving cancer treatment.At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.Where your expertise is needed Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledgeResearch, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological imagesTransform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systemsSupport and mentor junior colleaguesClearly communicate your results in internal and external presentationsWhat We Are Looking ForPh.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or BioinformaticsEagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex spaceSolid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniquesExperience with developing large-scale self-supervised deep learning models ("Foundation Models") for vision or language applicationsAdvanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacksPassion for clean code and high standards for quality assuranceAbility to independently define, organize and complete research projects Excellent communication and team working skillsBonus points forExposure to biomedical data Leadership experience in a research contextHands-on experience with developing and integrating Vision Language Models (VLMs)Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.Our offerJoin a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partnersWork with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startupExpand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programsMentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great expertsFlexible working hours and teleworking policyEnjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per yearWe are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave optionsPick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-beingEnjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environmentJoin us to make a difference!About Usaignostics.com

title: Praktikum - Silent testing for autonomous driving - REF79036G with verification
description: About the jobCompany DescriptionContinental entwickelt wegweisende Technologien und Dienste f√ºr die nachhaltige und vernetzte Mobilit√§t der Menschen und ihrer G√ºter. title: SALES ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP with verification
description: About the jobBuild the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.Munich or Berlin, GERThere is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake‚Äôs founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn‚Äôt stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organisations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.We‚Äôre looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake. As part of our world-class Enterprise Solution Engineering team, interns will engage in structured, hands-on technical projects that tackle real-world challenges and drive impactful outcomes. In addition to project work, interns will have opportunities to connect with Snowflake employees, contribute to community initiatives, and participate in professional development events. These experiences are crafted to promote both personal and professional growth, helping students develop valuable technical and interpersonal skills while advancing their career potential and making a meaningful impact.WHAT WE OFFER :4-6 months internship program (depending on school requirements), starting March 2025Paid, full-time internships in the heart of the software industryPost-internship career opportunities (full-time and/or additional internships)Exposure to a fast-paced, fun and inclusive cultureA chance to work with world-class experts on challenging projectsOpportunity to provide meaningful contributions to a real system used by customersHigh level of access to supervisors (manager and mentor), detailed direction without micromanagement, feedback throughout your internship, and a final evaluationWHAT WE EXPECT :Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college/university program during the time of the internshipDesired Class Level: Master of Science or Master of Business AdministrationDesired majors: Data Engineering and Analytics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Information EngineeringRequired coursework: SQL / Python Programming, Database Systems, Cloud ComputingRecommended coursework: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Systems & Architecture Familiarity/certification(s) with GCP/Azure/AWS services in relation to Database/Data Platforms would also be beneficial.German native / C1 speakerWHAT YOU WILL LEARN / GAIN :You will be paired with one manager and one mentor during the internship cycle, and be required to complete at least one project during your tenure at Snowflake.Projects will be designed to have a clear beginning, midpoint and end, and represent "real work", with tight deadlines.You will be required to share your work in 2 separate ways - a Live Presentation with your assigned team and a ‚ÄúSnow & Tell‚Äù Video shared company wide.EXAMPLE OF WORK FOCUS AREAS:Interns have the opportunity to work on real-world, high-impact use cases, including but not limited to:Natural Language Query Generation with LLMs: Business analysts face bottlenecks due to reliance on technical teams for complex SQL queries, limiting data access for non-technical users. LLMs in Snowflake allow analysts to ask questions in plain English, automatically generating SQL queries to extract insights without needing SQL expertise.Unstructured Data Analysis and Insights: Organisations struggle to analyse unstructured data like reviews, social media comments, and emails for actionable insights. Snowflake enables centralised storage and analysis of unstructured data, leveraging machine learning and UDFs to extract meaningful insights.Customer Churn Prediction with Machine Learning: Businesses need to predict customer churn by analysing large datasets of customer behaviour, transactions, and support interactions. Snowpark enables data scientists to build machine learning models directly within Snowflake using familiar programming languages, ensuring secure and efficient processing of large datasets.Snowflake is growing fast, and we‚Äôre scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.How do you want to make your impact?For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com

title: Fullstack Developer (x/f/m)
description: About the jobWe‚Äôre building the leading B2B AI SaaS / marketplace to help buyers source suppliers in the food and beverage industry. Backed by experienced business and product founders with C-level backgrounds in major e-commerce players, we‚Äôre now scaling our engineering team to reach the next level.TasksBuild and maintain features across our platform, from backend services to frontend interfacesContribute to our core product experience with scalable and high-quality codeDevelop and maintain components in Next.js and APIs in PythonHelp improve infrastructure, performance, and maintainability of the platformWork closely with product, design, and business to deliver value to usersBring ideas to the table, challenge assumptions, and help shape our tech and product roadmapRequirements3‚Äì5+ years of professional experience in web developmentProficient with Next.js (React) and Python (e.g. FastAPI, Flask, or Django)Solid understanding of REST APIs, database design, and cloud deploymentsExperience with modern DevOps workflows (e.g. CI/CD, Docker, cloud providers)Bonus points for experience with data engineering, ML/AI, or B2B SaaS marketplaces, CMS/WagtailHands-on, pragmatic approach with a bias for actionFluent in English (written and spoken); other languages are a plusGrowth mindset: curiosity, willingness to learn, and openness to feedbackBenefitsHigh ownership and autonomy in a fast-paced startupSupport and mentorship from experienced product and engineering leadersOpportunity to build an impactful product used by thousands of businessesRemote-friendly and flexible work setupWork on real-world AI/automation challengesA culture that values ownership, humility, learning, authenticity, and resultsNo matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you come from‚Äîyou can find your place at Torg. We are committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone belongs and can thrive.Desired Skills and Experiencenext.jspythonwebfullstack

title: Internship R&D Technical Photography - Consumer Technology Insights with verification
description: About the jobAbout this Position  Our test salons are part of the research and development function at Henkel. Here, hairdressers, product testers and engineers evaluate new formulations, applications and devices and support, consult and inspire our product development during the development process and before the final market launch. During this process, we aim for a very robust documentation of our progress and take pictures in a standardized form so that they can be compared retrospectively and support the development process.We are looking for skilled and passionate candidate for a 6-months internship to help us develop and realize the most ideal photo documentation ecosystem for our D√ºsseldorf test-salon.What You¬¥ll Do Identification of improvement potential for the general setup of the system as part of the evaluation infrastructureRecommendation of a cloud-based solution for centralized data storage and accessibility incl. linking to results within other results documentation IT systemsReview of the existing prototype to identify potential improvement areas for the scientific analysis of the defined key performance criteriaDefinition of a ‚ÄúStandard of Excellence‚Äù scenario to take the current situation to the next level - development of an action plan (milestones including required resources) to raise the current scenario to the ideal situationRecommendation for monitoring the system along with a regular assessment of performance improvements - collaboration with the different internal departments & functions to implement the partners' requirementsEvaluation of the currently existing system for photo documentation of hair cosmetic results on consumers‚Äô head in the R&D test-salon in D√ºsseldorf What makes you a good fit Student with a minimum of 4 semesters of studies in media technology, photography or comparable areasExperience with internet-based storage solutionsExcellent analytical skills, solution-oriented, adaptive mindset and ‚ÄòCan-do‚Äô-attitudeCapable of working with multifunctional groups to move projects forwardStrong communication and presentation skills for verbal and written communication of ideas, technical rationales, risks, issues and recommendationsFluent in English and German languageA passion for Beauty - in touch with trends and technology in the beauty industry Some perks of joining Henkel Diverse national and international growth opportunitiesGlobally wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programsGender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeksEmployee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching sharesAttractive RemunerationFlexible working hoursGlobal ExperienceInterns CommunityWe offer you an attractive salary between ‚Ç¨ 1050-2095. The exact amount of the remuneration depends on the desired duration, the type of internship (voluntary or mandatory) and existing degrees.At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

description: About the jobE.ON Digital Technology GmbH | Permanent | Part or Full time You have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place? Join the forefront of energy transition with E.ON's Digital Technology organization, as part of our technology in-house consulting, Expert Services. As a professional services organization, we collaborate closely with our business units, providing pivotal services that accelerate E.ON's ambitious Digital Transformation strategy.If you have a passion for leading the green transition with digital innovation, become a playmaker in our energetic and diverse team of more than 500 Expert Services consultants.It's on us to make new energy work!Your Role - meaningful & rewarding You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including project managers, data experts and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and build operational data-driven solutions that have global impact and scale to all E.ON countries  You take responsibility in the end-to-end lifecycle of projects, define scope and deliverables with the business and ensure timely delivery of high-quality solutions  You communicate findings, insights and decisions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences  You foster a collaborative and innovative team environment and mentor junior colleagues  You share your ideas and convince to go new ways Your Profile - authentic & open-minded You have extensive professional experience in data engineering positions and a consulting background  You have extensive hands-on experience in building end-to-end data solutions  You have experience with software development best practices, including version control, continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD), monitoring, automation and testing  You have experience in Microsoft Azure, Infrastructure-as-a-Code as well as building secure cloud architectures  You have experience with our technology stack which includes Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Terraform, Python, Spark  You have excellent communication skills engaging various stakeholders matching the audience  Fluent in English and German Our Benefits - smart & usefulEnjoy flexibility: You can combine coming to the office and working from home flexibly. It's even possible to go on workation for up to 20 days per year within Europe.Advance your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us. Learning on the job, exchanging with others, or taking part in an individual training - our learning culture enables you to bring your personal and professional development to the next level.Get connected: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building.Recharge your battery: You have 30 days of paid vacation per year plus Christmas and New Year's Eve off. Your battery still needs charging? You can exchange parts of your salary for more paid vacation or you can take a sabbatical.Elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing offers to a subsidised Deutschland-Ticket - your way is our way.Think ahead: With our company pension scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future.This is by far not all... We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the hiring process.Do you have questions? For further information please contact the Talent Acquisition Team, EDT_Talent_Acquisition@eon.com.Please understand that for data protection reasons we can only accept applications submitted via our portal. Unfortunately, we cannot consider application documents that reach us by email or post.What You Need To KnowJob Req ID: 235396Contract type: PermanentWorking time: Part or Full timeCompany: E.ON Digital Technology GmbHLocation: Essen, Berlin, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Hannover, M√ºnchenFunction area: IT/Digital; Consulting; Data / IoT

title: Senior Consultant Business Intelligence Data & Analytics (all genders) with verification

title: Wissenschaftlicher Projektmitarbeiter Rechteinformationen und Metadaten (m/w/d)
description: About the jobDie SLUB z√§hlt mit etwa 350 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern zu den gr√∂√üten und leistungsf√§higsten wissenschaftlichen Bibliotheken Deutschlands. Sie ist ein bedeutendes Innovations- und Koordinierungszentrum im deutschen Bibliothekswesen und ein lebendiger sozialer Ort wissenschaftlichen Austauschs. Wir wollen mit zukunftsweisenden Technologien Wissen schaffen und niedrigschwellig verf√ºgbar zu machen. Dabei sind wir unserem umfangreichen kulturellen Erbe aus vielen Jahrhunderten verpflichtet.Mit unterschiedlichen Partnereinrichtungen beteiligt sich die SLUB an der DFG-Pilotphase ‚ÄûDigitalisierung und Bereitstellung (noch) rechtebewehrter Objekte‚Äú . GitHub: librml ) entsprechend der Anforderungen an eine vereinheitlichteErfassung von Zugangs- und Nutzungsbeschr√§nkungen Erstellung und Anpassung bisher fehlender Rechtehinweise zur Beschreibung der Beschr√§nkungen und rechtlichen Grundlagen Formulierung der Rechtehinweise sowie deren persistente Bereitstellung Projektkoordination in Zusammenarbeit mit der SBB-PK und der DINI-AG KIM Lizenzen Gruppe sowie mit weiteren Projekten der DFG-PilotphaseSie bringen mit: abgeschlossene Hochschulausbildung z.B. im Bereich der Bibliotheks-, Informationswissenschaften oder einen vergleichbaren Abschluss sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Metadatenstandards, insbesondere METS/MODS und MARC sehr gute Kenntnisse in Auszeichnungssprachen und Datenformaten wie zum Beispiel XML (XSD) oder JSON hohe Eigeninitiative sowie F√§higkeit und Bereitschaft zur selbst√§ndigen Arbeit in einer vielschichtigen Projektstruktur Organisationsgeschick, sehr gute Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und Selbstorganisation w√ºnschenswert: Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement Kenntnisse der Datenfl√ºsse in Bibliotheken und Bibliotheksverb√ºnden grundlegende Kenntnisse rechtlicher Grundlagen, wie zum Beispiel das Urheber- und verwandte Schutzrechte sowie deren Auswirkung auf die Bereitstellung digitalisierter Bibliotheksbest√§nde (Drucke, Tontr√§ger, Bilder, ‚Ä¶) Erfahrung im Umgang mit der Versionsverwaltung mit GitWir bieten Ihnen: mobiles Arbeiten nach der Einarbeitung bis zu 100 % m√∂glich attraktive Bedingungen zur Mobilit√§t (z. B. Job- bzw. Bitte √ºbermitteln Sie uns Ihre vollst√§ndigen Bewerbungsunterlagen, die in der Bezeichnung Ihren Namen tragen, unter Angabe der Kennziffer SLUB-2025-05 bis zum 10.04.2025 √ºber unser Online-Bewerbungsformular . title: Data Scientist (d/f/m) with verification
description: About the jobWhy us?We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.As a Data Scientist (d/f/m) at Aignostics, you work on interdisciplinary projects to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. Together with your colleagues you apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve complex real-world problems. You independently conduct rigorous experiments while also contributing well-designed features to our codebase.This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.Where your expertise is needed Work on interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledgeApply and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological imagesTransform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systemsClearly communicate your resultsWhat We Are Looking ForDegree in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or BioinformaticsEagerness to learn new technologies and excel in a complex spaceSolid theoretical foundations and 1-2 years of experience developing novel machine learning techniquesAdvanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacksExperience with development of deep learning models for computer vision Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assuranceExcellent communication and team working skillsBonus points forExposure to biomedical data Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.Our offerJoin a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partnersWork with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startupExpand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programsMentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great expertsFlexible working hours and teleworking policyEnjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per yearWe are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave optionsPick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports and well-beingEnjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environmentJoin us to make a difference!About Usaignostics.com

Mit ihren Reifen leistet Continental einen wesentlichen Beitrag zu sicherer, effizienter und umweltfreundlicher Mobilit√§t.StellenbeschreibungHey, du bist auf der Suche nach einer spannenden Werkstudentent√§tigkeit, bei der du wertvolle Einblicke in den Bereich Noise, Vibration, Harshness (NVH, ‚ÄûGer√§usch, Vibration, Rauhigkeit‚Äú) gewinnen kannst? Wir werden dich vor Ort im Werk St√∂cken brauchen, zum Aufbau und Nutzung von Messtechnik.Was erwartet dich bei uns:Mitarbeit bei der Vorbereitung von Reifen f√ºr Ger√§uschmessungen und in der LogistikUnterst√ºtzung bei der Vorbereitung verschiedener Messverfahren, einschlie√ülich der Einrichtung des Labors und der Kalibrierung der Ger√§teDurchf√ºhrung von Reifen-Ger√§uschmessungen im LaborKontrolle des Erfassungssystems und Aktualisierung von Checklisten und BerichtsvorlagenUnterst√ºtzung bei der Wartung von NVH-Ger√§tenQualifikationenDu fragst dich, ob du f√ºr die Werkstudentent√§tigkeit im NVH Testing geeignet bist? Hier sind wichtige Qualifikationen, die wir suchen:Du studierst Fahrzeugtechnik, Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau oder vergleichbare Studienrichtungen, damit du grundlegende Aspekte unseres Aufgabenbereichs mitbringstDein Studienschwerpunkt in Fahrzeugtechnik ist von VorteilDu bringst erste Erfahrungen im Testing und Messtechnik mitDu hast gute Kenntnisse in Mechanik, bevorzugt auch in der AkustikDie Arbeit mit Matlab ist dir vertrautDu arbeitest sicher mit den g√§ngigen MS Office-ProgrammenSehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift) sind f√ºr uns unbedingt notwendigNeben diesen fachlichen Anforderungen suchen wir aber auch nach bestimmten Eigenschaften und F√§higkeiten:Du hast eine gute Auffassungsgabe und wei√üt, wie man effektiv arbeitet, ohne den √úberblick zu verlierenDein Arbeitsstil ist strukturiert und selbst√§ndigEine sehr gut ausgepr√§gte Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und Teamf√§higkeit sind f√ºr uns ebenfalls wichtig - schlie√ülich m√ºssen wir immer gemeinsam an L√∂sungen arbeitenBitte denk daran, deine aktuelle Immatrikulationsbescheinigung ebenso wie deinen aktuellen Notenspiegel und einen Auszug aus der aktuellen Studienordnung hinsichtlich Ableistung eines Pflichtpraktikums hochzuladen, da diese f√ºr die Bearbeitung Ihrer Bewerbung zwingend erforderlich sind!Bitte reiche uns, sofern erforderlich, einen g√ºltigen Aufenthaltstitel sowie deine Arbeitsgenehmigung inklusive Zusatzblatt ein.Die Bewerbungen von schwerbehinderten Menschen sind willkommen.Zus√§tzliche InformationenEin vielseitiges und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet in einem motivierten Team, in dem du schnell Verantwortung √ºbernehmen kannst und so ein wertvolles Mitglied unseres Teams bistDein Einsatz bei uns wird fair verg√ºtet: Wir wissen, dass deine Arbeit wertvoll ist und m√∂chten sicherstellen, dass du angemessen entlohnt wirstWir bieten dir flexible Arbeitszeiten mit hybriden Arbeitsmodellen, bei denen du die M√∂glichkeit hast, gelegentlich auch von zu Hause aus zuarbeiten, denn wir wissen, wie wichtig das Zusammenspiel von Privat- und Berufsleben istDu wirst von unseren erfahrenen Fachkr√§ften qualifiziert betreut, um dein fachliches Wissen und deine praktischen F√§higkeiten zu verbessernAls Mitarbeiterin oder Mitarbeiter hast du au√üerdem die M√∂glichkeit, erm√§√üigte Speisen in unserer werkseigenen Kantine zu genie√üenWenn du dich in unserer Stelle wiederfindest und Lust hast, mit uns an spannenden Projekten zu arbeiten, dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams!Wenn du mehr √ºber unseren Standort erfahren willst, besuche gerne unsere Standortseite: Continental / Hannover St√∂ckenVielfalt, Inklusion und Zugeh√∂rigkeit sind uns wichtig und machen uns als Unternehmen stark und erfolgreich.
