title: Senior Data Scientist GenAI (f/m/d) (Essen DE)
description: About the jobE.ON Digital Technology GmbH | Permanent | Part or Full time You have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place? Join the forefront of energy transition with E.ON's Digital Technology organization, as part of our technology in-house consulting, Expert Services. As a professional services organization, we collaborate closely with our business units, providing pivotal services that accelerate E.ON's ambitious Digital Transformation strategy.If you have a passion for leading the green transition with digital innovation, become a playmaker in our energetic and diverse team of more than 500 Expert Services consultants.It's on us to make new energy work!Your Role - meaningful & rewardingYou collaborate with cross-functional teams, including project managers, data experts and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and build operational data-driven solutions that have global impact and scale to all E.ON countriesLead the development and enhancement of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures using Python and FastAPIYou take responsibility in the end-to-end lifecycle of projects, define scope and deliverables with the business and ensure timely delivery of high-quality solutionsYou communicate findings, insights and decisions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiencesYou foster a collaborative and innovative team environment and mentor junior colleaguesYou share your ideas and convince to go new waysYour Profile - authentic & open-mindedYou have extensive professional experience in data science positions and a consulting backgroundYou have extensive hands-on experience in building end-to-end data solutionsExpertise in LLM-based applications, including prompt engineering, embeddings, and vector search. In-depth knowledge of RAG architectures and their application in AI/ML scenarios. You have experience with software development best practices, including version control, continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD), monitoring, automation and testingYou have good experience with our technology stack which includes various Azure services, Databricks, Python, Spark, GitlabYou have excellent communication skills engaging various stakeholders matching the audienceFluent in English and GermanOur Benefits - smart & usefulEnjoy flexibility: You can combine coming to the office and working from home flexibly. It's even possible to go on workation for up to 20 days per year within Europe.Advance your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us. Learning on the job, exchanging with others, or taking part in an individual training - our learning culture enables you to bring your personal and professional development to the next level.Get connected: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building.Recharge your battery: You have 30 days of paid vacation per year plus Christmas and New Year's Eve off. Your battery still needs charging? You can exchange parts of your salary for more paid vacation or you can take a sabbatical.Elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing offers to a subsidised Deutschland-Ticket - your way is our way.Think ahead: With our company pension scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future.This is by far not all... We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the hiring process.Do you have questions? For further information please contact the Talent Acquisition Team, EDT_Talent_Acquisition@eon.com.Please understand that for data protection reasons we can only accept applications submitted via our portal. Unfortunately, we cannot consider application documents that reach us by email or post.What You Need To KnowJob Req ID: 235397Contract type: PermanentWorking time: Part or Full timeCompany: E.ON Digital Technology GmbHLocation: Essen, Berlin, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Hannover, M√ºnchenFunction area: IT/Digital; Consulting; Data / IoT

title: Data Analyst Insurance (all genders) with verification
description: About the jobWir geh√∂ren zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngesch√§ftsprozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz ma√ügeschneiderter IT-L√∂sungen unterst√ºtzen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.DEINE ROLLEProjektleitung und Mitarbeit: Du √ºbernimmst (Teil-)Projektleitungen oder arbeitest aktiv bei Analyse- und Implementierungsprojekten im Umfeld von Data Analytics aus fachlicher sowie aus technologischer Sicht mit. Datenanalyse Unterst√ºtzung: Du unterst√ºtzt unsere Kunden eigenst√§ndig bei der Datenanalyse im Rahmen von innovativen Projekten f√ºr Datenintegration bzw. Data Warehouse oder Data Lake und Data Analytics. Datenmodellierung und Implementierung: Du arbeitest an der Konzeption von Datenmodellen, Implementierung von modernen Datenplattformen oder Data-Warehouse-Systemen unter Einsatz moderner SW-L√∂sungen mit. Weiterentwicklung des Beratungsportfolios: Du bringst kontinuierlich dein Know-how zur Weiterentwicklung unseres Beratungsportfolios ein. Akquisitions- und Presales-Unterst√ºtzung: Zus√§tzlich unterst√ºtzt du bei Akquisitions- und Presales-T√§tigkeiten.DEIN PROFILAbgeschlossenes Studium: Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung.Projekterfahrung: Du bringst bereits Projekterfahrung bei Versicherungen mit.Verst√§ndnis f√ºr Architekturen: Aufgrund deiner Erfahrung hast du ein gutes Verst√§ndnis zu Data Warehouse Architekturen, zu Big Data L√∂sungen oder Cloud Analytics Services entwickelt.Teamarbeit: Dar√ºber hinaus arbeitest du gerne mit den Mitarbeitenden im Projektteam.Reisebereitschaft: Eine projektbezogene Reisebereitschaft rundet dein Profil ab.Sprachkenntnisse: Deine sehr guten Deutsch- und guten Englischkenntnisse erm√∂glichen dir eine sichere Kommunikation. Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlf√ºhlen! Kollegial, famili√§r und auf Augenh√∂he ‚Äì wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversit√§t und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso gesch√§tzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht f√ºr unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gef√ºhl. F√ºr das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind gepr√§gt von gegenseitiger Wertsch√§tzung, Anerkennung und Unterst√ºtzung. Das verbindet uns hierarchie√ºbergreifend ‚Äì auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb ‚ÄûDeutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK‚Äú!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell f√ºr alle sorgen daf√ºr, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.

title: wiss. Mitarbeiterin bzw. Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Mechanikdesign f√ºr Gravitationswellenexperimente
description: About the jobMit dem Deutschen Zentrum f√ºr Astrophysik (DZA) entsteht ein neues Forschungszentrum in der Lausitz. Die Entscheidung f√ºr den Aufbau des Zentrums fiel am 29.09.2022 im Rahmen des Wettbewerbs ‚ÄûWissen schafft Perspektiven f√ºr die Region‚Äú, der im Zuge des Strukturst√§rkungsgesetzes Kohleregionen StStG zur St√§rkung der vom Kohleausstieg betroffenen Regionen vom Bundesministerium f√ºr Bildung und Forschung (BMBF), vom Freistaat Sachsen und vom Land Sachsen-Anhalt ausgerufen wurde, um den Wissenschafts- und Innovationsstandort Deutschland zu st√§rken und zur Entwicklung der s√§chsischen Lausitz und des mitteldeutschen Reviers zu attraktiven Zukunftsregionen beizutragen. Als weltweit sichtbares Zeichen f√ºr Innovation wird das DZA neue M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr strategische F√ºhrungsrollen der deutschen Astrophysik schaffen und den Strukturwandel in der Lausitz nachhaltig pr√§gen.Mit Beginn des Jahres 2023 hat eine dreij√§hrige Aufbauphase mit dem Ziel, das DZA als eigenst√§ndige Institution im Jahre 2025 gegr√ºndet zu haben, begonnen. Die Aufbauphase wird gemeinsam vom Deutschen Elektronen Synchrotron (DESY) und der Technische Universit√§t Dresden (TUD) organisiert. Es besteht die einmalige M√∂glichkeit, aktiv beim Aufbau eines gro√üen Forschungszentrums mitzuwirken und die zuk√ºnftigen Strukturen mitzugestalten.Die TUD und das DZA begreifen Diversit√§t als kulturelle Selbstverst√§ndlichkeit und Qualit√§tskriterium einer Exzellenzuniversit√§t. Entsprechend begr√º√üen wir alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber, die sich mit ihrer Leistung und Pers√∂nlichkeit bei uns und mit uns f√ºr den Erfolg aller engagieren m√∂chten.Zum Aufbau des DZA ist zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt am Arbeitsort G√∂rlitz eine Stelle alswiss. Mitarbeiterin bzw. Mitarbeiter (m/w/d)Mechanikdesign f√ºr Gravitationswellenexperimente(bei Vorliegen der pers√∂nlichen Voraussetzungen E 13 TV-L)zun√§chst bis 31.12.2025 (Besch√§ftigungsdauer gem. WissZeitVG) mit der Option auf Verl√§ngerung/Verdauerung am DZA nach dessen Gr√ºndung zu besetzen. Die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf hat einen hohen Stellenwert. Die Stelle ist grunds√§tzlich auch f√ºr Teilzeitbesch√§ftigte geeignet. Bitte vermerken Sie diesen Wunsch in Ihrer Bewerbung.Aufgaben: wissenschaftliche Forschungs- und Entwicklungsarbeiten zu Aufbau und Entwicklung eines unterirdischen Laserinterferometer-Prototyps, welcher als Technologiedemonstrator f√ºr das geplante Einstein-Teleskop, ein Gravitationswellenobservatorium der dritten Generation, dient: Erarbeitung, Aufbau und Charakterisierung der seismisch isolierenden Aufh√§ngung der Testmassen f√ºr den Detektor auf Grundlage existierender Designs Planung und Durchf√ºhrung von Experimenten an der Grenze der Machbarkeit, begrenzt durch seismisches und thermisches Rauschen sowie Quantenrauschen Durchf√ºhrung von Mehrk√∂rper- und Multiphysiksimulationen Forschung an Subsystemen (Absicherung von Teilfunktionen) durch oberirdische Laboraufbauten einschlie√ülich Vakuum- und Kryotechnik √úbertragung der Ergebnisse auf den Anwendungsfall des Einstein-Teleskops wissenschaftlicher Austausch mit Kolleg*innen in der Einstein Telescope Community Ver√∂ffentlichung der erzielten Ergebnisse auf international anerkannten Konferenzen und in Journalen mit Peer Review Anleitung von Bachelor- und Masterstudierenden sowie PromovierendenVoraussetzungen: wissenschaftlicher Hochschulabschluss (Master/Diplom) in Maschinenbau, optischem Ingenieurswesen oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung oder Promotion in einem der genannten Fachbereiche Belastbarkeit, Flexibilit√§t und Anpassungsf√§higkeit in einer sich entwickelnden Organisation hohe Kommunikationsf√§higkeit, Teamf√§higkeit und Eigeninitiative interdisziplin√§re Arbeitsweise Bereitschaft f√ºr Gesch√§ftsreisen verhandlungssicheres Englisch; Deutschkenntnisse sind vorteilhaft w√ºnschenswert sind Kenntnisse in Mehrk√∂rper- und Multiphysiksimulation Regelungstechnik CAD Optischer Interferometrie Vakuum- und KryotechnikWir bieten: die Chance, am Aufbau des gr√∂√üten Forschungszentrums f√ºr Astrophysik in Deutschland mitzuwirken die M√∂glichkeit, den Strukturwandel in der Oberlausitz aktiv mitzugestalten die M√∂glichkeit, die personellen Voraussetzungen zu schaffen, um so die Entdeckung bahnbrechender Forschungsergebnisse zu unterst√ºtzen und einen Beitrag zur Realisierung der Forschungsvorhaben zu leisten ein dynamisches, engagiertes, internationales und interdisziplin√§res Umfeld mit renommierten Expertinnen und Experten aus Wissenschaft und Industrie Verg√ºtung nach TV-L, sowie Konditionen und Sozialleistungen des √∂ffentlichen Dienstes Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf Die M√∂glichkeit eines unbefristeten Arbeitsverh√§ltnisses nach der Aufbauphase. Die TUD und das DZA streben eine Erh√∂hung des Anteils von Frauen an und bitten diese deshalb ausdr√ºcklich um deren Bewerbung. Die Universit√§t ist eine zertifizierte familiengerechte Hochschule. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen sind besonders willkommen. Bei gleicher Eignung werden diese oder ihnen Kraft SGB IX von Gesetzes wegen Gleichgestellte bevorzugt eingestellt.Ihre aussagekr√§ftige Bewerbung senden Sie bitte mit den √ºblichen Unterlagen unter Angabe der Stellenkennung ‚Äûw25-052‚Äú bis zum 23.04.2025 (es gilt der Poststempel bzw. der Zeitstempel auf dem E-Mail-Server der TUD) bevorzugt √ºber das SecureMail Portal der TUD https://securemail.tu-dresden.de als ein PDF‚ÄìDokument an dza@tu-dresden.de bzw. an: Deutsches Zentrum f√ºr Astrophysik (DZA), Herrn Alexander Welk, Postplatz 1, 02826 G√∂rlitz. Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen werden nicht zur√ºckgesandt, bitte reichen Sie nur Kopien ein. Vorstellungskosten werden nicht √ºbernommen.Hinweis zum Datenschutz: Welche Rechte Sie haben und zu welchem Zweck Ihre Daten verarbeitet werden sowie weitere Informationen zum Datenschutz haben wir auf der Webseite https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis f√ºr Sie zur Verf√ºgung gestellt.

title: Senior Backend Software Engineer (d/f/m) with verification
description: About the jobWhy us?We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.As a Senior Backend Software Engineer at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. You will be part of our journey to provide software for medical devices that will help to improve cancer research and diagnostics. Together with your colleagues you will take care of a variety of external and internal APIs and services. You will scope, drive and own projects and services that support scaling in a data intensive setting and lead the improvement of our SaaS product and our services.This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will beWhere your expertise is needed Help us in building the infrastructure to work with medical image data on a large scaleDesign and develop services and core libraries that enable our SaaS platformEnsure reliable, high throughput access to our data for machine learningMaintain and expand our data management infrastructureLead initiatives, evaluate new technologies and their integration into our current codebaseEagerness to take ownership - from inception to completion - without losing focus on the business contextCommunicate closely with our frontend and machine learning teamsPerform code reviews, considering readability, design and performanceWhat We Are Looking ForBachelor and/or Master in a relevant field or extensive work experience4+ years of software development experience, ideally in a data driven environmentStrong background in software development with PythonExperience with cloud providers (GCP, AWS) and their servicesExperience with container orchestration (preferable Kubernetes)Experience with database systemsFamiliar with CI/CD pipelines, code reviews and other standards to keep up code qualityDriven self-starter, well-organized, excellent communication skills and a strong team playerIdeally, you also haveExperience in leading a team from a technical perspectiveExperience with data processing systemsDeveloped software in an regulated environmentWe are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above bonus points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.Our offerJoin a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partnersWork with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startupExpand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programsMentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great expertsFlexible working hours and teleworking policyEnjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per yearWe are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave optionsPick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports and well-beingEnjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environmentJoin us to make a difference!About Usaignostics.com

title: Studium Plus Bachelor Informatik (m/w/d) with verification
description: About the jobUnternehmensbeschreibungContinental entwickelt wegweisende Technologien und Dienste f√ºr die nachhaltige und vernetzte Mobilit√§t der Menschen und ihrer G√ºter. Das 1871 gegr√ºndete Technologieunternehmen bietet sichere, effiziente, intelligente und erschwingliche L√∂sungen f√ºr Fahrzeuge, Maschinen, Verkehr und Transport. Continental erzielte 2021 einen Umsatz von 33,8 Milliarden Euro und besch√§ftigt aktuell mehr als 190.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter in 58 L√§ndern und M√§rkten. Am 8. Oktober 2021 hat das Unternehmen sein 150-j√§hriges Jubil√§um gefeiert.StellenbeschreibungIm Studienmodell ‚ÄûStudium Plus‚Äú lassen sich in nur 4,5 Jahren zwei berufsqualifizierende Abschl√ºsse in der Zeit von einem erwerben. Falls du Interesse hast, gleichzeitig eine Ausbildung zum Mathematischtechnischen Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) und ein Bachelorstudium ‚ÄûInformatik‚Äú zu absolvieren, dann bist du bei uns an der richtigen Stelle! Du studierst dazu an der Hochschule Furtwangen.‚ÄûAls Informatiker (m/w/d) mit dem Abschluss Bachelor of Science im Bereich ‚ÄûInformatik‚Äú bist du Teil eines internationalen Teams in einem sehr dynamischen Umfeld. title: Internship / Master Thesis - Foundation Models for Automated Driving (m/f/d) with verification
description: About the jobWe are CARIAD, the automotive software company of the Volkswagen Group.Our teams build automotive software platforms and digital customer functions for iconic brands like Audi, Volkswagen, and Porsche ‚Äìsupporting the Volkswagen Group in becoming the leading automotive technology company. With CARIDIANS in Germany, the USA, China, Estonia, and India, we are transforming automotive mobility for everyone. Join us and be part of this exciting journey!YOUR TEAMTo support our "ADAS/AD Predevelopment" team, we are currently looking for an intern or thesis student. Our department works on software for automated driving in urban environments. Within this department, we are a team of ambitious and highly motivated experts in the field of environment perception for self-driving vehicles.What You Will DoResearch and assess novel methods for foundation models (Vision-Language and Self-Supervised Models) enhancing the perception and/or planning task in Automated DrivingInvestigate, train and evaluate neural networks for different downstream tasks (i.e. 3D object detection)Develop algorithmic ideas addressing open research challenges related to your topicCooperate closely within the ADAS team to advance the self-driving stackWho You AreEnrolled student in computer science, electrical engineering, data science, robotics or similar field (please specify the expected date of your graduation or end of enrollment)Profound knowledge in machine learning, especially deep neural networks Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, OpenCV, scikit-learn)Experience in perception tasks like object detection, BEV detection would be beneficialStrong communication skills and analytical understandingNICE TO KNOWRemote work options within GermanyDuration: 3 to 6 months35-hour weekAt CARIAD, we value individuality and diversity. We see great strength in our differences and can all benefit from the unique perspectives of others. We strive to employ people with diverse backgrounds who have the expertise, energy and focus to advance our mission. If you're unable to submit an application because of a disability, please contact us at careers@cariad.technology.

title: Data Scientist Traveler with verification
description: About the jobAbout GetYourGuideGetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.Team missionAt GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.You WillDevelop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.Who You AreIdeal candidates will have 2+ years experience in a full time role, covering most of the following areas:Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.How We Set You Up For SuccessMeaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiencesA diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valuedCollaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalitiesEnglish-speaking office environmentContinuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budgetMentorship programs to support your growth and career developmentFlexible working arrangements to support work-life balanceWell-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer FridaysGetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessonsSave on transportation costs with discounted public transportation ticketsSupport your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policiesRelocation assistance if neededAnd more...We look forward to hearing from youUnlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.We are an equal opportunity employerOur commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

title: Wissenschaftliche*r Mitarbeiter*in (Postdoc) in Biochemie und bakterieller Zellbiologie
description: About the jobAusschreibungs-ID: ZE-0034-synmikro-wmz-2025  Eintrittstermin: n√§chstm√∂glich Bewerbungsfrist: 04.05.2025 Entgeltgruppe:  E 13 TV-H Befristung: 30.09.2028 Umfang: VollzeitEintrittstermin: n√§chstm√∂glich / Bewerbungsfrist: 04.05.2025 / Entgeltgruppe: E 13 TV-H / Befristung: 30.09.2028 / Umfang: VollzeitDie 1527 gegr√ºndete Philipps-Universit√§t bietet vielfach ausgezeichnete Lehre f√ºr rund 22.000 Studierende und stellt sich mit exzellenter Forschung in der Breite der Wissenschaft den wichtigen Themen unserer Zeit. Am Fachbereich Biologie und dem Zentrum f√ºr Synthetische Mikrobiologie (SYNMIKRO), AG Thanbichler, sind zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt befristet bis 30.09.2028 zwei drittmittelfinanzierte Vollzeitstellen als Wissenschaftliche*r Mitarbeiter*in (Postdoc)im Rahmen des ERC Advanced Grants ‚ÄûC-SWITCH‚Äú zu besetzen. Die Eingruppierung erfolgt nach Entgeltgruppe 13 des Tarifvertrages des Landes Hessen. Das Projekt untersucht nukleotidabh√§ngige molekulare Schalter ‚Äì eine Gruppe von Proteinen, die h√§ufig eine Schl√ºsselrolle bei der Regulation zellul√§rer Prozesse, wie der Translation, Proteinfaltung, Zytoskelett-Dynamik und Zelldifferenzierung, spielen. Bis vor kurzem ging man davon aus, dass diese ausschlie√ülich die Purinnukleotide ATP oder GTP binden und hydrolysieren. K√ºrzlich wurde jedoch eine neue Klasse von regulatorischen Schaltern (C-Switches) entdeckt, die das Pyrimidin-Nukleotid CTP als Kofaktor nutzen. Recherchen deuten darauf hin, dass C-Switches in Bakterien, Archaeen und Bakteriophagen weit verbreitet sind. Allerdings sind bisher nur wenige Vertreter untersucht worden. Ziel des ERC Advanced Grants C-SWITCH ist, einen umfassenden Einblick in die Biologie dieses neuartigen Typs von Regulatoren zu erhalten und zu kl√§ren, wie diese die Aktivit√§t von Proteinen und zellul√§re Funktionen steuern. Neue C-Switch-Proteine sollen identifiziert, unter Einsatz aktueller in vitro-, in vivo- und in silico-Methoden funktionell untersucht und auf ihr Potenzial als neuartige Angriffspunkte f√ºr antibakterielle Therapien untersucht werden. Diese Arbeiten sollen den Weg zu einem umfassenden Verst√§ndnis von C-Switches als vielseitige Regulatoren in der Biologie ebnen und einen Beitrag zu den weltweiten Bem√ºhungen zur Bek√§mpfung von Antibiotikaresistenzen leisten. Ihre Aufgaben:bioinformatische Identifizierung und Analyse potenzieller C-Switchesbiochemische, biophysikalische und strukturbiologische Analyse gereinigter Kandidatenproteinefunktionelle Charakterisierung von Kandidatenproteinen in vivo mittels genetischer, zellbiologischer und physiologischer Ans√§tzekooperative Forschung in einem multidisziplin√§ren und internationalen UmfeldKommunikation der Forschungsergebnisse durch Publikationen und Konferenzpr√§sentationen Es handelt sich um eine Projektstelle, die nicht nach ¬ß 2, 1 WissZeitVG befristet wird. Ihr Profil:abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Diplom, Master oder vergleichbar) sowie Promotion in einem relevanten Bereich (z. B. Biochemie, Mikrobiologie oder Zellbiologie)umfassende Erfahrung in der Reinigung und in vitro-Charakterisierung von ProteinenExpertise in allen g√§ngigen molekularbiologischen MethodenExpertise in der Nutzung biologischer und strukturbiologischer Standard-Software und Online-Ressourcenoptimalerweise: Erfahrung in der Bioinformatik und/oder Fluoreszenz-MikroskopieErfahrung in der Anleitung wissenschaftlicher Arbeiten Wir bieten:ein dynamisches internationales Forschungsumfeld in einem der Zentren mikrobiologischer Forschung in Europaeine umfassende und aktuelle technische Ausstattung und Facility-Infrastrukturumfangreiche Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeitenkostenlose Nutzung des √ñPNV in Hessen (Landesticket)M√∂glichkeit der Telearbeit / Mobilen ArbeitBetriebliche Altersvorsorge (VBL) Wir f√∂rdern Frauen und fordern sie deshalb ausdr√ºcklich zur Bewerbung auf. In Bereichen, in denen Frauen unterrepr√§sentiert sind, werden Frauen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt ber√ºcksichtigt. Als familienfreundliche Hochschule unterst√ºtzen wir unsere Besch√§ftigten bei der Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf. Eine Reduzierung der Arbeitszeit ist grunds√§tzlich m√∂glich. Menschen mit Behinderung im Sinne des SGB IX (¬ß 2, Abs. 2, 3) werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt. Bewerbungs- und Vorstellungskosten werden nicht erstattet. Kontakt f√ºr weitere InformationenProf. Dr. Martin Thanbichler+49 6421-28 21809 thanbichler@uni-marburg.de Bitte bewerben Sie sich bis zum 04.05.2025 √ºber den Bewerbungs-Button auf unserer Homepage.

title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
description: About the jobAs a Data Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.Your impactConducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.Who you areA completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!What makes us specialOur employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‚Äòve created a range of perks for our employees:A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.Who we areWe are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.

title: Automotive Safety Expert for AI-based System - ISO 8800 / ISO 21448 / AI-Based Systems
description: About the jobAutomotive Safety Expert for AI-based System - ISO 8800 / ISO 21448 / AI-Based SystemsFull-Time - PermanentOnsite - MunichWe are currently partnered with a world-leading research center in Germany working on cutting-edge next-generation projects within AD/ADAS. The team is looking to expand their headcount with an Automotive Safety Expert AI-based System. Responsibilities:Cultivate an innovation-driven mindset to explore new approaches for achieving safety goals, pushing the boundaries, and advancing the state-of-the-art in AI-based safety.Conduct comprehensive safety analyses of AI-based systems in accordance with ISO 8800, ISO 21448, and other relevant safety standards.Define and review safety concepts, including mechanisms designed to safeguard AI-based systems.Collaborate closely with system engineering and development teams to design and review AD/ADAS system safety architectures, ensuring coverage of fail-operational, fail-degraded, and fail-safe aspects.Stay current with industry standards, regulations, trends, and emerging best practices, and share key insights within the organization to influence our ADS solutions.Qualifications:MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent experience in automotive system/software safety engineering.Strong understanding of AI-based systems, including neural network architectures, hardware and software platforms for AI, and their failure modes.Practical experience in analyzing the nominal performance of AI-based systems, determining performance metrics, and implementing performance improvements.In-depth knowledge of automotive safety engineering, particularly in relation to ISO 26262, ISO 21448, functional and technical safety concepts, and safety analysis methods such as HAZOP, HARA, FMEA, FTA, and STPA, with a focus on SOTIF and emerging AI regulations.If you are interested in this Automotive Safety Expert for AI-based System position, please send a CV to ww@eu-recruit.comBy applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice (https://eu-recruit.com/about-us/privacy-notice/)

title: Staff Software Engineer - PhariaKernel (f/m/d) with verification
description: About the jobOverviewAs a Staff Software Engineer at Aleph Alpha, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing software systems that power our AI-driven products. You will be part of one of our engineering teams, contributing to architectural decisions, writing high-quality code, and ensuring best practices are followed throughout the software development lifecycle. The ideal candidate is a skilled engineer with a strong technical foundation, a passion for AI technology, and a proven track record of delivering impactful software solutions.Your ResponsibilitiesYou will be working on the PhariaKernel, a serverless runtime for AI skills. PhariaKernel is part of PhariaAI and interacts with almost all other components. PhariaAI delivers souvereign AI to enterprises.Software Development: Design, implement, and maintain scalable, high-performance software solutions that support AI-driven products. Technical Contribution: Work alongside senior engineers and cross-functional teams to drive software architecture, development, and optimization efforts. Code Quality & Review: Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code while conducting peer reviews to uphold high coding standards. Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, AI engineers, and data scientists to translate product requirements into actionable development plans. Performance Optimization: Ensure software solutions meet performance, scalability, and reliability requirements. Problem Solving: Troubleshoot technical issues and contribute to the resolution of software-related challenges during development and in production. Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in AI and software engineering. Your ProfileBachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Strong experience in software engineering, with expertise in designing and implementing complex systems. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Rust, or similar, along with experience in relevant frameworks and libraries. Solid understanding of software architecture principles, design patterns, and best practices for building scalable and maintainable software. Experience with AI or machine learning applications is a plus. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is desirable. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work through complex technical challenges. Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment. What You Can Expect From UsBe part of an AI revolution! 30 days of paid vacation Access to a variety of fitness & wellness offerings via Wellhub Mental health support through nilo.health Substantially subsidized company pension plan for your future security Subsidized Germany-wide transportation ticket Budget for additional technical equipment Flexible working hours and a hybrid working model for better work-life balance Virtual Stock Option Plan

title: Data Engineer (m/f/d) - Supply Data Solutions with verification
description: About the jobWe are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Supply Data Solutions Team, dedicated to building and maintaining high-impact data products. In this role, you will collaborate with business stakeholders to develop reliable and well-engineered solutions that drive insights and optimize business processes. If you enjoy solving complex problems through code and want to contribute to a more connected and efficient organization, read on!What you will doBuild and maintain data pipelines that deliver actionable insights through various channels (Excel reports, BigQuery tables, Looker dashboards)Develop practical optimization solutions for business challengesOwn your data products end-to-end: from infrastructure as code to production monitoringWrite efficient Python code using AWS (Lambda, Batch, Step Functions)Design and implement robust data models that serve business needsManage CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure deployments using GitLab and CloudFormationWork directly with business stakeholders to understand their needs and implement effective solutionsMonitor and improve systems proactivelyMentor junior colleaguesWho you areStrong software engineering background with solid programming fundamentalsExperience in building maintainable, production-grade applicationsStrong analytical skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issuesSolid understanding of SQL and data modeling principlesExperience with cloud services (AWS/GCP) and version control (Git)Proactive mindset and ability to identify improvement opportunitiesUnderstanding of data warehouse concepts and best practicesSelf-driven approach to problem-solving and learningBenefits Hybrid working  Fresh fruit every day  Sports courses  Exclusive employee discounts  Free drinks  Language courses  Company parties  Help in the relocation process  Mobility subsidy  State-of-the-art technology  Central Location  Flexible Working Hours  Professional training  Dog-friendly office  AY Academy  Feedback Culture  Job Bikes You Are The Core Of About You.We take responsibility for creating an inclusive and exceptional environment where all genders, nationalities, and ethnicities feel welcomed and accepted exactly as they are. title: Lead Data Scientist | Assisted relocation to Barcelona with verification
description: About the jobWho we are:Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.Who we're looking for:We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist with experience in mentoring and leading larger projects, ensuring a high level of quality across the team. The ideal candidate will be excited to tackle a broad array of challenges in our two-sided marketplace, from machine learning to analytical problems, in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. We are particularly excited about candidates with expertise in Search, Ranking, and Recommendations, as we have ambitious initiatives in this space.What does Data Science mean at Rover?At Rover we obsess over our customers‚Äô needs, relying heavily on data to improve the customer journey, and to continuously optimize outcomes in our marketplaces. Our entire organization is metric driven and underpinned by data science and analytics. Data scientists are responsible for defining the right metrics, understanding nuanced marketplace dynamics, and developing models and algorithms that power our business and technology.You will be joining the Booking Data Science team, which works specifically on problems of matching (mostly through search and recommendations) and retention (through search and other initiatives in collaboration with Lifecycle Marketing and Operations).As a Lead Data Scientist in the Booking Data Science team you will:Iterate on Rover‚Äôs search ranking algorithm by developing new contextual features, experimenting with different objective function formulations and researching possible improvements such as with distance, location, past user history.Lead larger cross-functional data science projects, building a roadmap of iterations and helping define milestones in collaboration with product, engineering and data engineering. Act as a project lead, organizing and mentoring more junior team members, while ensuring high quality output.Dive deep into marketplace dynamics, extracting valuable insights and providing strategic recommendations to shape our product offerings, using your skills in data mining and data visualization.Implement best practices in machine learning model development, deployment and monitoring, by working with Data Platform and prioritizing operational improvements.Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines that serve as the backbone for informed decision-making, monitoring of our systems and features to our models.Perform statistical analysis to draw inferences, forecast future trends, and predict user behavior. You will also use statistics to estimate the expected impact of interventions or to establish causal relationships when A/B testing is not possible.Your Toolset Includes:SQL - you would be comfortable leading a SQL 101 courseProficient Python and the most common data science libraries ‚Äì scikit-learn, xgboost, numpy, scipy, pandasData visualization (we use Mode as our data visualization tool, but you could have experience in any other tool or library such as Tableau, Sisense, Matplotlib, ggplot)Experience with big data technology and infrastructure (e.g. Spark, Redshift, AWS) a plusYour Qualifications:At least 6 years of experience in a business setting as a data scientist and at least 1 year of mentoring or managing other data scientistsBS in a quantitative discipline; advanced degree (MS or PhD) a plusUnderstanding of foundational statistical concepts including probability, hypothesis testing, and experimental designRobust foundation and in-depth experience with one or more contemporary machine learning or predictive modeling algorithms, such as ensemble methods, natural language processing (NLP) techniques, clustering algorithms or deep learning methods. Specifically, solid experience with Search, Ranking and Recommendations will be preferredExperience working side-by-side with coordinated teams of developers, analysts, product managers, marketers, and operatorsExperience in a two-sided marketplace is a plusWhy We‚Äôll Hire You:You‚Äôre a deeply analytical thinker who is passionate about finding structure in data, and using data to drive real value to the end user (and thus the business).You are excited both about analysis and model building. You‚Äôre not afraid to tackle ambiguous analytical questions or impactful production-facing models, depending on business needs.You are passionate about our core business. You will instinctively dig into every aspect of what it means to be a pet sitter and a pet owner on the Rover platform.You can take abstractly defined problems and work with (imperfect) data to drive decisions.You‚Äôre able to fit and interpret results of statistical models, as well as report on key assumptions and limitations.You show a pattern of being self-started, self-taught and self-directed.You favor open communication with willingness to ask and answer questions.You are output- and outcome-oriented.You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to break apart complex processes for non-technical stakeholders.You play nicely with others (and dogs).Benefits of Working at Rover.com:Competitive compensationLong-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payoutPermanent contractPension PlanMeal tickets through CobeeGenerous PTO AllowanceHybrid schedulePrivate health insuranceDiscounted Gym MembershipBring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platformFlexible work hours, sometimes you‚Äôll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we‚Äôre pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and timeGrab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself goingRegular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and moreLocations:This position is located at our Barcelona officeWe assist with relocation to BarcelonaRover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

title: Working Student Data Engineer (f/m/d)
description: About the jobDeine AufgabenMoving our data warehouse towards a new software stack. Currently, we‚Äôre switching to DBT for our data transformation needs. title: Abschlussarbeit (Bachelor- oder Masterarbeit) with verification

title: Internship (m/f/d) - AI Framework for Automated Forecasting
description: About the jobAt ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.This position reports toR&D Team LeadYour Role And ResponsibilitiesLooking for a taste of working life in an international, future-focused corporate group? Then join us as an intern (m/f/d) and familiarise yourself with a suitable department for 3 to 6 months. You will be involved in large-scale projects and perform a defined set of duties independently. Use your internship to build a network and become familiar with our company. The following tasks and responsibilities will be part of your role: Implement an AutoML-based pipeline (e.g., data preprocessing, feature selection, algorithm selection, model evaluation, etc.). Enhance and refine the framework by improving its structure and usability, ensuring a seamless experience for users. Contribute to making the solution intuitive and accessible through thoughtful design and implementation. Develop detailed and user-friendly documentation to guide future developers and users, enabling effective utilization and further development of the solution. Expand the capabilities of the software by integrating additional algorithms and features. You'll have the opportunity to innovate and contribute your own ideas to shape the future of the solution. Drive an independent work task as a project team member, taking ownership and bringing your creativity and technical skills to the table.Qualifications For The RoleCurrently studying Mathematics, Physics, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related field.You have a strong understanding of both traditional machine learning models and deep learning techniques, and you're excited to apply them to real-world scenarios.You have hands-on programming experience, particularly in Python, with a knack for writing clean, well-structured and maintainable code.Ideally you have prior experience developing ML-based forecasting models and are familiar with automated machine learning concepts and tools.You have worked with platforms like MLflow, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and are comfortable using libraries such as scikit-learn, Keras, pandas, NumPy or other ML frameworks.You have a good grasp of software engineering principles, version control systems (e.g. Git) and collaborative development practices.Fluent in English (written and spoken); German is a plus but not mandatory.A motivated team player with the ability to work independently in an international, interdisciplinary environment.Strong communication and interpersonal skills combined with enthusiasm for professional and personal growth.More About UsWe value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory We believe in fairness, so interns who join us will benefit from our expertise as they expand their own knowledge. Your time is valuable, so you will receive appropriate remuneration for the duration of the internship. Please state whether you are applying for a voluntary internship or undertaking a mandatory internship, and be sure to enclose your certificate of enrolment. In the case of mandatory internships, please include the corresponding extract from your university's internship guidelines. Interested? Then we look forward to receiving your informative application (cover letter, CV, certificate of enrolment, current transcript of grades and other supporting documents) through our online careers tool.

title: wiss. Mitarbeiterin bzw. Mitarbeiter (m/w/d)
description: About the jobDie Technische Universit√§t Dresden (TUD) z√§hlt als Exzellenzuniversit√§t zu den leistungsst√§rksten Forschungseinrichtungen Deutschlands. 1828 gegr√ºndet, ist sie heute eine global bezogene, regional verankerte Spitzenuniversit√§t, die innovative Beitr√§ge zur L√∂sung weltweiter Herausforderungen leisten will. Diese bundesweit herausragende Vielfalt an F√§chern erm√∂glicht der Universit√§t, die Interdisziplinarit√§t zu f√∂rdern und Wissenschaft in die Gesellschaft zu tragen. Sie begreift Diversit√§t als kulturelle Selbstverst√§ndlichkeit und Qualit√§tskriterium einer Exzellenzuniversit√§t. Entsprechend begr√º√üen wir alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber, die sich mit ihrer Leistung und Pers√∂nlichkeit bei uns und mit uns f√ºr den Erfolg aller engagieren m√∂chten.An der Fakult√§t Maschinenwesen, Institut f√ºr Naturstofftechnik, ist an der Professur f√ºr Bioverfahrenstechnik, vorbehaltlich der F√∂rderung durch den EFRE und den Freistaat Sachsen, zum 01.06.2025 eine Stelle alswiss. Mitarbeiterin bzw. Mitarbeiter (m/w/d)(bei Vorliegen der pers√∂nlichen Voraussetzungen E 13 TV-L)bis 30.11.2026 (Besch√§ftigungsdauer gem. WissZeitVG), mit 85 % der regelm√§√üigen w√∂chentlichen Arbeitszeit, zu besetzen. Es besteht die Gelegenheit zur eigenen wiss. Weiterqualifikation.Aufgaben: wiss. Forschungs- und Entwicklungst√§tigkeiten zum Aufbau einer Versuchsanlage f√ºr die biotechnische Herstellung eines L√∂sungsmittels. Die Anlage soll die Untersuchung des Zusammenspiels aller Prozessschritte im Herstellungsverfahren erm√∂glichen. Sie umfasst insbesondere Lagertanks, eine Fermentationsstufe zur mikrobiellen Herstellung des L√∂sungsmittels, eine Kondensationsstufe zur Produktabtrennung, Messtechnik und eine Steuereinheit. Die einzustellende Person soll die Versuchsanlage (vortechnischer Ma√üstab) im Austausch mit anderen Teammitgliedern der Professur dimensionieren, Systemkomponenten ausw√§hlen und Angebote einholen, die Anlage aufbauen und im Realbetrieb testen. Dar√ºber hinaus soll sie an Veranstaltungen des Arbeitskreises und Workshops teilnehmen und Studierende projektbezogen bei der Anfertigung von Abschlussarbeiten (Bachelor/Master/Diplom) unterst√ºtzen. Zu den Aufgaben z√§hlen weiterhin die regelm√§√üige Berichterstattung √ºber die eigenen Entwicklungsfortschritte gegen√ºber den wiss. Betreuerinnen und Betreuern sowie die Ver√∂ffentlichung der Ergebnisse der Forschungsarbeiten in individuellen und kooperativen Publikationen.Voraussetzungen: wiss. Hochschulabschluss (MSc., Dipl.) auf dem Gebiet der Verfahrenstechnik oder angrenzender Gebiete wie Anlagenbau oder Automatisierungstechnik. Wir sind auf der Suche nach Hochschulabsolventinnen bzw. Hochschulabsolventen mit hoher Motivation und F√§higkeit zum kreativen und eigenst√§ndigen Arbeiten, hohem fach√ºbergreifendem Lernwillen und Spa√ü an Teamarbeit, sehr guten m√ºndlichen und schriftlichen Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in der deutschen und englischen Sprache und der wiss. Publikation in Wort und Schrift. Erfahrungen auf dem Gebiet der Biotechnologie sind erw√ºnscht.Die TUD strebt eine Erh√∂hung des Anteils von Frauen an und bittet diese deshalb ausdr√ºcklich um deren Bewerbung. Die Universit√§t ist eine zertifizierte familiengerechte Hochschule. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen sind besonders willkommen. Bei gleicher Eignung werden diese oder ihnen Kraft SGB IX von Gesetzes wegen Gleichgestellte bevorzugt eingestellt.Ihre aussagekr√§ftige Bewerbung senden Sie bitte mit den √ºblichen Unterlagen bis zum 25.04.2025 (es gilt der Poststempel der Zentralen Poststelle bzw. der Zeitstempel auf dem E-Mail-Server der TUD) bevorzugt √ºber das SecureMail Portal der TU Dresden https://securemail.tu-dresden.de als ein PDF-Dokument an thomas_walther@tu-dresden.de oder an: TU Dresden, Fakult√§t Maschinenwesen, Institut f√ºr Naturstofftechnik, Professur f√ºr Bioverfahrenstechnik, Herrn Prof. Thomas Walther, Helmholtzstr. 10, 01069 Dresden. Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen werden nicht zur√ºckgesandt, bitte reichen Sie nur Kopien ein. Vorstellungskosten werden nicht √ºbernommen.Hinweis zum Datenschutz: Welche Rechte Sie haben und zu welchem Zweck Ihre Daten verarbeitet werden sowie weitere Informationen zum Datenschutz haben wir auf der Webseite https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis f√ºr Sie zur Verf√ºgung gestellt.

title: PhD Candidate - Radar-Camera Fusion for Advanced Autonomous Parking Functions (m/f/d) with verification
description: About the jobWe are CARIAD, the automotive software company of the Volkswagen Group.Our teams build automotive software platforms and digital customer functions for iconic brands like Audi, Volkswagen, and Porsche ‚Äìsupporting the Volkswagen Group in becoming the leading automotive technology company. With CARIDIANS in Germany, the USA, China, Estonia, and India, we are transforming automotive mobility for everyone.Join us and be part of this exciting journey!YOUR TEAMThe aim of our PhD Program is to promote innovative topics that are relevant to CARIAD. We cooperate with top universities and bring new research projects to life. Our PhD candidates get the opportunity to create new innovations in their projects for CARIAD and the respective scientific field. All PhD projects are accompanied by a supervisor professor and a dedicated CARIAD mentor. title: Masterand (w/m/d) Abschlussarbeit: Scan to BIM ‚Äì Digital Twin with verification
description: About the jobUnternehmensbeschreibungWir stehen jeden Morgen daf√ºr auf, eine lebenswerte Zukunft f√ºr nachfolgende Generationen zu schaffen. Mit Leidenschaft und modernsten Technologien. We unite. Join us at Dreso and let‚Äôs create a world we want to live in.StellenbeschreibungIm Rahmen dieser Masterarbeit hast Du die M√∂glichkeit, in die Welt des Building Information Modeling (BIM) einzutauchen und ma√ügeblich zur Optimierung von as-built Modellen beizutragen. Dein Schwerpunkt liegt dabei auf der Analyse von Gro√üprojekten im Bereich BIM, speziell hinsichtlich der erreichten Genauigkeiten und Abweichungen von as-built Modellen. Du wirst die relevanten Normen in Deutschland, √ñsterreich und der Schweiz untersuchen und deren Anforderungen an Vermessungsleistungen herausarbeiten.Ziel ist es, einen praxisnahen Leitfaden zu erstellen, der die tats√§chlich geforderten Genauigkeiten sowie den Level of Accuracy (LoA) pr√§zise definiert. Der Output Deiner Arbeit umfasst eine umfassende Guideline und einen Bauelement-Katalog auf Basis des IFC4 Standards, der eine klare Darstellung des LoA f√ºr as-built Modelle erm√∂glicht und so eine wertvolle Best Practice-Grundlage f√ºr die Branche schafft.Die Schwerpunkte k√∂nnen in Absprache an den Arbeitsstand bzw. an die notwendigen Schritte individuell angepasst werden.Diese Abschlussarbeit kann in Kombination mit einer Werkstudentent√§tigkeit oder auch mit einem (Vor-)Praktikum absolviert werden. So kannst Du Dein theoretisches Wissen direkt in die Praxis umsetzen, aktiv an spannenden Projekten mitarbeiten und gleichzeitig Dein Netzwerk auf- und ausbauen!Thema der Masterarbeit: ‚ÄûErarbeitung einer Best Practice Unterlage zur Anwendung des LoA bei as-built Modellen‚ÄúAnalyse von Gro√üprojekten in BIM hinsichtlich as-built ModelleUntersuchung der erreichten Genauigkeiten und Abweichungen (beispielhaft)Analyse der Normen in Deutschland, √ñsterreich und der Schweiz hinsichtlich VermessungsleistungenErstellung eines Leitfadens f√ºr praktikable und tats√§chlich geforderte GenauigkeitenDefinition des Level of Accuracy (LoA)Erstellung eines Bauelement-Katalogs auf Basis des IFC4 StandardsQualifikationenStudium im Bereich Architektur, Bauingenieurwesen, Geb√§udetechnik/TGA, Innenarchitektur oder in einem vergleichbaren StudiengangSicherer Umgang mit den MS-Office-ProduktenFundierte Kenntnisse in CAD-Anwendungen (Autodesk Revit, SketchUp) und AdobeDeutschkenntnisse auf selbstst√§ndigem Anwendungsniveau (mindestens B2)Motivation, sich in einem spannenden und zukunftsorientierten Arbeitsumfeld aktiv einzubringen, weiterzuentwickeln und mitzugestaltenZus√§tzliche InformationenZur Sicherstellung deiner Work-Life-Balance bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit zum mobilen ArbeitenDeine berufliche und pers√∂nliche Entwicklung f√∂rdern wir durch ein individuell zugeschnittenes Studierenden-MentoringDeine Gesundheit unterst√ºtzen wir mit Gesundheitskursen wie bspw. Yoga oder der bewegten Pause Kn√ºpfe wertvolle Kontakte innerhalb Drees & Sommer und erweitere dein berufliches Netzwerk Zus√§tzliche attraktive Angebote mit Rabatten im Corporate-Benefits-Portal. title: Product Manager (B2B SaaS) (m/f/d)
description: About the jobAt Shiftmove, we develop products that solve real-world problems with speed and impact. customer success teams, ensuring clear communication and alignment on project goals Contribute to Strategy and Execution: Collaborate with senior management and key stakeholders to refine and execute the product vision and roadmap, ensuring alignment with strategic business objectives, customer needs, and market demandsKey Initiatives: Remote Condition Monitoring: Implement enhancements for real-time vehicle health monitoring without additional hardware Vehicle Procurement: Streamline the procurement process to improve efficiency and decision-making Advanced Reporting Capabilities: Upgrade our reporting to enhance performance and support strategic fleet management decisions AI/ML Opportunities: Explore the use of artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies to optimize product features, enhance data analytics capabilities, and automate complex processes, creating more intelligent and responsive systemsWhat Success Looks LikeFirst 6 Months: Refine the fleet acquisition process to enhance customer satisfaction and improve activation ratesBegin planning and discovery for integrating vehicle telematics data to enhance fleet management intelligenceDevelop and start implementing a roadmap for new features tailored to the needs of our customersLong-Term:Establish and maintain a framework for ongoing product improvement that drives increased customer satisfaction and business growthCultivate a product culture that embraces innovation, efficiency, and data-driven decision-makingYour ProfileExtensive experience as a Product Manager, ideally in B2B SaaS, Mobility, or Fleet ManagementProven track record managing the entire product lifecycle, from conception and design, to development support, release management and deprecationDemonstrated ability to engage directly with customers, translating their pain points and feedback into actionable insights that drive product enhancements and iterationsStrong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset, complemented by excellent communication abilitiesProficient in leveraging product analytics tools and methodologies to inform decision-making, measure impact, and drive product improvementsExperienced in designing and executing product experiments to validate hypotheses, uncover insights, and iterate quickly based on customer feedbackBusiness fluent in German and EnglishWhat Makes This Role solutions to launching new features that anticipate market trends Collaborative Environment: Thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional setting that encourages innovation and values each team member's inputWhy Join Us?Be part of a forward-thinking company that leads with innovation and a strong focus on customer needsEngage with complex, interesting projects that allow you to make a visible impact title: Financial Crime Compliance Advisor with verification
company: Merck Finck | A Quintet Private Bank
description: About the jobPurpose of the JobQuintet Private Bank is a leading private bank in the wealth management sector. We are committed to our clients and their families, and pride ourselves on our personalised service based on a deep understanding of what clients want to achieve. Compared to others, we are small (<2,000 employees across 50 European and UK locations) with an ambition to stay true to our purpose to be the most trusted fiduciary of family wealth. When you join Quintet you are joining a company that values diversity of background, equal access to opportunities, career development, collaboration and inclusiveness. We want our employees to feel proud of being part of a company that is committed to do the right thing. You will have the opportunity to grow your career while developing personally and professionally through various resources and programmes.The FCC Advisor (Director) for Merck Finck holds a key role in the compliance team responsible for ensuring that operations in Merck Finck are effective in identifying, managing and mitigating Financial Crime risks. They ensure timely advice is provided to the business and that the policies and procedures and the risk and control framework of the first line are continuously reviewed and challenged where and when required. This ensures that the business is taking mitigating actions to maintain a robust and stringent compliance risk management within the Group risk appetite and that escalation is made through appropriate governance channels when the business is not addressing critical issues.Key AccountabilitiesArticulate Financial Crime risks for Merck Finck in line with Group Policies, and any local regulatory requirements not covered within Group Policy (documented through country addendum). Maintain an effective control framework and to ensure compliance with all relevant external laws & regulations, internal codes and policies and good market practices, with primary focus on Merck Finck Drive and oversee FCC support of high risk clients files for the business. Ensure that senior management are appropriately advised of all material Compliance related matters. Oversee the critical Compliance policies and systems that impact Merck Finck and ensure that the Group‚Äôs exposure Financial Crime risks is managed in a commercially sensitive, practical and cost effective manner. Provide advisory services to < Country/Branch Name ‚Äì Country > business in order to ensure clear understanding of compliance risk exposure with respect to clients, transactions and products and work with the business on incorporating appropriate controls to mitigate those risks. Manage the relationship with relevant regulators on behalf of Merck Finck business. Manage and oversee second line governance covering Financial Crime risk exposures ensuring analysis and reporting is provided to Merck Finck local governance as well as Group governance committees. Ensure independence of the first line of defence, thereby maintaining an objective assessment of risk exposure. Support the business and Head of Compliance of Merck Finck, and other colleagues on all FCC related matters. Support the Head of Compliance of < Country/Branch Name ‚Äì Country >, in deploying strategic functional objectives and delivering critical services to the Group & country in an effective and-efficient manner. Knowledge And ExperienceExperience as a regulator, or a compliance specialist across all areas of FCC risks within a global firm in the financial services industry. Detailed and extensive knowledge of the financial institution structure (Private Banking specific experience is an advantage). Ability to develop practical and optimized solutions to complex issues. Attributes and QualitiesExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience of dealing with individuals at all levels of the business. Consistently achieve objectives set for them and take action to improve their own performance. Strong organisational skills. Strong conflict management skills. Collaborative working style with colleagues and broader stakeholders within a cross-border and line of business matrix. Technical SkillsFamiliarity with Policy and procedures impact analysis and deployment. ICA ML/FCC qualifications preferred. A graduate in any discipline with exposure in a relevant risk or audit profile. Experience in establishing and maintaining risk and controls framework for ML/CTF, Sanctions, ABC, Fraud, tax evasion risks. Languages SkillsProficient in English required Knowledge of other Quintet languages is an advantage

title: Master Student - Fluidic cartridges for next generation cell manufacturing (m|f|d) with verification
description: About the jobCompany DescriptionJoin usFor 35 years, we have been developing cutting-edge science and technology to empower biomedical research and personalized medicine. We combine excellence from more than 60 disciplines in natural sciences, engineering, and informatics to significantly contribute to biomedical sciences. We encourage a creative working environment driven by pioneering spirit ‚Äì to seek new horizons ‚Äì boldly envisioning the future and turning it into reality. Today, more than 4,700 experts from over 50 countries contribute to our sustainable success.Job DescriptionThis position offers you a unique opportunity to obtain your master‚Äôs degree while gaining insight into cutting-edge technologies for consumable cartridge development in the field of cell and gene therapies.Your master thesis will aim to develop the next generation of fluidic consumables. Your work will focus on the integration and automation of different functionalities into consumable cartridges.You will apply a broad range of the development process, from the concept phase to design and prototype manufacturing (3D printing and prototype tooling). Upon completion of your training, you will independently perform experiments and data analysis.You will present and discuss your results with your team as well as other departments in the company.The findings of your study will contribute to the advancement of our innovative technologies for Cell and Gene Therapies.QualificationsYou are an enrolled student and passionate about science and are about to begin your master's thesis in engineering, biotechnology or a related field. You have demonstrated your ability to work both independently and in an interdisciplinary team with excellent problem-solving and communication skills.You have good organizational and analytical skills.Your motivation, teamwork spirit and excellent written and spoken English skills complete your profile.First experience in medical engineering, plastics development or sensor technologies is a plus.Additional InformationYour workplace is Bergisch Gladbach.What We OfferAn exciting project in the field of adoptive T cell therapiesA modern workplace and exciting opportunities in the development of technologies with a secure futureCross-border intercultural cooperation and short communication channelsA collegial corporate culture and flexible working hours enable time management on your termsPersonalized employee development program: specialist and personal training courses provided by our training universityDiverse corporate benefits about employee health and staff eventsDiversity is the bedrock of our creativity.Our mission: To innovate treatments and technologies and tackle the world‚Äôs most serious health challenges. And that‚Äôs why we connect the dots ‚Äìacross various disciplines, linking different perspectives, skills, and abilities.You and your talent are welcome here in our inclusive and collaborative environment. So come as you are. Regardless of gender, sexual identity, age, ethnicity, religion or disability.Become part or our team and focus on pushing the borders of medicine.Contact usIf you have the skills and qualifications for this position, please use the link to send us your details (application letter, curriculum vitae, references and certificates). Please give us some idea of when you can start and the kind of salary you are looking for, outlining the reasons you have made this application.
