title: Quantitative Researcher - Digital Assets Liquidity (EMEA Remote) with verification
description: About the jobAbout KeyrockSince our beginnings in 2017, we've grown to be a leading change-maker in the digital asset space, renowned for our partnerships and innovation.Today, we rock with over 180 team members around the world. Our diverse team hails from 42 nationalities, with backgrounds ranging from DeFi natives to PhDs. Predominantly remote, we have hubs in London, Brussels and Singapore, also soon to be Paris, and host regular online and offline hangouts to keep the crew tight.We are trading on more than 80 exchanges, and working with a wide array of asset issuers. As a well-established market maker, our distinctive expertise led us to expand rapidly. Today, our services span market making, options trading, high-frequency trading, OTC, and DeFi trading desks.But we‚Äôre more than a service provider. We‚Äôre an initiator. We're pioneers in adopting the Rust Development language for our algorithmic trading, and champions of its use in the industry. We support the growth of Web3 startups through our Accelerator Program. We upgrade ecosystems by injecting liquidity into promising DeFi, RWA, and NFT protocols. And we push the industry's progress with our research and governance initiatives.At Keyrock, we're not just envisioning the future of digital assets. We're actively building it.What we are looking for...A dynamic, experienced Quantitative Researcher to work in collaboration with our engineers, data scientists and quantitative traders to support our market-making and proprietary trading initiatives.Job DescriptionAn ideal candidate lives and breathes math and statistics, enjoys digging into data, loves solving hard, ambiguous challenges and ideally has a track record of adding significant, tangible value to trading businesses. Your mission will be to help shape Keyrock‚Äôs trading strategies. Tasks:market-making and optimal quoting of HL assets (CeFi and DeFi); researching and building proprietary trading algorithms for high- and mid-frequency strategies on spot, perpetual, and futures/forwards markets; trading and hedging both cryptocurrencies and FX. Background And ExperienceAs a Quantitative Trading researcher, you have strong analytical capabilities and are fully comfortable with financial markets and trading algorithms in order books. You are/have:3+ years experience in quantitative research at a bank, asset manager, or trading firmStrong attention to detailGood communicatorProgramming skills in PythonPrior experience in building or researching trading algorithmsDesirable: a master-level degree or PhD in a relevant hard science eg. maths, statistics, astronomy, physics, quant finance etc. A passion for algorithmic tradingThe ability to take ownership of a project while collaborating on it with colleaguesFluency in EnglishOur recruitment philosophyWe value self-awareness and powerful communication skills in our recruitment process. We seek fiercely passionate people who understand themselves and their career goals. We're after those with the right skills and a conscious choice to join our field. The perfect fit? A crypto enthusiast who‚Äôs driven, collaborative, acts with ownership and delivers solid, scalable outcomes.Our offerA competitive salary package, with various benefits depending on the method of engagement (employee or Contractor). Autonomy in your time management thanks to flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely The freedom to create your own entrepreneurial experience by being part of a team of people in search of excellence As an employer we are committed to building a positive and collaborative work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, and hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.Due to the nature of our business and external requirements, we perform background checks on all potential employees, passing which is a prerequisite to join Keyrock.https://keyrock.com/careers/

a consultative mindset to develop robust partnershipsBreak down complex problems into distinct parts, manage uncertainty, and understand interdependencies, presenting objective insights paired with storytelling to guide decision-making while building and maintaining outstanding relationships with key stakeholdersContinuously strive for better performance, outcomes-focused, driven to achieve objectives, and able to manage through change effectivelyPreferred:  MBA or Graduate-level Degree Considerable experience in applying data analysis techniques to advise business decisionsProven experience in acting as a strategic thought partner to teams; Entrepreneurial approachExperience working in a matrix environment with international team members using influence without authorityExpertise in standard analysis and presentation software; Ability to merge data sets and report findingsPersuasive written and verbal communication skillsStrong attention to detailRelocation benefits are not available for this job posting. Who we areA healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Junior AI Engineer with verification
skills: ['Artificial Intelligence (AI)'; 'Data Science'; 'Machine Learning'; 'Python (Programming Language)'; 'Software Development'; 'Statistics'; 'Computer Science'; 'Computer Vision'; 'Deep Learning'; 'Programming']
description: About the jobCompany DescriptionNexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.Job DescriptionWe're not just another tech company; we're revolutionizing how millions of people experience their digital experience.At Nexthink, we‚Äôre the pioneers of Digital Employee Experience (DEX) technology. Using a powerful mix of real-time analytics, clever automation, and cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning, we're helping some of the world's biggest companies create digital workplaces that delight their employees at work. Think of us as the architects of the future workplace!We‚Äôre a team of passionate tech enthusiasts, problem solvers, and innovators. At Nexthink, collaboration is key‚Äîwe encourage curiosity, creativity, and bold thinking. If you love solving real-world challenges and want to be part of an exciting growth journey, you might just be the Nexthinker we‚Äôre looking for!Are you passionate about AI and eager to turn that enthusiasm into real-world impact? Do you want to learn from experienced AI engineers while working on cutting-edge solutions? If so, this is your opportunity to join Nexthink as a Junior AI Engineer!As a Junior AI Engineer, you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic and collaborative AI team, gaining hands-on experience in building AI solutions deployed on the cloud with an impact on millions of employees worldwide.This role offers an incredible opportunity to:Build your expertise in modern AI technologies (LLM, AI agents, ‚Ä¶) and frameworks (Python, Langchain, ‚Ä¶) Learn how to develop scalable and resilient software in a cloud production-environment Contribute to meaningful projects that impact our customers Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team where questions are encouragedGrow your career with mentorship from experienced AI and software engineers If you're ready to start your journey in AI engineering and are excited about learning while doing so, we want to hear from you!Even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply. We value potential and enthusiasm just as much as experience!QualificationsWe're not expecting you to know everything! What we're looking for is:MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, ML or related fieldA solid foundation in AI, ML and software engineeringGenuine curiosity about building cloud product at scale and enthusiasm for solving real-world problems Strong willingness to learn and adaptClear communication skills (English) with technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharingAdditional InformationIf you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.ü§∏ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.üöû Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.ü§ù Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

title: Trainee Analytics Engineering with verification
description: About the jobWorkload: 80-100% Ready to kickstart your career at the intersection of data science, software engineering and the energy industry? Join Axpo as a Trainee in Analytics Engineering and become part of a dynamic, future-focused community that is shaping the energy world of tomorrow. ‚ö°As part of the Axpo Trainee Programme, you‚Äôll work across multiple teams and business units, gain hands-on experience, and build a group-wide network. You‚Äôll rotate through three different assignments ‚Äì starting with the Advanced Analytics team in Trading & Sales ‚Äì and take an active role in solving real-world data challenges.The perfect start for your future career! üíØ The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2025 and is limited to 18 months with a strong perspective for a permanent position afterwards.What you will do: Help shape the future of energy by working on data science and software engineering topics across the entire value chain ‚Äì from data gathering and processing to analytics and generating tradeable insightsDive into real operational and strategic tasks and take on responsibility from day oneCollaborate with cross-functional teams in Data Science, GenAI, and Trading DesksIn your first assignment (Advanced Analytics, Trading & Sales), you will:Experiment with new machine learning use cases and contribute to production-ready data solutionsGain hands-on experience with cloud and platform technologies (e.g. Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Kubernetes)Improve and maintain our codebase, reducing technical debtDevelop and optimize data ingestion and analytics pipelinesTailor your second and third rotations to your interests ‚Äì possible teams include Group IT, Trading Desks, our subsidiary CKW, or possibly an international Axpo hub üöÄWhat you bring & who you are:Master‚Äôs degree üéì in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics (no more than 2 years of post-graduation work experience)Strong Python skills, with a solid understanding of data science and software engineering best practicesIdeally, first experience with data or platform engineering tools (e.g. Databricks, Kubernetes)Excellent analytical skills and the ability to explain complex technical concepts in simple termsA collaborative and proactive mindsetFluency in English; German is a plusAbout the team:You will become part of the 18th trainee generation. Meet regularly for several events, whether it‚Äôs lunch or even power plant visits. Take advantage from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and expand your network.Our innovative environment encourages us to contribute new ideas, deepen our knowledge of the energy sector, and achieve great things together. üí°You will work in the office in Baden, with the flexibility to work from home as well. The fixed traineeship salary is CHF 86‚Äô000 per year, including several attractive fringe benefits.Find more details to the traineeship here.

title: Machine Learning Engineer Bot & Fraud Detection with verification
description: About the jobAbout CastleCastle is a Series A startup on a mission to create a safer online world by protecting platforms from fraud, abuse, and malicious activity. Trusted by companies like Canva, Atlassian, and Rockstar Games, we‚Äôre backed by Y Combinator, Index Ventures, and top-tier angels from Datadog, Stripe, and New Relic. Our fast-moving team is scaling globally, helping platforms stay secure while thriving in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.The roleAs a Machine Learning Engineer specializing in Bot & Fraud Detection, you will develop AI-driven fraud prevention systems that continuously adapt to evolving attack patterns. Your work will directly impact real-time bot mitigation, anomaly detection, and automated rule generation, ensuring Castle remains one step ahead of attackers.You will work closely with our Head of Research, Antoine Vastel, a recognized expert in bot detection and browser fingerprinting, to integrate cutting-edge fraud detection models into Castle‚Äôs AI-driven defense engine. With direct access to rich behavioral data and a modern ML stack, you‚Äôll be able to iterate quickly and deploy models that make an immediate impact.In addition to traditional ML-based fraud detection, you will also leverage LLMs to classify traffic patterns, detect anomalies, and optimize application performance. You will experiment with the latest advancements in AI, ensuring Castle is at the forefront of modern fraud prevention technology.What you‚Äôll doYou will develop AI-powered fraud detection models, leveraging behavioral analysis, anomaly detection, and adversarial ML techniques to uncover evasive bot behavior. Our structured data pipelines and well-instrumented fraud signals ensure you‚Äôll spend more time solving complex problems and less time wrangling data.You will explore LLMs for traffic classification, using modern AI architectures to analyze session behavior, detect anomalies, and optimize fraud detection models. With seamless access to large-scale real-world fraud datasets, you'll have everything you need to push the boundaries of AI-driven fraud prevention.What you bring5+ years of experience in machine learning, fraud detection, or adversarial AI, preferably in security-focused environments.Strong background in anomaly detection, behavioral modeling, and adversarial ML techniques for detecting fraudulent activity and bot behavior.Experience developing and optimizing real-time ML pipelines for high-speed fraud detection.Hands-on experience deploying and fine-tuning LLMs, with a deep understanding of prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and large-scale inference.Deep understanding of supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques for adaptive fraud prevention.Familiarity with fraud signals, device intelligence, and behavioral analytics for bot detection and risk assessment.Experience with vector-based search, feature engineering, and scalable model inference for real-time fraud prevention.Ability to collaborate across Threat Research, Infrastructure, and JavaScript Engineering teams to develop end-to-end ML-powered fraud detection.BenefitsWe pay US salaries globally. $153,000-$196,000 per year for this role.Flexible work hours. We prioritize outcomes over hours spent.Unlimited PTO. Take the time you need to recharge and maintain a healthy work-life balance.Paid parental leave. Supporting new parents during their transition.We‚Äôll supply the computer and related gear you need to excel.

title: Senior Data Engineer ‚Äì Kafka Expert (Bangkok based relocation provided) with verification
description: About the jobAbout AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Our Purpose ‚Äì  Bridging the World Through Travel We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.Get to Know Our TeamThe Data department oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityAs senior data pipeline engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will have a chance to manage projects with small team of 1-2 members which improving your ownership and leadership. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you‚Äôll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.In This Role, You‚Äôll Get toYou will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process hundreds of billions of messages a day spanning over multiple data centersYou will develop and expand upon existing frameworks that is used by Teams throughout Agoda to produce messages to the data pipelineYou will build and manage data ingestion into multiple systems (Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems)You will build tools that monitor high data accuracy SLAs for the data pipelineYou will explore available new technologies that improve upon our quality of data, processes and data flowYou will develop quality software through design review, code reviews and test driven developmentWhat You‚Äôll Need To SucceedBachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Computer Engineering or related field4 plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech companyGood knowledge of data architecture principlesHave operational experience debugging production issuesAn experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scaleYou‚Äôre detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decisionYou can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and writtenKnow more than one programming language (Golang, Java, Scala, Python, C#, etc.)Good understanding of how Kafka worksKafka Administrator ExperienceExperience with data ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed SystemsStrong systems administration skills in LinuxWorked on or contributed to Open Source Project title: Senior Applied Scientist - PRSB (All genders) with verification
description: About the jobThe Discovery team assists customers in their fashion discovery journey and helps them find what they are looking for. We are developing the next generation of our discovery systems, utilising state-of-the-art information retrieval (IR) methods, particularly transformer-based deep neural networks and large language models (LLMs).As a Senior Applied Scientist, you will address challenging fashion problems using cutting-edge approaches. You will contribute to drive our scientific roadmap, applying your scientific capabilities and in collaboration with a team of exceptional scientists and engineers developing models and cutting-edge machine learning products that enhance the experience of over 51 million customers.WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED Utilize your extensive scientific experience in researching, deploying, and architecting machine learning and deep learning solutions in IR to enhance the inspiration journey of millions of our customers.  Contribute to develop scientific roadmaps to address complex fashion challenges using state-of-the-art solutions, ensuring we stay at the forefront of IR innovation. Contribute to our scientific endeavours through external publications in top-tier journals and conferences.  Act as a mentor to junior scientists, foster collaboration with other teams, and actively share knowledge and expertise within Zalando‚Äôs science community.  Forge close partnerships with applied science leaders and product managers, and other business stakeholders to deliver state-of-the-art machine learning solutions to our customers and uncover new opportunities for growth. WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR PhD in IR, search & recommendation, information & knowledge management, or related fields (or equivalent experience), accompanied by 3+ years of industry experience in modern IR systems, especially neural IR. Comprehensive understanding of the key components of an IR system, including query processing, indexing, evaluation, etc.  Experience in applying scientific methods to tackle research problems. A strong inclination to collaborate with product, science, and engineering managers and solve business problems through scientific solutions.  Track record of addressing real-world problems using machine learning throughout the entire product cycle, encompassing problem analysis, data processing, literature review, production deployment, monitoring, and maintenance.  Strong publication records at top-tier venues such as SIGIR, KDD, WWW, ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, JMLR, etc.  Hands-on experience in deep learning with proficiency in Python and frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow. Familiarity with LLMs. Proficiency in full-text search engines such as Elasticsearch, OpenSearch, Apache Lucene is also desired.  Knowledge of classical IR models is a plus (boolean, vector, and probabilistic). PERKS AT WORK Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events.  Flexible hours  Work load of 80-100%  Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings.  Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts.  Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in selected locations) INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process. do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups  Opportunity to work from abroad for 30 (working) days per calendar year About ZalandoIt‚Äôs the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 48 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindsetdo.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainabilityFollow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalandoPlease note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Security Engineer with verification
description: About the jobFounded in Switzerland in 1968, Z√ºhlke is owned by its partners and located across Europe and Asia. We are a global transformation partner, with engineering and innovation in our DNA. We're trusted to help clients envision and build their businesses for the future ‚Äì to run smarter today while adapting for tomorrow‚Äôs markets, customers, and communities. Our multidisciplinary teams specialise in tech strategy and business innovation, digital solutions and applications, and device and systems engineering. We excel in complex, regulated spaces including health and finance, connecting strategy, tech implementation, and operational services to help clients become more effective, resilient businesses.If you share our values and want to do the best work, for the right reasons, we can offer you the chance to do it on a global scale and play a real role in shaping our exciting journey.The role As a Security Engineer at Z√ºhlke, you will work on various customer projects and make a significant daily contribution to securing our customers' digital products.  Passion for cybersecurity. Do you enjoy making systems do something they weren't designed to? Do you want to break things without causing any lasting damage? And do you dare to question what's given, to stand up for something and fight for it? You love to solve technical challenges. If you like finding vulnerabilities in code and terms like XSS, injections and buffer overflows make your eyes light up, you'll have a lot of fun with us. But also methods like DevSecOps, Threat Modeling, Web Security, Bug Hunting and individual Security Assessments will be part of your work as a Security Engineer. You like variety and new challenges. Our projects are diverse - just like the challenges our customers face. We therefore strive for diversity in our professional orientation. This also means that we are constantly developing and learning new things. Would you like to become an expert in your field or expand your leadership and consulting skills and gradually take on more responsibility in your projects?Then you have come to the right place. How You‚Äôll Make ImpactYou take on responsibility in customer projects in a wide variety of industries (defining methodological approach, developing use cases with customers, advising customers on technical topics, as well as presenting and explaining results). Thanks to your passion, you inspire our customers for the field of cybersecurity. You develop machine learning solutions: data preparation, modelling, method selection, evaluation, implementation. You evaluate the technical and economic feasibility of cybersecurity solutions. You contribute to the further development of our Cybersecurity Practice and actively support the acquisition of customer projects. What‚Äôs Important To UsYou have a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree (FH, ETH, Uni) in computer science or a comparable education (e.g. mathematics). You have experience with similar roles in medium to large solution projects or have already gained experience due to your enthusiasm for cybersecurity. Your passion for Cybersecurity is what defines you You find a good balance between efficiency and quality in projects. Thanks to your open and communicative personality, you feel comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and can work in a customer-oriented way, from the idea to the successful implementation of a solution. German language skills are required. Very good English skills complete your profile. What We OfferWork life blend: we offer a safe & healthy workplace, with flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home Profit share scheme: In addition to your annual salary, you may receive a profit share defined by the company‚Äôs success in the previous year Global and Diverse Z√ºhlke community: witness how colleagues from all our 16 offices across the globe come together to create a unique, positive and inclusive work culture, learning from one another at annual team camps, and celebrating year-end parties and other local festivities. Committed to development: we are committed to the growth of our people and are investing in your development. We‚Äôre empowering you to build the skills you need to make a positive impact, both personally and for our clients, today and in the future. To dive deeper into local benefits of working in Z√ºhlke follow the link.How To ApplyPlease remember all applications must be submitted in English only to be considered.If you feel you don't meet all the requirements, we are still happy to get to know you, learn more about your ambitions and ideas and look forward to receiving your application!We welcome people from all backgrounds, regardless of their gender, personality, national origin, race, religion, colour, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability or veteran status.

Reclutiamo, sviluppiamo e creiamo talenti in 60 Paesi, permettendo alle organizzazioni di contribuire a plasmare il futuro del lavoro.PERMTechnik und FertigungSettore: AltroRuolo: Altro

title: Senior HFT Quantitative Trader/Researcher - Digital Assets (EU Remote) with verification
description: About the jobSince our beginnings in 2017, we've grown to be a leading change-maker in the digital asset space, renowned for our partnerships and innovation.Today, we rock with over 170 team members around the world. Our diverse team hails from 42 nationalities, with backgrounds ranging from DeFi natives to PhDs. Predominantly remote, we have hubs in London, Brussels and Singapore, and host regular online and offline hangouts to keep the crew tight.We are trading on more than 80 exchanges, and working with a wide array of asset issuers. As a well-established market maker, our distinctive expertise led us to expand rapidly. Today, our services span market making, options trading, high-frequency trading, OTC, and DeFi trading desks.But we‚Äôre more than a service provider. We‚Äôre an initiator. We're pioneers in adopting the Rust Development language for our algorithmic trading, and champions of its use in the industry. We support the growth of Web3 startups through our Accelerator Program. We upgrade ecosystems by injecting liquidity into promising DeFi, RWA, and NFT protocols. And we push the industry's progress with our research and governance initiatives.At Keyrock, we're not just envisioning the future of digital assets. We're actively building it.Mission statementWhat we are looking for‚Ä¶ a dynamic, driven Senior HFT Quantitative Trader/Researcher to work in collaboration with our engineers, data scientists and quantitative traders. We are currently looking for people with experience developing and running systematic strategies in the HFT space.The ideal candidate will be able to analyze existing trading strategies and identify areas of improvement. They will also be able to develop their own trading strategies and take them from hypothesis to production. The candidate must have a strong mathematical background. They must have a good understanding of the engineering problems faced by an HFT business and be able to collaborate with senior developers in overcoming these challenges.If the candidate has run systematic strategies in the HFT space they should be able to demonstrate the performance of the strategies.Job DescriptionBuilding models to create new trading strategiesStructuring and implementing algorithmic trading strategiesBacktesting algorithmic trading strategiesSoftware development and implementationMonitoring market performanceMarket analysisBackground And ExperienceAs a quantitative trading researcher, you have strong analytical capabilities and are fully comfortable with financial markets and trading algorithms in order books. You have:Understanding of digital assets, either professional or personal interest. Understanding of financial market micro structures. Strong attention to detailGood communicatorProgramming skills in PythonPrior experience in building or researching trading algorithmsA background or substantial experience in a STEM subject. Passion for algorithmic tradingPrior knowledge of market making algorithms is a plusThe ability to take ownership of a project while collaborating on it with colleaguesFluent in EnglishNice to have: Stochastic Calculus, dynamic programming Nice to have (tech): RUST, AWS, ROur recruitment philosophyWe value self-awareness in our recruitment process. We seek people who understand themselves and their career goals. We're after those with the right skills and a conscious choice to join our field. The perfect fit? A crypto enthusiast who‚Äôs driven, collaborative, and delivers solid, scalable outcomes.Our offerA competitive salary package, with various benefits depending on the method of engagement (employee or freelancer). Autonomy in your time management thanks to flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely The freedom to create your own entrepreneurial experience by being part of a team of people in search of excellence As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.Due to the nature of our business and external requirements, we perform background checks on all potential employees, passing which is a prerequisite to join Keyrock.https://keyrock.com/careers/

title: Senior Data Analyst - Strategic Marketing with verification
description: About the jobWho We Are Is What We Do.Deel and our family of growing companies are made up of global teams dedicated to helping businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily.The team comprises over three thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 100 countries, and our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the platform and products for customers.Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the platform‚Äôs success. We deliver the best products and features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.Why should you be part of our success story?A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because exceptional talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.After our successful Series D in 2021, we raised another $50M in 2023, doubling our valuation to $12B. There‚Äôs never been a more exciting time to join Deel ‚Äî the international payroll and compliance market leader.About This RoleDeel has grown from a contractor management product to a full-fledged HR platform in just five years, serving tens of thousands of global customers. As Deel continues its rapid global expansion, we are strengthening our localized go-to-market strategies by enhancing our marketing capabilities.In this role, you will partner closely with marketing leadership, including Marketing Heads and Marketing Directors, to drive data-driven marketing strategy, optimize budget allocation, and set top-level marketing targets. You will take a holistic approach to marketing performance, leveraging cross-channel insights to inform investment decisions, guide marketing mix planning, and ensure resources are allocated effectively. Your work will directly influence how Deel balances marketing and sales efforts, driving efficiency and maximizing impact across all marketing channels.Key ResponsibilitiesPartner with Marketing Leadership as a strategic thought partner, guiding budget allocation and cross-channel marketing investments.Collaborate with GTM Data team members, including Marketing Analysts, Analytics Engineers, Digital Analytics Managers, as well as Sales Operations and Marketing Operations teams.Develop intuitive and actionable dashboards in Looker, providing a holistic view of marketing performance and enabling data-driven decision-making.Design and track top-level marketing KPIs, ensuring alignment with business objectives and optimizing marketing and sales team balance.Own and refine marketing measurement frameworks, including Marketing Mix Analysis, to identify the most efficient channel and regional investment strategies.Lead target-setting processes, ensuring marketing teams have clear, data-backed goals that drive efficiency and growth.Conduct structured experiments to optimize marketing spend, improve cross-channel attribution, and inform strategic planning.Generate insights and recommendations for marketing leadership to guide budget planning, headcount allocation, and performance measurement across teams.RequirementsBachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.You are a deeply curious person. You love understanding how the world works and have a deep sense for business and strategy. Highly proficient in SQL and experience with self-service BI tools like Looker. 3+ years of experience in marketing or growth analytics, with a proven track record of supporting marketing leadership (CMO, Marketing Directors) in strategic decision-making.Experience with holistic marketing measurement frameworks, such as Marketing Mix Modeling, experiment design, and top-down/bottom-up forecasting.Strong experience in marketing budget allocation, target setting, and cross-channel investment optimization.Excellent communication and storytelling skills; ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior stakeholders.Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth environments, with the ability to influence executive decision-making.We especially would like to speak with you if you have:Experience with tools like Snowflake, Salesforce, HubSpot, and dbt.Familiarity with Python and other data science tools.Hands-on experience with ETL tools (e.g., Fivetran, Funnel).Prior experience working in a fast-growing B2B SaaS company.Total RewardsOur workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.Some things you‚Äôll enjoyProvided computer equipment tailored to your roleStock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and locationAdditional perks and benefits based on your employment status and countryThe flexibility of remote work, including WeWork access where availableDISCLOSURE We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications.Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on the 19th of February, 2025.For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy.You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144.At Deel, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com, @paygroup.com and @safeguardglobal.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting our careers page.Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

title: Software Engineer ll YouTube MetaData with verification
description: About the jobMinimum qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience.1 year of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).1 year of experience with data structures or algorithms.1 year of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure or distributed systems.Preferred qualifications:Experience with C++, Go, SQLExperience one or more technologies (e.g., Boq/Pod, Spanner, Bigtable and Flume).About The JobGoogle's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun ‚Äî and we do it all together.ResponsibilitiesWork with a team of talented engineers responsible for delivering high-quality, change-tracked metadata that fuels all investigative processes across YouTube. Manage the processing of hundred of terabytes of data daily, ensuring efficient and scalable solutions for batch and streaming data pipelines.Build resilient and fault-tolerant systems that provide consistent and reliable metadata delivery.Collaborate with stakeholders across YouTube, including Creator Analytics (YTA), Commerce, Music and Premium, Shopping and Abuse Detection, to understand their needs and deliver impactful solutions.Drive the evolution of YouTube's metadata ecosystem by exploring new technologies and architectural patterns.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Specialist for Visual Inspection (1 year temporary position) with verification
description: About the jobAt Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.The PositionAt Roche, we thrive to deliver more benefits to our patients as part of our 10-year Pharma vision. An integral part of achieving this vision is to deliver new and innovative data analytics solutions to our scientists across Pharma Technical Operations (PT). To do so, we have formed a new organization called PT Digital and Operational Excellence (PTE) with the aspiration to digitally transform and become a lean organization.As an AI Specialist for Visual Inspection at Roche PT, you will lead the development, implementation, and optimization of deep learning solutions with a focus on visual inspection applications and Generative AI (GenAI). You will drive the design and enhancement of AI models and systems, collaborating with cross-functional teams to streamline and transform business processes. Your role will involve exploring and integrating cutting-edge AI algorithms, supporting the automation and enhancement of Roche‚Äôs pharmaceutical operations. You will play a key role in mentoring junior team members and contributing to the broader AI strategy within the company.Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of advanced deep learning models for visual inspection (e.g., CNNs), ensuring high accuracy and performance in pharmaceutical applicationsSpearhead the integration of Generative AI systems to automate complex processes and improve decision-making across production environmentsOversee the creation, maintenance, and optimization of AI pipelines, ensuring smooth transitions from data preprocessing to model deployment and continuous performance monitoringCollaborate with senior engineering teams to develop scalable, robust, and real-time AI solutions tailored to Roche‚Äôs operational needsConduct research on emerging AI technologies and frameworks, contributing to the continuous innovation and improvement of Roche PT‚Äôs AI capabilitiesMentor and guide junior engineers and specialists in AI and deep learning best practicesWork closely with leadership to align AI projects with strategic goals and business prioritiesWho you areMaster‚Äôs degree in AI, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field. A Ph.D. is highly preferredExtensive experience applying AI, deep learning, and Generative AI, particularly in visual inspection and model optimization, with a proven track record of successful project deliveryAdvanced proficiency in Python and deep learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), with a focus on model building, deployment, and performance optimizationStrong experience with machine learning techniques for visual recognition tasks, including model evaluation, performance tuning, and scaling AI solutions. Expertise in deploying AI models at scale using cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), including managing model lifecycle and ensuring continuous optimizationDeep understanding of data preprocessing, model optimization, and the practical application of AI solutions in business contexts. Ability to develop strategic AI solutions that meet both short-term and long-term business needsPreferred:Proven interest or experience with AI technologies applied to pharmaceutical or healthcare industries, especially within manufacturing and operational contextsFamiliarity with the integration of Generative AI applications or advanced visual inspection systems in manufacturing environmentsExperience in leading or managing teams, mentoring others, and shaping AI strategy within an organizationWho we areA healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Integrated Reporting - Lead Data Architect with verification
description: About the jobIntegrated Reporting - Lead Data ArchitectAt ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.Write the next chapter of your ABB story.This position reports toHead of Integrated Reporting ToolsYour role and responsibilitiesIn this role, you will own overall architecture of the Integrated Reporting platforms which with in using SAP BW/4 Hanna, SAC & Non-SAP technologies and supports Finance organization of ABB for Management and external reporting.You will be responsible for defining reporting data strategy and architecture along with wider Finance process data and systems and IS teams of ABB.You will report to the Head of Integrated Reporting and manage a 6 member team of Functional Architects: Defines architectural and design patterns and guide on their adoption for analytics purpose. Interprets data, analyzes results and provide guidance through the team to the design and delivery team. Guides on the building of reports and dashboards using best practices and intuitive visualization. Collates and prioritizes business and domain/functional use-cases to architect and design solutions to meet business needs. Manages the delivery of user-friendly analytics insights by improving and adapting through continuous solutions delivery, through active feedback from customers and stakeholders. Defines and keeps up to date technologies preference criteria for exposing the data to business users. Guides on the building dashboards using best practices and intuitive visualization.Defining data Strategy and architecture along with the wider Finance Process data and systems team. Leads the validation and prioritization of incoming business demand, in collaboration with the relevant demand manager. Acts as the escalation point for solution, performance and architecture & design related issues. Evaluates the ideas for efficiency improvement and value addition, decides based on their technological, financial, and functional feasibilities Collaborates with ABB IS team to approve, develop, and maintain technology roadmaps architecture standards, reference architectures, and architecture building blocks in integrated reporting tools.Qualifications for the roleMaster‚Äôs degree in computer science, Finance, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related field.Minimum 15 years of experience in a Functional architecture role on large SAP program. Good understanding of financial end to end process such as Record to Report, FP&A, Order to Cash etc. Knowledge of working with and using SAP/, BW/ BW/4Hana, SAC and SAP MDG is a must. Having exposure to non-SAP data analytics environment like Snowflake will be an advantage.Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.A collaborative, solution-focused approach and strong written and spoken communication skills.A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Experience with cloud services (SAP Rise, AWS, Azure, GCP) and understanding of scaling analytics projects in cloud environments.More about usWe value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work with verification
description: About the jobCompany DescriptionWelcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AGWe are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.Job DescriptionJoin our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.About The PositionPerform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholdersOwn the Tableau self-service platform and main reportsCreation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General MarketplacesDefine GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track bookCarrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnelsPerforming internal data quality audits and reviews on internal toolsQualificationsWhat we are looking for3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders 3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech sideExperience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM Knowledge of A/B testing frameworksKnowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plusAnalytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimizationAbility to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structuresProactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competenceFluency in English mandatoryGerman is a plusAdditional InformationWhy you should join usAt SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.Benefits You‚Äôll LoveFlexible working hours and a culture of trustHybrid work set-up 40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide eventsFree SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in SwitzerlandGender-neutral fair-pay 18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)Ready to make an impact?Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.We are looking forward to getting to know you!About UsSMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.DisclaimerSMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

title: Applied ML Engineering GenAI / AI Agent (Global) with verification
description: About the jobAbout The RoleRole Overview:At Shopify, we are developing an innovative AI Personal Shopper designed to redefine the online shopping experience for buyers. Our aim is to provide an exceptional concierge service tailored to individual preferences and needs, revolutionizing how customers interact with Shop and Storefronts.Leveraging cutting-edge AI technology, including Large Language Models (LLM) and advanced machine learning algorithms, we will harness the power of data analytics and build upon the solid platform foundation of the Assistant projects in Shopify. This enables us to deliver personalized recommendations, exclusive offers, and insightful suggestions that cater to each user's unique taste. Our AI technology will analyze user behavior, preferences, and inventory levels in real-time, ensuring that shoppers receive highly relevant and customized suggestions. Our AI Personal Shopper will be an indispensable ally for every shopper, assisting with everything from curating outfits to finding the perfect gifts.To expedite this effort, we are seeking Machine Learning Engineering (MLE) leads and individual contributors to join our team and help shape the future of online shopping. Together, we will create an unparalleled shopping experience that exceeds customer expectations and redefines the e-commerce landscape.You and your team won't just be working on theoretical concepts ‚Äì you'll be at the forefront of implementing AI systems at scale, directly empowering our merchants. We're all about creating tangible solutions that make a real difference in the day to day lives of entrepreneurs.Key outputs:Developing and deploying Generative AI, natural language processing and machine learning modelsProducing system design and architecture of scalable AI/ML systemsDesigning and implementing data pipelines for fine-tuning LLMs Solving high impact data problems and delivering business impact through data and machine learning productsPrioritizing and communicating to technical and non-technical audiences alikeQualifications:Demonstrated mastery building data products that use generative AI, RLHF and fine-tuning LLMsEnd-to-end experience of training, evaluating, testing and deploying machine learning products at scaleExperience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions leveraging disparate data sourcesExperience with the following: Python, shell scripting, streaming and batch data pipelines, vector databases, DBT, BigQuery, BigTable or equivalent, orchestration toolsExperience with running machine learning in parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, GPU optimization)This role may require on-call workAbout ShopifyOpportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.About YouMoving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity‚Äîand a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.Before you apply, consider if you can:Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

title: Senior Python Engineer - Data Platform (Remote)
description: About the jobAxiom is seeking a Senior Python Engineer - Data Platform (Remote) for a leading blockchain intelligence firm, providing real-time blockchain analysis and compliance solutions. This is a remote role and we are flexible with considering applications from anywhere in Europe. What You'll DoIntegrate blockchains, AMM protocols, and bridges into the platform.Develop and maintain data pipelines and backend services.Integrate new technologies into existing processes and tools.Design and implement end-to-end features.Code, debug, test, and deliver features while providing code reviews and feedback to team members.Who You Are8+ years of experience developing Python backend services and APIs.Advanced SQL skills with the ability to write, understand, and debug complex queries.Strong knowledge of data warehousing, database architecture, and PostgreSQL.Experience with POSIX/Unix/Linux ecosystems and Python frameworks like Flask or FastAPI.Ability to work independently, with a team-oriented mindset and good communication skills.Nice To HavePractical experience with big data frameworks like Kafka, Spark, Flink, and analytical databases such as ClickHouse.Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform and Ansible.Passion for Bitcoin and blockchain technologies.Experience with distributed systems and open-source solutions.Experience with Java or a willingness to learn.What‚Äôs in It for YouFully remote with flexible hours across Europe.Competitive salary and bonus schemes.Work on cutting-edge tech in blockchain, AI, and data intelligence.Be part of a dynamic, innovative team that values collaboration and learning.For more information, please apply to the role directly or reach out to andrew@axiomrecruit.com.

title: Senior Data Analyst - F/M/X with verification
description: About the jobWho are we?Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.We look forward to meeting you!Job DescriptionWe are currently seeking a skilled Senior Data Analyst (F/M/X) with expertise in data science and analytics to join our team remotely. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in programming and sensor data analysis, along with the ability to effectively contribute to our data-driven projects.üî• Responsibilities: Analyze sensor and system data to extract meaningful insights and support decision-making processes. Develop and implement data detection, interpretation, and reporting methodologies. Conduct performance and stress testing to evaluate system capabilities and reliability. Process and analyze large datasets, focusing on low data rates and MB-sized data. Integrate MATLAB and Python solutions into product systems for enhanced functionality. Collaborate with internal teams to define and optimize analytical approaches based on project needs. Assess and identify future technology gaps to ensure continuous improvement in data processing capabilities.üéØ Your Profile: You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field. You have proven experience in data analysis, particularly in sensor-based data processing. You possess strong programming skills in MATLAB and Python, with experience in software development and integration. You have a solid understanding of performance evaluations and process assessments. You demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work with complex datasets. You have effective communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work well within a team environment. Ideally, you have relevant industry experience in Defense, Aerospace, or Engineering.üí° Our Company Culture: Agility: Evolving in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment. International: Benefit from international collaborations and numerous mobility opportunities. Intrapreneurship: Get involved in parallel initiatives or develop your own Business Unit. Listening Management: Receive personalized support throughout your professional journey.We are committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic.Desired Skills and ExperienceEngineering, Data orientation / Data analysis, Multisensory Data Representation Software

title: Data Scientist
description: About the jobOur Opening And Your ResponsibilitiesThe Digital Business Services (DBS) department at METTLER TOLEDO delivers comprehensive technical solutions to enhance business productivity, drive innovation and ensure an exceptional customer experience. DBS services cover the entire spectrum from infrastructure to applications and from strategy to global operations. Our Data, Analytics & AI team supports and enables the business with AI platforms, expertise and solutions. To help further advance our AI journey and facilitate the implementation of AI projects across the organization, we are looking for a Data Scientist 80-100% (all genders)You will be responsible to assess, design, build and deploy new AI solutions incorporating analytics, ML, DL, NLP, agentic AI, etc. for beneficial global usage in our diverse business. Understanding the technical aspects, you will also enable and guide business partners in implementing their solutions. You will take an active part in establishing our cross-departmental AI Competence Center, having expertise in data science, data engineering, programming and software development. The ideal candidate will be passionate about artificial intelligence and motivated to support our community throughout this transformative journey.In This Role, Your Responsibilities Would IncludeCollaborate with data architects and data engineers to refine our data strategy and develop tailored technical infrastructure, leveraging existing BW4HANA / KNIMEDesign, build, and test AI solutions that meet the needs of business stakeholders and usersAssist in delivering and preparing datasets for analysis, ensuring adherence to quality standards and improving data cleaning processesUnderstand business objectives and requirements to coach stakeholders in developing models that align with these goals, including metrics for tracking progressComply with strict data, intellectual property and security guidelinesManage stakeholders, provide transparency on progress, business case and risksWhat You Need To SucceedFollowing requirements are necessary for this role:You have at least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field, or equivalent practical experienceYou are proficient in SQL and Python, familiarity with R, JavaScript or Scala. Strong understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases including data modeling and warehousingYou bring experience with data integration, cloud platforms, MS-SQL, SAP HANA and APIs, along with a solid understanding of algorithms and data structuresYou have the ability to assess technical projects, including hardware selection, and work independently while approaching problems methodically and pragmaticallyStrong analytical skills, particularly with unstructured datasets, coupled with excellent organizational skills for coordinating work across multidisciplinary teamsFluent communication skills in English is required, German is a plusOur Offer to YouWe OfferFlexible working hours (depending on the role), a hybrid work model, and a wide portfolio of training opportunitiesA 40-hour work week with at least 25 vacation days per year, plus 4 to 7 additional days off between bank holidaysFree parking and direct access to public transportHealthy lunches cooked onsite at our own METTLER TOLEDO restaurant, with special prices for employees A range of additional attractive benefits, including employee discounts at select area businessesYou can expect challenging, interesting, and varied tasks in an innovative and international environment, with the opportunity to network globally and achieve your career goals.Have we raised your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your complete application at our Job portal.Please note that we do not accept any application documents via e-mail, only applications submitted on our job platform due to our data protection guidelines. Furthermore, we do currently not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this role.If you have any question, please do not hesitate to contact our Talent Acquisition Team ta-ch@mt.com.About Mettler ToledoMETTLER TOLEDO is a global leader in precision instruments and services. We are renowned for innovation and quality across laboratory, process analytics, industrial, product inspection, and retailing applications. Our sales and service network is one of the most extensive in the industry. Our products are sold in more than 140 countries, and we have a direct presence in approximately 40 countries. For more information, please visit www.mt.com.Equal Opportunity EmploymentWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We give consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other protected classification. You can find more details in our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy.

title: Quantitative Researcher ‚Äì Digital Assets
description: About the jobNumeus is a diversified digital asset investment firm built to the highest institutional standards, combining synergistic businesses across Alpha Strategies, Trading, and Asset Management.Numeus was founded by successful executives with decades of experience across the finance, blockchain and technology industries, with a shared passion for digital assets. Our values are grounded in an open approach based on connectivity, collaboration, and partnerships across the digital asset ecosystem. People and technology are at the core of everything we do.We are looking for an experienced Quantitative Researcher who can help us develop alpha in the digital asset markets through a diversified set of systematic trading strategies. You will work closely with experienced researchers, traders, and engineers with deep domain expertise. The digital asset space is fast-evolving and filled with innovative sources of alpha and trading opportunities.Key Responsibilities:Employ a rigorous scientific approach to develop sophisticated investment models and deliver insights into how markets behaveApply quantitative techniques, like machine learning, to a vast and innovative array of datasetsCreate and test investment ideas and develop algorithms that drive trading decisionsAnalyze investment model performance and behavior, aiming for continuous improvementWork closely with our team of experienced developers to translate investment models into production codeSkill Set and Qualifications:2+ years within a quantitative investment research team with experience in alpha research, model building, backtesting, parameter optimization routines, execution engine design, and performance trackingEducational background in technical field, preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or Theoretical Computer ScienceStrong analytical skills; experience working with, and analyzing, large datasetsStrong mathematical and statistical modeling skills (e.g. time-series)Ability to think independently, creatively approach data analysis, and communicate complex ideas clearlyBasic knowledge of the digital asset space is beneficial, but not requiredIntermediate programming background in Python and C++Fluent English speakerBased in Zug, with the ability to travel periodically to our offices in London and NYCAre you keen to work in a well-resourced startup environment, where your ideas, experience, and drive to find creative solutions makes a difference? We‚Äôd like to hear from you.
