title: Senior Vehicle Dynamics Engineer
description: About the jobJoin the Audi F1 Project - Shape the Future of Motorsport!Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026.The new team has three locations. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. The Sauber Motorsport Technical Center, UK will be operational this year. The Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations.What you need? The mindset of an athlete. If you are someone for whom giving up isn‚Äôt an option and limits are just something to be overcome, you can bring Vorsprung durch Technik to Formula 1 with us. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history.Your missionResponsible for the quality and the development of the pre-event simulations and methodologiesRemote garage support during the eventsResponsible for the in-event and post-event analysisCoordination of the in-event correlation of the offline simulationContinuous improvement oaf the predictive and analysis toolsYour profileMaster‚Äôs degree or PHD in mechanical or automotive engineering or applied mathematics5 years‚Äô experience in a relevant field (Vehicle Science / Vehicle Performance / Vehicle Dynamics / DiL Simulator)Extensive understanding of vehicle dynamics Experience in Matlab is required, advanced level will be advantageous Accustomed to a conscientious working style under time pressureResilient as well as stress tolerant (flexibility of working hours)We are an equal opportunities employer.As an equal opportunities employer, Sauber Motorsport Technology Center, UK is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join Sauber Motorsport Technology Center, UK.

title: BI Specialist (Focus Business Applications) with verification
description: About the jobAboutBist du bereit, gemeinsam mit einem starken Team innovative L√∂sungen zu entwickeln und das Einkaufserlebnis von Millionen Kunden zu verbessern? Hast du Spass daran, hands-on an technischen Datenherausforderungen zu arbeiten und deine Teams zu H√∂chstleistungen zu f√ºhren? Um das sicherzustellen, braucht es neben guten Daten und deren Aufbereitungen durch Reports & Dashboads BI Specialists - also dich!Das erwartet dichDeine Mission: In Zusammenarbeit mit den Product Teams und dem Analytics Engineering erarbeitest du die Anforderungen ans Reporting, konzipierst Dashboards und stellst dem Business damit Handlungsempfehlungen zur Verf√ºgung. Mit deinem technischen Know-how unterst√ºtzt du aktiv bei der Entwicklung schlauer L√∂sungen und sorgst daf√ºr, dass deine Teams sowohl technologisch als auch methodisch auf dem neuesten Stand bleiben.Fachliche Aufgaben: Als Teil unseres Business Intelligence Teams arbeitest Du aktiv am Ausbau unserer unternehmensweiten Business Intelligence L√∂sungen. Du √ºbernimmst selbst√§ndig die Konzeption, Modellierung, Implementierung und Einf√ºhrung neuer Auswertungen und Dashboards im Unternehmen. Du arbeitest aktiv an der Weiterentwicklung bestehender Auswertungen und Dashboards. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Teams und verschiedenen Fachbereichen wie Logistik, Commercial, Marketing oder Finanzen gestaltest Du unsere Business Intelligence Landschaft aktiv mit.Dateninfrastruktur & -architektur: Du bist verantwortlich f√ºr das Anbinden und Aufbereiten der Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (verschiedene Datenbanken, Datei-Quellen, sowie internen und externen APIs)-Betrieb & Optimierung: Du bist zusammen mit dem Team f√ºr die Updates und Wartung der Softwareinstanzen verantwortlich und hast so auch die M√∂glichkeit immer die neusten Patches und Updates zu nutzen. Du testet neue Releases der Software auf Funktionsf√§higkeit und Kompatibilit√§t der bestehenden Reports & Dashboards. √úberwache, analysiere und optimiere kontinuierlich die Performance, Sicherheit und Betriebssicherheit unserer Dateninfrastruktur & -architekturDaten-Governance & Qualit√§t: Du sicherst durch klare Governance-Richtlinien die Integrit√§t und Sicherheit unserer Daten und Systeme. Du vergibst Lizenzen und Berechtigungen an die UserInnovation & Technologie-Research: Du verfolgst aktiv neue Entwicklungen im Bereich BI, Data-Engineering und ML und integrierst geeignete neue Ans√§tze in unsere ProzesseStakeholder Management & Zusammenarbeit: Du arbeitest eng und vertrauensvoll mit F√ºhrungskr√§ften aus allen Bereichen der Unternehmung zusammen, um die Abstimmung der technischen und gesch√§ftlichen Ziele sicherzustellen. Du kommunizierst wirkungsvoll auf allen Ebenen, vor allem mit den weiteren Data Rollen sowie den Product Leads und und vertrittst die Bedeutung datengetriebener Initiativen √ºberzeugend und klar.Das bringst du mitMindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence oder verwandten Feldern.Nachweisliche Erfahrung im Auf- und Ausbau von BI L√∂sungen (inkl. Anbindung der Quellsysteme).Umfangreiches Wissen in der Modellierung von Daten, in relationalen Datenbanken und SQL bildet die Grundlage Deiner Arbeit.Erste praktische Erfahrung mit weiteren Data-Technologien, sowie Konzepten wie Data Mesh, Lambda-Architekturen und Lakehouse-Architekturen.Ausgepr√§gte analytische F√§higkeiten, schnelle Auffassungsgabe sowie die F√§higkeit, komplexe Zusammenh√§nge klar und verst√§ndlich zu kommunizieren.Leidenschaft f√ºr technologische Innovation und kontinuierliche Verbesserung sowie die F√§higkeit, technische Risiken zu erkennen und proaktiv zu managen.Aus komplexen Daten leicht verst√§ndliche Dashboards und Kennzahlen aufzubereiten, ist Deine Leidenschaft.Einen Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in Informatik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.Aktiver Austausch mit der Data-Community und regelm√§√üige Beitr√§ge zu Open-Source-Projekten.Bist du interessiert oder hast du weiterf√ºhrende Fragen?Sercan Ugur steht dir gerne telefonisch oder elektronisch zur Verf√ºgung.√úber uns"Gemeinsam gestalten wir den Handel von morgen" Brack.Alltron besch√§ftigt rund 1300 Mitarbeitende und erwirtschaftet √ºber eine Milliarde Umsatz. Das Unternehmen gibt es, weil ein Mensch den Mut hatte, neue Wege zu finden und sie zu gehen. Unsere Erfolgsgeschichte zeigt, dass durch jeden Einzelnen, gemeinsam etwas Grosses entsteht und wir lieben unsere Einzigartigkeit. Wir setzen uns ambitionierte Ziele, dabei ist es uns sehr wichtig, dass wir verantwortlich handeln, uns gegenseitig f√∂rdern und fordern und Freude haben an dem, was wir tagt√§glich tun.Die Competec-Gruppe sucht st√§ndig qualifizierte Mitarbeitende in verschiedenen Bereichen. Ein spannendes Gesch√§ftsumfeld und interessante Zusatzleistungen machen die Competec-Gruppe zu einem attraktiven Arbeitgeber, der 2016 sogar mit dem "Swiss Arbeitgeber Award" ausgezeichnet worden ist.Nice-to-have skillsSQLData ModelingAargau, SwitzerlandWork experienceBusiness IntelligenceData InfrastructureLanguagesGerman

title: Software Engineer II Calendar Backends with verification
description: About the jobMinimum qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience.1 year of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).1 year of experience with data structures or algorithms.Preferred qualifications:Experience in building and developing infrastructure or distributed systems.About the jobGoogle's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. The web is what you make of it and our team is helping the world make more of the web. From open-source pros to user-experience extraordinaires, we develop products that help users connect, communicate and collaborate with others. Our consumer products and cloud platforms are giving millions of users at homes, businesses, universities and nonprofits around the world the tools that shape their web experience -- and changing the way they think about computing.ResponsibilitiesOwn projects end-to-end from initial idea to design. Work with Team Leaders (TLs), Technical Program Managers (TPMs), Product Managers (PMs) and user Experience Designers (UXDs). Design, review, implement and launch changes to our products. Drive for pragmatic, robust solutions and product excellence.Unblock releases, monitor production systems, find bottlenecks optimize performance.Help to maintain and improve our infrastructure and platform.Consult our partner teams, review designs and Changelist (CLs).Help to strive for a failure culture and an inclusive and fun work environment.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Internship IP2TIS 2025 - For students in the field of Computer Science / Data Science / AI / GenAI with verification
description: About the jobAt Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.The PositionA healthier future. It‚Äôs what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That‚Äôs what makes us Roche.Our Global Internship Programme in Innovation & Sustainability (#IP2TIS) offers a unique opportunity for passionate individuals to gain hands-on experience in the pharmaceutical industry while making a positive impact on the world.Are you ready to join a global network spanning 20+ countries, where bright minds collaborate to tackle real-world challenges in Innovation & Sustainability? Do you want to work on impactful projects, shape the future , and drive change from within?The OpportunityJoin Roche‚Äôs Global Internship Program in Innovation & Sustainability (#IP2TIS) and be a part of a transformative project that focuses on analyzing bias in Large Language Models (LLMs). Here‚Äôs what you can expect:Project Impact: Contribute to Roche‚Äôs ambitions by analyzing and addressing biases in LLMs to ensure they are fair and unbiased. Help drive the development of ethical AI systems within Roche‚Äôs Responsible AI team.Core Project Work: Design a statistically sound bias evaluation framework, investigate various types of biases in different types of LLMs, design and implement methods to mitigate these biases (e.g. prompt engineering tips) and develop actionable guidelines for ethical AI use.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with data scientists and cloud engineers to identify and mitigate bias in different LLMsContribute to the work of the Responsible AI team at Roche, in particular to our Model Evaluation Framework, that also looks at performance, toxicity and sustainability of LLMsContribute to the development of actionable guidelines for ethical AI useContribute to building a decision tree to guide the selection of the best model for a specific type of use casePresent findings and recommendations across different teams at Roche, technical and non-technicalLearning & Growth: Gain hands-on experience in GenAI and LLMs, in particular on the ResponsibleAI/Ethics landscape. Benefit from mentorship and the opportunity to make a real-world impact.Who You AreYou are enrolled or have completed your Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs studies at a university, preferably in fields such as data science, AI/Gen AI, computer science or related areas within the last 12 months and are interested in applying your knowledge in a modern working environment as part of an internship of at least3 months and getting to know the pharmaceutical industry.Furthermore you areWe expect the following requirements:Hands-on experience with GenAI required, additional experience with traditional NLP and classical Machine Learning algorithms preferredAdvanced knowledge of PythonHands-on experience with cloud solutions (AWS and/or Azure)Passion for Ethical AI and Responsible AISome experience with topics related to explainability, fairness and bias, performance assessment, greenAI are valuableHands-on experience with prompt engineeringUnderstanding of GenAI evaluation techniquesStrong background in statisticsFeature engineering & data preprocessing skillsProblem solving: excellent analytical skills and the ability to tackle complex challenges with innovative solutionsCommunication: strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiencesIf you meet most but not all qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.Technical details:The start date for the internship is between 1st and 16th of July 2025More information about the program you can find on go.roche.com/ip2tis_25.Who we areA healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.Roche Kaiseraugst is a cornerstone of Roche's global production and logistics network. It employs some 1900 people out of the 10,700 employees at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site and is Roche's largest and most innovative packaging facility worldwide. Read more.Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Z√ºrich based - Consultant AI/ML
description: About the jobWe are looking for ambitious and passionate AI/ML Consultants to join our our fast-growing Z√ºrich office in developing AI-driven solutions. You will work on building machine learning models, generative AI applications, and automation tools to address key challenges in direct tandem with our clients.About The JobDo you want to be part of an exciting journey where you will get plenty of responsibility and influence? Then you need to read on!Being an AI/ML Consultant at Intellishore, you will get to shape and implement technology as well as business solutions to deliver value at our new Intellishore office in Z√ºrich. You will get the chance to immerse yourself in some of the most exciting technologies while gaining an in-depth understanding of specific business challenges as you engage with clients in close collaboration with your dedicated Intellishore project team.Additionally, by joining Intellishore in Z√ºrich you will get a unique opportunity to influence and shape the development and commercial growth of Intellishore CH in a highly entrepreneurial and flexible setup, while having the backing of a family of over 80 Intellishorians in Denmark.Who is Intellishore?Intellishore is an advanced analytics, AI, and strategy consultancy founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical expertise. Today, we are more than 70 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; data engineering, economics, business, marketing, and data science. Intellishore CH is our new entity in Z√ºrich focused on empowering large multinational and pharmaceutical companies to realize their AI aspirations. We deliver solutions across the value chain - no project is the same, and the energy is high.What are we looking for in an AI/ML Consultant?We are looking for an AI/ML Consultant at the beginning of their career who is curious and eager to develop real-life solutions for interesting clients. Perhaps you have recently completed your education or have a few years of full-time experience in the field of AI and Data Science, possibly from a consultancy.At Intellishore, we are what you might call ‚Äòagnostic,‚Äô meaning we act as an objective technology partner, implementing only tailored and best-fit solutions for our clients. Therefore, you should be open-minded and curious to learn new technologies.Ideally, you match all or most of the following attributes:1+ years of experience in machine learning and AI engineering.Strong Python programming skills.Experience with ML frameworks (XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.).Familiarity with LLMs, vector databases, and RAG techniques.Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).Understanding of data processing techniques and best software engineering practices.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to learn quickly.Effective communication and collaboration skills.Fluency in English - German or French in addition would be a plus.Availability for on-site presence in Z√ºrich.And do not worry about whether you have too much or too little experience. We are always looking for curious and passionate people to join our family, and your title will match your level of seniority and expertise.What will be your key responsibilities?ResponsibilitiesIntellishore is a cross-functional consultancy where you will represent the back-end area in the technical track. Here you will be responsible for (among other things):Develop and implement machine learning and generative AI solutions.Build scalable data pipelines and integrate AI models into production environments.Implement natural language processing (NLP) and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques.Create proof-of-concepts to demonstrate AI capabilities.Collaborate with cross-functional teams on solution design and development.Support client engagements and effectively communicate technical concepts.What can we offer you?1 | Challenging projectsExciting and challenging project roles in strategic & technical AI projects2 | Entrepreneurial work environmentA highly entrepreneurial work environment with ambitious and innovative colleagues focused on rapidly growing the Intellishore CH business3 | InfluenceUnique opportunity for influencing and directing Intellishore CH's market position, commercial growth, and strategic journey4 | Strategic seminarsA yearly strategic seminar where all Intellishorians across locations spend time strategizing and team-building (in previous years, we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany)5 | Sustainable consultingA consulting career with high levels of flexibility allowing for work-life balance6 | Exciting growth journeyWe are on a mission to redefine the world of AI consulting, and we are constantly expanding our reach"At Intellishore, we work with a principle of always choosing the best person for the job - disregarding seniority and titles. In practice, this means that you will have a major influence on what you'll be doing on a day-to-day basis as well as the level of responsibility you will have."Mikkel M√∏ller AndersenManaging Director, Intellishore CHApply nowIf you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the application form. Please make sure to attach a short motivational letter. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants in Switzerland.

title: (Senior) Data Consultant with verification
description: About the jobJoining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you‚Äôre encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It‚Äôs important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can and we believe that everyone brings something different to the table ‚Äì so we‚Äôd love to know what makes you different. Such differences may mean we need to make changes to our process to allow you the best possible platform to succeed, and we are happy to cater to any reasonable adjustments you may require. You will find the section to let us know of these at the bottom of your application form or you can mention it directly to your recruiter at any stage and they will be happy to help.About CapcoCapco is a global technology and management consultancy dedicated to the financial services industry. We combine innovative thinking with unrivalled industry knowledge, to offer our clients consulting expertise, complex technology and package integration, transformation delivery and managed services to move their organizations forward.We specialize primarily in banking & payments, capital markets, wealth & asset management and insuranceWe have a collaborative and efficient approachWe help our clients successfully innovate, increase revenue, manage risk and regulatory change, reduce costs and enhance controlsWe serve our clients from 32 offices across the Americas, Europe, and Asia PacificIf creativity and innovation are your passion, then Capco is right for you. You can grow in an inclusive, diverse and collaborative environment. At Capco, we will train and support you to help accelerate your career.YOUR CAPCO DAYDevelop innovative Data Science solutions and utilize cutting-edge technologies such as Machine Learning and generative AI to align with business objectives and data strategies. Collaborate closely with stakeholders to define data architecture strategies, integrate analytics solutions into enterprise ecosystems, and establish effective data pipelines and workflows. Develop scalable data models and ETL processes, and maintain best practices for data preparation, transformation, and governance. Provide technical leadership in project workflows, integrations, and customizations to meet client-specific requirements. Conduct workshops to gather business and technical needs and translate them into actionable Data Science solutions. YOUR CAPCO-FITSuccessful completion of a degree in a relevant field and extensive experience in data architecture, data modeling, and ETL development. Solid knowledge in data management, machine learning workflows, and data governance concepts. Experience in stakeholder management with the ability to align technical solutions with broader business strategies and objectives. Consulting mindset, showing flexibility to adapt to dynamic client environments, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to develop efficient and scalable data solutions. Excellent communication skills to translate technical concepts into clear, actionable insights. Proficiency in Python, SQL, and other modern technologies is essential. Excellent proficiency in German is required; fluency in French is an advantage for effective collaboration in multilingual environments. Hands-on coding capabilities in data engineering are crucial, with a proven ability to align and collaborate effectively with senior stakeholders on data requirements. WHY CAPCOA career at Capco is a chance to help reshape the competitive landscape in financial services. We launch new banks, transform existing ones, and help our clients navigate complex change. As consultants, we work on the front-end business design all the way through to technology implementation.We are the largest Financial Services focused consultancy in the world, serving everyone from global banks to emerging FinTechs, from strategy through digital transformation, design, business consulting, data and analytics, cyber, cloud, technology architecture, and engineering.Capco is a young and growing firm. We maintain an entrepreneurial spirit and growth mindset, and have minimal bureaucracy. We have no internal silos that get in the way of your career opportunities or ability to focus on our clients and make a difference to the business. We offer the opportunity for everyone to learn rapidly, take on tough challenges, and get promoted quickly. We take pride in our creative, collaborative, diverse, and inclusive culture, where everyone can #BYAW.We offer highly competitive benefits, flexible working hours, technical and soft skills training, smartphone & fast mobile internet and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.Ready to take the Next Step If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. This is an opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a highly successful company with a significant growth trajectory.

title: Senior Data Engineer with verification
description: About the jobWho are we?From your everyday PowerPoint presentations to Hollywood movies, AI will transform the way we create and consume content. Today, people want to watch and listen, not read ‚Äî both at home and at work. If you‚Äôre reading this and nodding, check out our brand video.Despite the clear preference for video, communication and knowledge sharing in the business environment are still dominated by text, largely because high-quality video production remains complex and challenging to scale‚Äîuntil now‚Ä¶.Meet SynthesiaWe're on a mission to make video easy for everyone. Born in an AI lab, our AI video communications platform simplifies the entire video production process ‚Äî making it effortless for anyone, regardless of skill level, to create, collaborate, and share high-quality videos.Whether it‚Äôs delivering essential training to employees, onboarding customers, or marketing products and services, Synthesia helps the world‚Äôs largest organizations communicate through video ‚Äî quickly, easily, and at scale.We‚Äôre trusted by leading brands like Heineken, Zoom, Xerox, and McDonald‚Äôs. See what our customers say and read over 1,200 reviews on G2.In 2023, we were one of 7 European companies to reach unicorn status. In February 2024, G2 named us the fastest-growing software company in the world. In 2025, we announced our Series D. We've now raised over $330M from top-tier investors like NEA, Accel, Kleiner Perkins, Nvidia, and the founders of Stripe, Datadog, Miro, and Webflow.What will you be doing?The Data team powers Synthesia‚Äôs R&D efforts by providing scalable, reliable, and observable data infrastructure for our Applied Research team. The Data team is responsible for all data needs, from ingestion to transformation, to modeling.As a Data Engineer, you‚Äôll take full ownership of pipelines that move and structure massive volumes of non-tabular video, audio, image, and text data across our lakehouse architecture.You‚Äôll work on high-throughput systems that enable internal teams to query and consume data more efficiently, and you‚Äôll help drive the architecture, implementation, and observability of our entire data platform.This is not a traditional data engineering role. It‚Äôs hands-on, hybrid, and high-impact, sitting at the intersection of research, infrastructure, and product. You‚Äôll partner closely with R&D and infra teams, helping ensure that our systems scale with speed, performance, and cost in mind. We‚Äôre looking for someone who starts from the problem, not the tooling and knows how to build data systems around real-world use cases.A few examples of what you might work on:Re-architecting our ingestion pipeline to better support long-form, high-resolution video dataImplementing data tiering and modeling patterns like medallion architecture or dimensional modelingHost and manage open-source tools and frameworksDesigning scalable observability for data quality and pipeline healthSupporting researchers by enabling faster, more targeted data retrieval at training timeWho are you?You're an experienced Data Engineer who loves building robust, reproducible, and scalable data systems and you care deeply about data quality, performance, and usability.You‚Äôll thrive in this role if you have:A track record of owning data pipelines end-to-end - from data sourcing and transformation through to modeling and observabilityExperience designing with data architecture patterns like lambda or kappa, and strong opinions on ETL vs ELTFamiliarity with orchestration patterns (DAG-based, stateless, etc.) and workflow tools (we use Kubeflow and Spark)Strong SQL skills and experience building data models using patterns like dimensional or medallion architectureHands-on experience with columnar formats and open table standards (Delta Lake, Iceberg, Hudi)Proficiency in Python and infrastructure tools like Terraform. Experience hosting open source frameworksBonus points if you have:Experience working in lakehouse environments or hybrid data architecturesExposure to GitOps practices or deploying infra on Kubernetes (we run on k8s but don‚Äôt expect deep k8s experience)Familiarity with the audio/video domain or non-tabular data workflowsMLOps experience, such as model registryMost importantly, you start with the problem & not the tech. You build data systems based on real use cases and are thoughtful about tradeoffs, complexity, and cost.The good stuff...Very competitive compensation (salary + stock options + bonus)Hybrid work setting with an office in London, Amsterdam, Zurich, Munich, or remote in Europe. 25 days of annual leave + public holidaysGreat company culture with the option to join regular planning and socials at our hubsA generous referral scheme Strong opportunities for your career growth+ other benefits depending on your locationYou can see more about who we are and how we work here: https://www.synthesia.io/careers

title: Senior Aeroelasticity Engineer
description: About the jobJoin the Audi F1 Project - Shape the Future of Motorsport!Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026.The new team has three locations. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. The Sauber Motorsport Technical Center, UK will be operational this year. Our Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations.What you need? The mindset of an athlete. If you are someone for whom giving up isn‚Äôt an option and limits are just something to be overcome, you can bring Vorsprung durch Technik to Formula 1 with us. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history.This position for the Audi F1 Project is at Sauber in Hinwil (Switzerland).Your missionContribute to the Aerodynamic Department with a special focus on structural analysis and aeroelasticityLead development projects and activities, ensuring the improvement and reliability of Advanced Engineering (AE) methodologiesCollaborate with Aerodynamics, Design Office, R&D, Composite, Manufacturing and Vehicle Performance teams to integrate AE solutions effectivelyApply interdisciplinary expertise to support the structural and aerodynamic development of car componentsManage and coordinate aeroelastic activities across departments, ensuring seamless integration and progressDrive the development and implementation of solutions to enhance aeroelastic performanceYour profileMSc or PhD in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering or related disciplines, with a focus on FEA/CFDRelevant experience in F1 or high-performance motorsport environments is highly desirableProven experience in managing development projects, supervising teams, and driving innovation.Expertise in race car design, structural FEA, metallic and composite analysis, and aero-elasticity or fluid-structure interactionExperience with FEA and CFD tools, including Optistruct, Abaqus, Hyperworks, MSC Nastran/Patran, ANSYS, OpenFoam, Fluent, Star CCM+ and ParaViewStrong skills in programming (Python, Machine Learning, Linux scripting, Excel and VBA scripting) and mathematical modelingProficiency in CAD tools such as CATIA V6/3DExperience or NX, with knowledge of CATIA GSD and Part Design workbenchesCollaborate with stakeholders, ensure timely updates, and foster a culture of communication, creativity, and continuous learningProficiency in English language skills. German language skills will be an advantage

title: PhD Student in the Research Area of Intelligent Systems with verification
company: University of Applied Sciences and Arts of Southern Switzerland
description: About the jobThe University of Applied Sciences and Arts of Southern Switzerland (SUPSI) has opened a full-time position for a PhD Student in the Research Area of Intelligent Systems: Multi-Agent Systems Based on Large Language Models (LLM), at the Department of Innovative Technologies (DTI) based at the USI-SUPSI university campus in Lugano-Viganello (East Campus), within the Dalle Molle Institute for Artificial Intelligence (IDSIA USI-SUPSI). The contract starts on July 1st, 2025 or date to be agreed.The student will work within the intelligent systems group on topics related to the design and implementation of multi-agent systems based on natural language processing (NLP) and large language models (LLM), applying them to case studies in the field of software development support systemsTasksConduct innovative fundamental research on multi-agent systems.Conduct innovative fundamental research on large language models (LLM).Develop applied research projects in collaboration with industrial partners.Prepare publications for top-tier journals and conferences.RequirementsTechnical background and skillsMaster‚Äôs degree in computer engineering or a related field.Practical experience in artificial intelligence systems.Excellent programming skills with high-level languages (Python).Strong Mathematical skills.Soft SkillsExcellent communication skills in spoken and written English.Ability to work in a team and in a collaborative environment.Autonomy.Preferred QualificationsKnowledge of generative artificial intelligence algorithms.Familiarity with LLMs.Preferably good knowledge of written and spoken Italian.Strong publication record.What we offerA full-time employment contract, initially for two years, with intent of prolongation.Attractive salary, in line with Swiss standards and the candidate's experience.An international working environment.Travel support to participate to high quality conferences and workshops.Opportunity to develop professional and scientific skills.Additional informationFor further information, please contact Sandra Mitrovic. Applicants should submit the following documents, written in English:Curriculum vitae and publications list and Master thesis (draft for graduation in December 2024).Name and e-mail address of two or three reference contacts.Motivation letter, including a brief description of past research experience and future interests (1-2 pages).Applications will be considered only if submitted electronically within May 1st, 2025, through the appropriate form. Applications that are incomplete, submitted to other addresses, or submitted beyond the deadline, will be not accepted.

title: Senior Pricing Actuary (80-100%) with verification
description: About the jobInternationale & dynamische B2B-VersicherungWillkommen bei elipsLife ‚Äì deinem innovativen Versicherer f√ºr Unternehmen im B2B-Umfeld. Als fester Bestandteil der Personalvorsorgel√∂sungen der Division Swiss Life International sind wir spezialisiert auf Krankentaggeld- und Unfallversicherungen. title: Analyst Cloud Data & AI (all genders) with verification
description: About the jobEffective FieldAs an Analyst in Cloud Data & AI, you are part of an innovative team in Zurich that is shaping the future of cloud solutions and AI technologies.You support the development and implementation of tailored Data & AI solutions that help our clients optimize their processes and gain new insights.Your creative ideas are in demand when it comes to transforming complex data into clear, action-oriented insights.You work with modern cloud environments, such as AWS and Azure, and have the opportunity to participate in exciting projects that deepen your knowledge.With your assistance in data visualization, we enable our clients to understand the stories behind their data.What distinguishes youYou are passionate about the world of technology and hold a University degree in computer science, business informatics, or a similar field.With profound experience in programming, preferably in Python or Java, as well as knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS, you make the difference.You are curious about AI solutions, enjoy developing innovative software, and have a high affinity for IT.Your structured and careful approach to designing solutions sets you apart.Your strong team spirit and trustworthy personality make you a valued team member.You speak fluent English.What you can expectYou will become part of a community that values appreciation and support, and looks forward to shaping your path together.Our modern valantic office in Zurich offers a comfortable atmosphere with lots of fun.An environment where you can bring your own ideas and experience growth.Flexible working hours and the possibility for home office, which allow you to optimally combine your practical experience with your career.Insights into leading digital cloud & AI projects that expand your expertise and promote your development.Diverse opportunities for networking and collaboration with experienced colleagues and mentors who share your passion for technology.

Very good database knowledge including data modelling and SQL (DML and DDL)5. title: Data Analyst (HSE-OHS-IB-2025-65-GRAE) with verification
description: About the jobJob DescriptionYour responsibilitiesWithin the HSE Unit, we have the QARE Service. Quality and Aging Research for Cable (QARE) service is a quality control service for cables and a research program on cable ageing assessment at CERN accelerators. The activity involves the development of the most appropriate cable testing techniques to perform quality control on cable procured for CERN, and establish aging requirements on cables operating in the CERN accelerators environment.The QARE Service is seeking a skilled data analyst proficient in advanced statistical methods, big data analysis, and data analytics, with a solid understanding of quality control procedures. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in developing, enhancing, and maintaining the QARE database, dedicated to gathering comprehensive cable lifecycle information. This information includes data from manufacturers' technical data sheets, cables samples tests before and after aging, and condition monitoring in CERN facilities.The activities in this job are:Working closely with the QARE team to monitor, analyse, and validate testing data collected from various cable sample tests and condition monitoring in radiation areas.Establishing and maintain quality control protocols for cable testing procedures, ensuring data accuracy, reliability, and consistency.Developing and implement statistical quality control methods to identify anomalies, deviations, or trends in test results.Contributing to the design and optimization of test methodologies, ensuring they meet international quality standards and best practices.Collaborating with the QARE materials engineers to provide data-driven insights that enhance the reliability and performance of cable testing procedures.Producing data correlations based on results obtained from various cable tests conducted by the QARE materials engineers.Supporting assessments related to quality control, ensuring compliance with CERN regulations and international applicable standards.Your profileSkillsProven experience in database development and management.Proficiency in advanced statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.Familiarity with quality control procedures, especially in a technical and scientific contexts.Strong programming skills, including proficiency in languages such as Python.Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team environment.Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information effectively.Spoken and written English, with a commitment to learn French.Eligibility criteria:You are a national of a CERN Member or Associate Member State.By the application deadline, you have a maximum of two years of professional experience since graduation in Data Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science (or a related field) and your highest educational qualification is either a Bachelor's or Master's degree.You have never had a CERN fellow or graduate contract before.Applicants without University degree are not eligible.Applicants with a PhD are not eligible.Additional InformationJob closing date: 22.04.2025 at 23:59 CEST.Contract duration: 24 months, with a possible extension up to 36 months maximum.Working hours: 40 hours per weekTarget start date: 01-June-2025Job reference: HSE-OHS-IB-2025-65-GRAEField of work: Data Science & Data AnalyticsWhat we offerA monthly stipend ranging between 5196 and 5716 Swiss Francs (net of tax).Coverage by CERN's comprehensive health scheme (for yourself, your spouse and children), and membership of the CERN Pension Fund.Depending on your individual circumstances: installation grant; family, child and infant allowances; payment of travel expenses at the beginning and end of contract.30 days of paid leave per year.On-the-job and formal training at CERN as well as in-house language courses for English and/or French.About usAt CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern. Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.

title: Senior System Engineer for UWB (f/m/div) with verification
description: About the jobJoin our team of innovators at our R&D center in Zurich, where we're pushing the boundaries of Ultra-wideband (UWB) technology to enable secure, accurate, and reliable distance measurement for a wide range of applications. As a Senior System Engineer, you'll have the opportunity to drive the development of next-generation UWB solutions, collaborating with a talented team of experts to shape the future of this exciting technology.With this position you will be entering our ‚Äûtechnical ladder‚Äù: our career path for experts. You will be able to focus deeply on technology ‚Äì while further pursuing your career. As you continually expand your expert knowledge, puzzle over matters and solve problems, you will position yourself as a thought leader ‚Äì thus helping our products improve our world a bit more each day.In your new role you will:Develop algorithms for the UWB radios considering the implementation complexity aspectsCollaborate with digital and analog designers on digital and mixed-signal requirements‚Äô specifications for UWB baseband and analog featuresDerive clear specifications for analog and digital blocks to be implemented on chipEvaluate performance trade-offs and propose innovative improvements to existing UWB featuresLead in an independent manner sub-projects of various UWB IP algorithm development comprehensively and ensure a smooth work processProactively drive the improvement of existing IPs and working flowsContribute to the team‚Äôs growth by helping others in a day-to-day basisYou create a work environment for the highest quality standards. At the same time, you ensure that your ideas come to their full potential and implementation. You commit yourself to the results of your own team and the company as a whole. Last but not least, you are able to cooperate across borders while valuing the contributions of others.You are best equipped for this task if you have:A Master's or PhD degree technical degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or comparable. PhD in a related field is a plusAt least 5 years of professional or academic experience in the field of Digital Signal Processing or Communication SystemsStrong design skills in RF transceiver modelling / Matlab / Python / SystemCExperience with signal processing and algorithm development, ideally for wireless communications or machine learningAbility to write pseudocode of algorithms to be used by other teams involved in IC designExperience in Pulsed Time Radars is a plusDigital Design experience is also welcomeProficient verbal and written communication in English, precise and clear documenting methodologyIn addition, you: have high degree of own initiative and interest for interdisciplinary work have strong interest in growing your expertise in digital wireless systems and implementation approach problems with curiosity and flexibility, are a good listener, fast learner and take responsibilityPlease send us your CV in English.Contact:In√™s Santos, LinkedIn#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.Are you in?‚Äì At our R&D center in Zurich we develop next generation UWB solutions ‚ÄìUltra-wideband (UWB) is emerging as preferred chip technology for secure, centimeter accurate and reliable distance measurement for numerous applications across including car access, door access in residential and hospitality, tap-free mobile payments and real-time localization systems (RTLS), among many others. In addition, new UWB standards are being developed such as IEEE 802.15.4ab bringing UWB technology into new domains for child safety and lossless audio streaming.We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

title: Research Intern for Deep Generative Modeling with verification

We are actively recruiting skilled research scientists or engineers with a robust engineering background to contribute to our endeavors. Ideal candidates possess diverse experience in large-scale or cross-modalities (computer vision, NLP, audio, videos etc.) implementations. This Tokyo-based position operates in an English-speaking environment.Learn More About Sony AI Herewww.linkedin.com/company/sonyai/lifehttps://ai.sonyRoles And ResponsibilitiesAs a Research Intern, you will conduct novel and advanced research with internal members. We focus on achieving healthy work-life balance for our teams, supported by hybrid and flexible working.You will work on exciting projects at the cutting edge of AI that are in the realms of entertainment or for the betterment of society, and you will have access to the most innovative technologies from across the Sony universe and the opportunity to partner with Sony‚Äôs leading companies.When projects are finished, we publish our work, and all our contributors are recognised on research pieces, at top-tier conferences, and in journals. You will also have access to workshops and development programs to expand your knowledge and skills. We want you to drive your career, find your direction and take authorship of your personal story at Sony AI, while enjoying the security and the resource-rich environment that comes with being part of a global corporation that has R&D in its DNA.Bring Your Uniqueness To SonyWe are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, or any other protected characteristics.Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony EuropeSony Europe will provide reasonable accommodation for any qualified individuals with disabilities in the application process. When contacting us please indicate the position you are applying for, and the accommodation required.

title: Machine Learning Evangelist @AI Startup
description: About the jobLightly AG is an official ETH and HSG Spin-off in the field of machine learning and computer vision. Its products are used by leading companies in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection to curate visual machine learning data.Lightly consists of a small team of talented developers, researchers, and business developers in Zurich, who all have a massive impact on the business and product. The company is backed by Y-Combinator, Wingman Ventures, and Soma Capital.TasksAt Lightly, our mission is to drive the democratization of artificial intelligence through open-source innovation. Our flagship repository, Lightly, is the leading framework for training self-supervised and foundation models. We believe in a community-driven approach to AI advancement and strive to empower developers and organizations with the tools they need to create transformative AI solutions. Our open-source commitment is central to this mission, fostering collaboration and innovation within the global AI community. As a Machine Learning Evangelist at Lightly, you will be a key player in our mission to build and nurture a vibrant open-source community. You will engage directly with developers, data scientists, and AI enthusiasts to promote Lightly, create compelling technical content, and contribute to the ongoing development of our platformResponsibilities:Community Engagement (20% of time)Actively participate in community forums, including GitHub, Stack Overflow, and Slack/Discord channels, addressing questions and fostering discussions.Organize and host virtual meetups, webinars, and other community events to engage and grow our user base.Develop and manage community programs, such as ambassador or advocate initiatives, to encourage community involvement and contribution.Content Creation (40% of time)Generate high-quality technical content, including blog posts, tutorials, screencasts, and conference talks that educate and inspire our community.Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to produce content that highlights new features, use cases, and best practices.Product Contribution (40% of time)Contribute to the development of Lightly, particularly in areas related to community feedback and user experience improvements.Assist in the creation of product documentation and guides to ensure ease of use for new and existing users.RequirementsWho we are looking for:Professional experience in machine learning or data science (2+ years preferred).Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.Experience with open-source projects, either as a maintainer or active contributor.Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to create engaging technical content.Passion for building and nurturing community relationships and fostering a collaborative environment.Nice to Have:Experience with computer vision applications.Prior experience in a developer advocacy or technical marketing role.Familiarity with collaborative development tools (e.g., GitHub, Slack).Important: We believe in people who are driven by curiosity and are willing to learn and take the next step. Please also reach out if you don't exactly "check all these boxes".BenefitsCompetitive salary, depending on experience.Equity options to share in the success of our company.Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly work environment.Comprehensive benefits package, including financial support for sports/health, mobility, and education.Opportunities for professional growth and development in an innovative and supportive team.Optional: Office in the heart of Zurich next to the central station with SnacksCompany events, retreats, and offsitesIf you're passionate about AI and open source, and you thrive in a community-centric environment, we'd love to hear from you!Apply Now: Please include your resume, a cover letter, and links to any relevant projects or content you've created.

title: R&D Engineer Structural Mechanics (m/f/d) (80-100%) with verification
description: About the jobAccelleron is accelerating sustainability in the marine and energy industries as a global technology leader in turbocharging, fuel injection, and digital solutions for heavy-duty applications. Building on a heritage of over 100 years as a trusted industry partner, the company serves customers in more than 100 locations in over 50 countries. Accelleron‚Äôs 3,000 employees are continuously innovating to deliver best-in-class products, services, and solutions that are mission-critical for the energy transition. You will join a team of experts in an exciting international environment, committed to excellence and innovation. Together, we support our customers in driving the transition toward sustainable industries with cutting-edge technology, deep expertise, and smart solutions. At Accelleron, we foster diversity and inclusion, welcoming and celebrating individual differences as a source of strength.Our Turbocharger Core Components department is seeking a highly educated and innovative engineer to join our structural mechanics team. In collaboration with R&D and testing engineers, you will be responsible for performing structural mechanics calculations for the design of new turbochargers and turbocharger components. Furthermore, you will engage in advanced simulation technologies and processes to support development teams. If you possess expertise in finite element analysis (FEA) and are open to pioneering ideas, we are eager to meet you.You tasks and responsibilities:Utilize FEA tools to conduct comprehensive numerical analyses in the areas of mechanical integrity and lifetime prediction, with an emphasis on thermomechanical fatigueAnalysis and numerical evaluation of bolted connectionsDevelop, implement, and maintain structural mechanics methods to improve lifetime predictionIntegrate field data into structural mechanical evaluationsManage development initiatives that include fundamental researchContribute to development projects related to turbochargersProvide support for design variations until they are technically ready for productionCollaborate extensively with engineering, design, and testing teamsYour background:Master's degree in mechanical engineering or equivalentProficiency in FEA tools (ABAQUS/SIMULIA/3DExperience), particularly within the field of turbomachineryFamiliarity with CAD in 3DExperience is beneficialSolid background in structural mechanics and finite element analysis (FEA)Experience in thermomechanical fatigue and material modelingUnderstanding of thermodynamics and expertise in scripting or programming is beneficialResponsible personality with the ability for self-reflectionAbility to effectively persuade and communicate intricate technical mattersInterest in improving products using simulationsProficiency in business English and GermanYour benefits:CanteenChildcareModern office, smart workingFlexible working modelAttractive holiday planRemote work policyEmployee assistance programPlease apply with your CV and Cover Letter.We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about Accelleron, take another look at our website accelleron-industries.com.Accelleron Data Privacy Statement: accelleron-industries.com/privacy-notice/candidate

title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Supply Chain
description: About the jobIntroductionUnilabs is the largest provider of medical laboratory diagnostics for prescribers and hospitals in Switzerland and employs around 800 people.Your TasksWe are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain team to support our company transformation project. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing supply chain data, identifying trends, and providing insights to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and optimize processes. The Data Analyst will collaborate closely with other departments to drive data-informed decision-making.Key responsibilitiesData Collection & Management: Gather, clean, and manage large datasets from various sources, including internal ERP systems and external suppliers. Data Analysis: Perform in-depth analysis to identify trends, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies in supply chain processes such as inventory management, lead times, supplier performance, and transportation. Reporting & Visualization: Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders. Utilize tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar software. Forecasting & Modeling: Support inventory optimization, and capacity planning using statistical models and data analysis techniques. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and alignment with supply chain goals. Process Improvement: Provide actionable insights to improve supply chain performance, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction through data-driven strategies. Key Performance Indicators & Metrics: Track and analyze supply chain KPIs. Ad Hoc Analysis: Conduct special projects and analyses as needed to support strategic initiatives in the supply chain function. Your ProfileExperience: minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within supply chain, logistics, or manufacturing industries. Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in supply chain management, Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related field. Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent. Experience with database management and querying (e.g., SQL) is an advantage. Experience with ERP migration is an advantage. Knowledge of supply chain management systems (ERP, WMS) is a plus. Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights. Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders. Attention to Detail: High degree of accuracy and attention to detail when working with complex datasets. Languages: Advanced command of English. and French or German

title: PhD Position in Decentralized Resource-Constrained Machine Learning
company: Department of Mechanical and Process Engineering (D-MAVT) ETH Zurich
skills: ['Artificial Intelligence (AI)'; 'Data Science'; 'English'; 'Machine Learning'; 'Pattern Recognition'; 'Computer Science'; 'Deep Learning'; 'Digital Currency'; 'Mathematics'; 'Research Skills']
description: About the job100%, Zurich, fixed-termprint DruckenThe Distributed Computing (DISCO) Group is a research group at ETH Zurich, led by Prof. Dr. Roger Wattenhofer. We are interested in a variety of research topics on new and upcoming areas off the beaten paths. Our three main areas of research are machine learning, distributed systems, and theory of networks. Within these three areas, we are currently working on several projects: graph neural networks, natural language processing, algorithmic learning, fault-tolerance, blockchains, consensus, cryptocurrencies, digital money, central bank digital currency, decentralized finance, financial networks, e-democracy, voting, social networks, online analysis with delay, and theory of distributed algorithms. In our group, we work on both theory and practice: some members of our group focus on algorithms and mathematical proofs, and some on system design and building.Job DescriptionThe Distributed Computing group at ETH Zurich is looking for a PhD candidate to work on the SNSF Ambizione 2023 project ‚ÄúeDIAMOND: Efficient Distributed Intelligent Applications in Mobile-Network Dynamics‚Äù, starting on 1 September 2025. The eDIAMOND project aims at developing new methods and systems for decentralized and distributed data-driven methods for Federated Learning on resource-constrained networks. Your research within the project will contribute towards your doctoral degree at ETH Zurich. You will be supervised by Prof. Dr. Roger Wattenhofer and Dr. Antonio Di Maio.You Will Be Entrusted With Designing, Developing, And Evaluating Data-driven Methods, Algorithms, And Systems For Three Independent But Related Research Directions In The EDIAMOND Project, NamelyDistributing model training and inference over a network of resource-constrained devices.Online, context-aware adaptation of Federated Neural Network Architectures based on the available system resources (e.g., communication, computation, energy).Communication-efficient knowledge exchange among networked federated large models.These research directions allow you to gradually build your own research profile according to your interests, while remaining within the project‚Äôs goals. Each research direction is composed of a sequence of Tasks that will collectively achieve the project‚Äôs goal. For each Task, you will be responsible for the typical scientific research workflow: motivating the problem, identifying the main methodological shortcomings in the literature, design and develop novel systems, plan and execute experiments, and report findings in articles to be published at top venues according to the project‚Äôs schedule. Periodic meetings and feedback will ensure the success of your degree and of the project overall.Other infoUpdated InformationDetails on Terms of EmploymentThe PhD Survival Guide from ETH ZurichAll about the doctorate at ETH ZurichProfileWe are looking for a new member with the following profile:A strong interest and motivation to contribute to the eDIAMOND project‚Äôs goals (see Job description section above).Theoretical and practical experience and passion in at least one of the following topics:Machine Learning: Deep Learning, Federated Learning (vertical, horizontal), Split Learning, Model Selection, Knowledge Distillation, Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA), Large Models (Language, Vision).Decentralized and Distributed Systems: Gossip Protocols, Consensus Algorithms, (Byzantine) Fault Tolerance, Peer-to-Peer Networks.Online Algorithms: Partially-Observable Markov Decision Processes (POMDPs), Cooperative and Competitive Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL), Multi-armed Bandits, Bayesian Optimization.Automated Model Design and Tuning: Neural Architecture Search, Hyperparameter Optimization.Computer Networking: Resource-Constrained Networking (e.g., Internet of Things), Wireless and Mobile Communications (e.g. IEEE 802.11, Bluetooth, etc.), Protocols (e.g., MAC, Network, and Transport).Mathematics: Statistical Learning, Stochastic Processes (e.g., Percolation Theory, Queuing Theory, Age of Information), Network Calculus, Graph Theory, Convex and Non-convex Optimization, Approximation Algorithms.An excellent Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or other fields related to the project‚Äôs domain, from a reputable university, to be obtained before 1 September 2025 (depending on visa requirements).A strong Transcript of Records, stating the list of passed exams (particularly those related to the project and the areas above) and their grades.Strong programming skills (i.e., Python and main Machine Learning frameworks such as Pytorch).Experience with scientific writing (e.g., reports, theses, and scientific articles).Strong critical thinking, English communication skills (oral and written), interpersonal abilities, collaboration aptitude.Bonus PointsPublished peer-reviewed articles on project-related topics in reputable conferences or journalsExperience with network simulators such as OMNeT++ or ns-3Experience with High Performance Computing (i.e., SLURM)Experience with GitWorkplaceWorkplaceWe offerYour career with impact: Become part of ETH Zurich, which not only supports your professional development, but also actively contributes to positive change in society.We are actively committed to a sustainable and climate-neutral university.You can expect numerous benefits, such as public transport season tickets and car sharing, a wide range of sports offered by the ASVZ, childcare and attractive pension benefits.chevron_right Working, teaching and research at ETH ZurichWe value diversityIn line with our values, ETH Zurich encourages an inclusive culture. We promote equality of opportunity, value diversity and nurture a working and learning environment in which the rights and dignity of all our staff and students are respected. Visit our Equal Opportunities and Diversity website to find out how we ensure a fair and open environment that allows everyone to grow and flourish.Curious? So are we.We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents:A short letter of motivationA CVThe Transcripts of Records for both Bachelor and Master degrees, containing the list of courses taken and grades achievedNames and email addresses of three people who could provide a recommendation/reference letterAdditional relevant documents: diplomas, certificates, theses, project reports, or published articlesThe provided documents and certificates will be checked for authenticity.The Letter Of Motivation‚Äôs Purpose Is To Assess Your Interest And Motivation In Pursuing Research In The Field Of Decentralized Resource-constrained Machine Learning, And The Match With The EDIAMOND Project‚Äôs Goals. For Example, You Can MentionYour achievements and awards (e.g., participation to coding competitions, olympiads in math or computer science, etc.) and how they can benefit eDIAMOND.The strengths of your best scientific projects (e.g., thesis, report, article) and their relevance to eDIAMOND.New ideas on how to carry out research and design novel methods to specifically achieve the eDIAMOND goals (see Job description section).How to extend our previous works (see publications by DISCO and Dr. Di Maio) towards the eDIAMOND‚Äôs goals.The subjects in which you have achieved excellent grades and how they are relevant to the project.Anything else that you believe is worth knowing about you and that will be essential for the project‚Äôs success.Questions regarding the position (not applications) should be directed to Dr. Antonio Di Maio (adimaio@ethz.ch).For further information about the hosting group please visit the website DISCO.Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our ETH Job Portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered.About ETH Z√ºrichETH Zurich is one of the world‚Äôs leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow.
